Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great for those flying into Beauvais Airport”
Reviews.Author: hmm_messiah
Reviews.Content: I picked this as 2nd hotel on a trip in Dec 2010 , I chose it as near to the Bus Park to get back to Beavais Airport. But it was a lovely looking street, nice hotel. tiny lift (one of those funny stories of it not moving with us both in it!!). The man at reception was very nice. We did not try breakfast as our flight was so early, but the hotel was very clean and tidy. The bedroom was small, but great bed, and massive clean bathroom. They also emailed a few times with updates on renovation work they are doing recently - which I kind of liked. Would i use again? If the price was alright it would be my FIRST choice. It's not exactly central, and you would have to walk to a metro etc but .. it's Paris, walking is a joy .

Reviews.Title: “FRIENDLY STAFF”
Reviews.Author: nancy7711
Reviews.Content: If you love a bath, then you MUST have a bathtub, right? A shower just will not do! I think I spend my life searching for hotels with bathtubs. Long story short, this small hotel have some rooms with bathtubs, but you must ask for them in advance. We had a lovely room with a small balcony. Breakfast room is tiny, but still lovely. The staff is extremely friendly and will make you feel right at home. It was a bit too far out for us; we probably will choose a hotel closer to Notre Dame in the future, but for many people, the quietness of this area would be perfect. There were several small shops within walking distance and an Italian Restaurant that we ate in several evenings. But, it IS quite a distance from much of anything. Probably good for a couple that has visited Paris several times and just wants a quiet neighborhood. We were there for Christmas and we will definitely return to Paris during the holidays again as everything was OPEN!!! They tend to close on Christmas Eve and remain open on Christmas Day. The little huts along the Champs Elysees were fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Our home in Paris:)”
Reviews.Author: tomas r
Reviews.Content: It was a beautiful hotel with wonderful service. Beautiful area:)

Reviews.Title: “amazing stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: jv282
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel largely because of the reviews on tripadvisor, and it did not disappoint in the least. Adorable little hotel a short walk from the Arc De Triomphe and Avenue des Champs Elysées. Great little residential neighborhood that isn't inundated with tourists. The room was very comfortable and clean (but note that you're not going to get a huge American-size room with a giant bathroom at a boutique hotel in Paris). The pastries in the breakfast that was included were absolutely amazing. Overall I felt like this hotel was a good value for the price, location, and quality. I would absolutely stay here again and would highly recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “If only all cities had a hotel like this.”
Reviews.Author: CoupontheKitty
Reviews.Content: About a 10 minute walk to the Metro and around the corner from Quebec House, this charming little hotel had overly friendly staff and a great breakfast. Our room was cozy but had an enormous bathroom. And everything was so tidy. It's not really steps away from anything but that's its charm. When your night is over, simply take a taxi back and enjoy a quiet night's sleep (but don't ask the taxi driver if he knows where it is. He will get mad. Let him find it on his iphone map. It will make the ride less rude). The best attraction to the hotel is the old-fashion small elevator! If we ever go back to Paris, we'd try to stay at the Hotel Residence Foch.

Reviews.Title: “Useful Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DDonSco
Reviews.Content: Air France coach service gets quite close to this family-run hotel. Very friendly and helpful staff. Good location near the metro with some busy streets nearby - but the hotel is in an attractive old building in a quiet street. Buffet breakfast was really special but more eating than we needed before walking in streets museums etc. The hotel suggested a Cafe Bakery within easy walking distance and we really liked everything about that! Older buildings often mean narrow stairs, smaller rooms and less sophisticated facilities. We like the character of that but if you want slick modernity you will be choosing a five star and paying their prices. This hotel had a very good small place feel. we will be back...

Reviews.Title: “Small room but nice and convenient”
Reviews.Author: MissHo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Residence Foch on Oct 31 for one night, and my impression of the hotel is it is nice, but pretty average. The room is quite small so it would be a bit crowded for two people. But other than that, the place is clean and tidy, and its friendly staff and free wi-fi certainly wouldn't hurt. The hotel is in a nice and quiet neighborhood where the Holland Embasssy is also located on the same street. The metro station is not far (about 10 minutes walk), and near the metro there are several restaurants and bakeries. It may not be your most memorable hotel experience but it is priced correctly (I paid 95 euro for one person, one night). As a mid-range hotel in a convenient neighborhood, it is a nice choice.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie G
Reviews.Content: We loved our three night stay at the Residence Foch, it was so quaint and charming. The residential area was quiet and also had two metro stations within a two block walk. The staff was so friendly and helpful, especially Isabella and Emma. A short walk brought us to an adorable bakery and several very nice restaurants. We were told that the hotel will close in November for a complete renovation - I am sure they will keep the charm intact! If we ever get back to Paris, I am sure it will be back to that lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brutally small hotel room, bathroom floods when showering”
Reviews.Author: badsaltydog
Reviews.Content: I based my decision to stay at this hotel on TripAdvisor reviews. Unfortunately it was a really bad decision. I stayed with my girlfriend for 5 nights. The room was so small, there was only one spot to put up 1 suitcase in the room. I had to keep my suitcase beside my bed near the window. The closet was approximately 3 feet wide with shelves. The closet was just inside the door to the room. There was no light, so it was impossible to see what I had put in the closet without taking it to the window. The closet had a strange smell as well. There was a desk at the foot of both beds, if my friend was on the computer, I had to climb across both beds to get to the bathroom. I chose to have the bed nearest the window so my friend would have easy access to the bathroom. When showering, the bathroom floor would flood, it did not matter how we each turned that shower head the floor flooded. The hotel is due for a major renovation starting at the end of November. Of course the prices will increase after the renovation, but the room size will not change. I have to be perfectly honest, I could not stay there again nor can I recommend this hotel. Yes, the hotel staff is excellent, but that does not make up for other deficiencies with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, tidy hotel with wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Pholt73
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for eight nights. We were thrilled with the friendly, helpful staff, especially Emma and Isabelle. The staff helped us with our travel plans, and saved us a lot of heartache when they advised us against going to Versailles during a strike. The hotel is charming and very clean. Rooms are small, but that is to be expected in Europe. There are many good restaurants nearby, and there are two metro stops very close to the hotel. Breakfast was also very good and reasonably priced. We loved Paris and will definitely be visiting this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Not a Bad Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Surveyor8785
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. The room size was large considering it is in Paris. The hotel is located nicely with a bus stop and metro nearby. It is also in close proximity to fine restaurants and shopping. We particularly enjoyed sitting on balcony in the evenings. We do, however, have two complaints. First, the room we were given is located so that the occupant must traverse three flights of stairs in order to reach the door. Second, this room had no proper shower. It has a detachable shower nozzle located near the faucet, but there is no curtain or nozzle located where a person could stand and shower. The hotel photos show rooms with showers, however, ours did not have one. This was above all, the biggest inconvenience of any hotel on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Hotel Residence Foch”
Reviews.Author: gena_11
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Hotel Residence Foch. The hotel was clean and accomodating. We stayed in two different rooms when we were there. The twin room was very small, although the bathroom was large. The double room was a little larger, although it was small also. All of the staff was helpful and friendly. The hotel's location was excellent as it was only about a 10 minute walk to the metro and restaurants and about a 20 minute walk to Avenue Des Champs D'Elysee. It was in a very safe area and we were able to walk on the street late at night without any fear of safety. The breakfast was excellent. It was buffet style which was great because we were able to eat as soon as we sat down and we could leave right after we had finished eating as we didn't have to wait for a bill. There was a good variety of food including poached eggs, rolls, cereal, yogurt, fresh fruit, meat, cheese, juice, coffee, etc. None of the cafes or restaurants nearby could compare to their breakfast. Finding the hotel was difficult at first. If you arrive by the Air France bus from CDG, after descending from the bus, turn left. Look for a tall building with the name Technip at the top. Cross the streets to the building. When you are standing in front of the building, look to the right and cross the street to walk on the street that goes along the side of a restaurant called L'Auberge Dab. That street is called Blvd. de L'Admiral Bruix. The second street to the left is rue Marbeau. Turn left at that street and voila the hotel will be toward the end of the street on the left. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly situated”
Reviews.Author: FrancesPasha
Reviews.Content: Having relied heavily on a personal recommendation and Tripadvisor reviews my friends and I were extremely pleased with this hotel. Initially we thought it might be too far from the main tourist spots but in fact it was perfectly situated. Within easy walking distance of the Arc de Triomphe (definitely worth going "up top" to watch the traffic) and the Eiffel Tower (book in advance to avoid the queues) it was also extremely well placed between two Metro stations which take you to most of the main tourist areas. There are plenty of restaurants close by - often serving fixed price breakfasts (cheaper than the hotel) and dinners - as well as bakers and general stores. The area is quiet and not touristy. Yes, the rooms are small but they are spotless and the towels and sheets are changed daily. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: jpjFredrikstad
Reviews.Content: This hotel suited us perfect. It was excellent for our family of 4 - two teenagers and parents. We had a lovely stay and we will be back for sure. We got a big family room, consisting of two rooms - one with a sofabed and an extra bed, and the other with a double bed. The bathroom was large and everything was spotlessly clean. The room also had a fridge/minibar, flatscreen TV, air con and coffee/the boiler. The hotel has a homely feel to it, but It isn't fancy. The decor is dated and looks a little bit like "back to the -80's", but the manager told us that the hotel will go through a total renovation from november 2011 - march 2012 (they will close the hotel), and I guess it then will be back to better shape than before. We loved it though, nice comfy beds and all that you really need for a good and pleasant City break. The best asset is the hotel staff - so friendly, helpfull and allways with a smile. They did every thing to make us feel welcome. The hotel is perfectly situated in a quiet, nice and posh residential area close to Porte Maillot (Metro line 1 and the bus station for Beauvais airport at the Congress center) and Porte Duphine (metro line 2) which is just 5-10 min walk away. The only negativ is the price of the breakfast - 13 EUR per person is way to expensive for what you get. But that is not really a problem since you easily can buy your own breakfast at the supermarket and eat it in your room or visit one of the many cafes in the eara for a "petit dejeuner". Close to the hotel at rue Malakoff you have a supermarket, a bakery/boulangerie, ATM, several cafes. At rue Pergolese you also have two exclusive restaurants, one with a Star Micheline. This is a perfect place to stay when you are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: John W
Reviews.Content: I have reviewed this hotel before, but that was 3 years ago, and I am delighted to say that the hotel continues to live up to the expectations I had of it. The staff are friendly, often have great suggestions for places to shop or dine, have sample menus available for you to review before going. Wi-Fi in the rooms is a big plus and it is free. It is just far enough off the beaten path to be quiet and close enough that you don't have to call a taxi to get anywhere. The Metro is 5 minutes away, Shopping, laundry, and a wonderful market are all within that distance as well. I plan to return to this hotel every time I get the chance to return to Paris. I have no need to look for any other hotel. Nelly and company are the best!

Reviews.Title: “Homey Friendly Place in the 16th Arrondisement”
Reviews.Author: sedoyle
Reviews.Content: From the website, i expected a much more elegant place than the Hotel Residence Foch is at its heart. It is a place with tidy tiny rooms with a truly French sensibility, including the traditional small elevator. it isn't overdesigned but classically decorated and comfortable. I got a room with a balcony and it was so small that we had trouble opening the french doors when the suitcases were open, but the bed was comfy and the shower strong. And when I sat on the tiny balcony with a basket of red geraniums and had brie, french bread and a bottle of red wine, I felt completely at home on the top floors of misty Paris with the Tour Eiffel looming over the houses down the street.. The manager had a painting of the view from my room over his desk, donated by a grateful artist. We never could figure out the internet, and I wouldn't bother with the Breakfast. There's a great little pastry and lunch place down the Rue Pergolese, on the corner of Rue Malakov, as well as a multitude of restaurants in an around Rue Malakoff. And for a real treat, try the 1 star Michelin restaurant . La Pergolese, on Rue Pergolese. On your way back, stop at the extraordinary cheese shop. There's a great supermarket with all kinds of cool French edibles but not much of tourist interest, just a nice residential neighborhood. You are ten minutes from three different subways and twenty minutes by subway from Notre Dame.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TMN619
Reviews.Content: The entire staff is friendly and helpful. Their primary goal is first rate customer service. Location is great; 5 minute walk to subway, 10 to Arc d' Triomphe, 20-25 to Tour Eiffel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay while in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: James J
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived in Paris my main concern was finding our hotel. The instructions were easy to follow and we were able to find the Hotel Foch without any difficulty. We had not been to Paris in 40 years.The excellent treatment continued through check-in and while we were escorted to our room. The room was spotlessly clean and charming. The bed was excellent as well. The breakfast was a good value and there were plenty of choices to eat. It was a short walk from mass transit to go where ever you wanted to go, but was close enough to walk to many areas. It made Paris an most enjoyable place to visit. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to pretend you live in a Parisian Apartment...”
Reviews.Author: Dragonlady15
Reviews.Content: I have been to Paris numerous times, so I'm over needing to be right by the Louvre, or the Opera. Not that I don't like those places, but this was a refreshing change, and for the first time I stayed in a non-touristy residential area. I was a tad nervous when I first saw the hotel as the lobby and stairs look a little worn down. The room, as other reviewers noted, are small and unimpressive. BUT, I will state here, as I have in other hotel reviews of Paris - you will just not get a lot of space in this city! It is simply an expensive city, with limited space. As a new yorker, I have become used to this. If you want to stay in Paris for under $400, or you don't want to stay at a large chain hotel, you will simply have to deal with the lack of space that comes with a high price tag. You shouldn't expect your money to buy you in Paris the same stuff it buys you in say, Ohio.if you can get over the space issues, you will grow to love this place. The staff is incredibly nice- very refreshing when you've been running around the frantic city all day. You can easily walk to a few metro stops. And my favorite thing- I could walk to a local cheese shop, meet shop, bakery, and wine store, and have a nice snack of bread, cheese and meats in my room! Now THAT is the real Paris! And- if you want- you can walk to the Champs Elysees. I am so over that touristy place though!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant environment, great customer service”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoTraveller30
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is pleasant, nicely appointed, and comfortable. It has a small, but nice lounge, an attractive breakfast room, and the room in which we stayed (the Family room), was large, clean, functional and comfortable. The hotel really excelled with their service. The manager who greeted us at check in was very nice and extremely helpful, and the manager the next morning was equally accommodating. Although we only stayed one night, the hotel allowed us to store a large piece of luggage with them until our return. The complimentary breakfast was quite nice and had a good selection. The hotel is located in a nice area a few blocks from the Porte Maillot Metro station. There were a multitude of excellent restaurants within walking distance. Although not in the center of Paris, the hotel is quite near the Arc de Triomphe and the Grands Boulevards area, and it’s on the perfect Metro and RER lines to access the major sites. Porte Maillot is served by line 1 - La Defense/Chateau de Vincennes - which takes you directly to the Arc de Triomphe, Tullerie gardens, and the Louvre. From the Neuilly-Porte Maillot station you can access RER line C, which will take you across the river to Tour Eiffel, Invalides, Musee d’Orsay, and Notre Dame. Take the RER C train in the other direction to Chateau de Versailles. Because it's not in the center of everything, the hotel is very quiet and peaceful, but it's perfectly situated for a visit to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic friendly hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: AlisonWarden
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay in Hotel Foch. The location is great near the Champs Elysee and metro stations but in a quiet street so you can get a good nights sleep. The staff were excellent - very friendly and helpful and although the rooms are small, they are clean and comfortable. I will be recommending it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: sweetienj
Reviews.Content: Once I was told that excellence is when you get an unexpected exceptional service. That is absolutely true for Residence Foch. I chose this hotel for a 4-night stay in Paris in occasion of a business trip. I based my choice on Tripadvisor reviews. So, I expected to find a nice hotel, at a reasonable price, in a convenient area, and good breakfast. I had more. The cozy and still sophisticated hotel is located in a quiet street, in what looks a pretty upscale residential quarter. You need just to go around the corner to find busy streets, full of life, shops and restaurant. This is not a tourist area (fortunately). The hotel is only ten minutes walking from the Conference Center (Palais de Congres) and so, for me and my colleague, was the perfect location. The hotel is also very close (less than 10 min walking) to the bus stop for buses to Beauvais and Charles De Gaulle. Metro station is only five minutes away. My experience with this hotel was all positive. We had a busy correspondence at the moment of booking because of certain administrative formalities. We found professional answers and commitment. On our arrival, they remembered our names and gave us exactly the kind of room we had requested. People working there are absolutely fantastic. No matter who you find at the reception, they are all professional and more than friendly. They cheer you every time you enter and look sincerely concerned about your needs. I felt like I was home. Every night when I returned to the hotel it was like going back home and find somebody that was interested about how your day had been. I would say that many guests shared my same feeling. People stopped at the small bar to enjoy a glass of wine while chatting with the other guests and also at breakfast early in the morning (I mean when everybody yawns and grunts ) hotel guests enjoyed the reciprocal company, sharing comments on the city and activities, giving advice and recommendations. It looks like the hotel has a positive influence on people or maybe positive people choose this hotel or maybe we were just lucky to meet nice people. Anyway, the result is an enjoyable place to stay. Breakfast is good.: a small buffet with high quality food and good service. The only problem is that the room is small and maybe you have to wait a little bit to be sit but it has never been a real problem during our stay. The rooms are not big, but well furnished and with a modern well equipped bathroom (fantastic shower, by the way, and this is sometimes a luxury in a 3-star hotel). Free WiFi internet. What’s more my colleague had to leave for personal reasons earlier than expected and she had no problem at all when she informed the reception. They also gave us recommendations about restaurants that turned to be very enjoyable places to have lunch or dinner. So, if you are not looking for big, impersonal chain hotels and like the old, warm, relaxing atmosphere of small hotels, I strongly recommend the Residence Foch and, personally, I am going to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price, 1/4 mile away from subway”
Reviews.Author: johntimothyhopkins
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful and knowledgable of the area, they also spoke perfect English. The breakfast (included) was great, they had cereal, breads, meat & cheese, fruit salad, and eggs. The rooms were not huge, but nice and didn't feel cramped... We stayed in room 50, perfect for a romantic couple stay. It had a terrace with nice flowers. Overall, it was a very nice stay and for the price will definately come back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “We're so glad we found you”
Reviews.Author: Phil M
Reviews.Content: Trusting the Tripadvisor reviews, and having looked all over Paris for a hotel suitable for a family of 4 with 2 kids, 9 and 11, our expectations were met perfectly. Booking was painless, friendly and efficient by email and when we arrived we felt expected, and welcomed. The staff were helpful and gave us advice on restaurants (although we used Tripadvisor for this too!) and on airpport transport. There's free Internet in the bar. Check-oout was 12 noon, and we left our bags with the hotel until we needed to leave Paris at 4pm. Location is a bit away from the main tourist areas in a smart residential/diplomatic area, but that means it's quite and you can sleep with the bedroom window open. It's only 5 minutes from the nearest Metro and that's only 2 stops from the Champs-Elysee. We stayed for a 3 night break in a family room, with a large double bed and 2 single beds in a an area screened off by a curtain. The room was nicely decorated and the beds were comfy, with clean and comfortable bedding. The bathroom is fine and well-equipped, although it's a fine art to make sure that the shower curtain stays inside the bath! We didn't take the breakfast, as it's €13 per head, so I can't comment on that. If you're looking for 4 or 5 star luxury "chain" hotels, then this isn't for you, but for a family break it's perfect, and if we come back to Paris again, we'll certainly stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel with awesome locatoion”
Reviews.Author: Tanguito2011
Reviews.Content: The service was great!, Hotel staff very polite and extremely helpful. Location is great and close to all the attractions. Would absolutely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: mintyWarwickshire
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location within walking distance of two Metro stations and just a couple of streets away from the Arc de Triomphe. The area around the hotel was mostly residential and foreign consulates, so a very quiet and safe feeling area.(16th Arr.) The hotel itself was small but perfectly formed. The reception staff could not have been more helpful and attentive. The bedroom was very tidy and clean, with lovely floor to ceiling curtains and matching bedcover. The bathroom with lovely white fluffy towels, hairdryer (make sure the lights are on for it to work!) and toiletries restocked when needed. Plenty of hot water all the time and great water pressure from the over the bath shower as well, even on the fourth floor. For a reasonably priced hotel in a pleasant, safe and convenient for sightseeing area of Paris you could not go far wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, helpful, sincere”
Reviews.Author: Simon T
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay and we were sad to leave. The staff were wonderful and very welcoming of us as a family + 1 grand parent. Bookings and queries were easily organised via email to meet some specific requirements. This was our 3rd trip to Paris (first with children) and the rooms were a reasonable size from our previous Paris experiences. We would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a city break!”
Reviews.Author: James L
Reviews.Content: I went and stayed with my 65 year old mother, who very much felt relaxed in the hotel. Pros: Very friendly and very helpful staff, comfy beds, good size room, clean, good bathroom, free WiFi! Cons: Not sure there are any! At a SLOW pace it's ten minutes to the Metro. But then it's not many more to the Arc de Triomphe. There was a small amount of road noise audible. Location wise, Paris is such a small city that you can get to/from the Gare du Nord (Eurostar) in around 30 mins, door to door! And Taxis are so cheap that even if you were out enjoying Bastille til too late, a ride home is not going to set you back.

Reviews.Title: “Great as ever!”
Reviews.Author: Maartje_dW
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at this hotel. As expected, it was fantastic! The staff is very friendly and helpful, the rooms are clean and breakfast is great.

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely loved it- it felt like home!”
Reviews.Author: Akanksha G
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is small and cozy and is situated in a quiet and pretty part of town. It is very close to Arc De Triomphe and many other major attractions in the city. The Port Maillot underground station is a ten minute walk and there are trains to almost everywhere. What we loved the most were the rooms, which were clean and fresh (although a little small- if you have even one child with you, you may want to take the family suite) and the staff, which was exceptionally friendly. They helped us every morning with where we wanted to go and gave us many invaluable tips about the city and what to see.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and staff”
Reviews.Author: R F
Reviews.Content: I am very skeptical of reading reviews online and have never reviewed a hotel before. My family of 4 booked here after extensive research, we were still not sure if we made the right decision as this was our first trip to Paris. We were certainly glad we did. The hotel staff were incredibly helpful and friendly from the moment we walked in. They helped us plan our days touring and made sure everything was to our satisfaction whenever they saw us in the hotel. The family bedroom was definitely big enough, clean and quiet (no view of any sights, but this was not important to us). We will definitely recommend this place to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “exactly what we were looking for:))”
Reviews.Author: sanem o
Reviews.Content: Before my trip to Paris I did some research about the hotels and preferred hotel residence Foch , what I was looking for was a clean room ( as I have astma a fresh room is important for me) , a clean bathroom,hot water anytime I want (in old building it may be an issue to get hot water upstairs because of the old tubes ) , a secure area and if possible an old parisien building where I can feel myself a little bit of parisien during my stay. well, I got all I asked for. I must say that the location is perfect ;safe, just 300-400 metres to arc de triump by walking, quite area among the old apartments of Paris. you feel yourself as if you are a guest at your parisien friend rather than a tourist staying in a hotel.I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelx4
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a wonderful trip to Paris with our children and as parents know,it can be difficult to find a nice family room in a European city.So we certainly appreciated the very comfortable and spotlessly clean family room in the Residence Foch. It had everything we needed - a double bed and a separate space with a curtain and two single beds for the children.The beds were very comfortable and the linens of really good quality. This is an extremely comfortable ,well run 3 star hotel.I would describe the rooms as whimsical and quaint - which for us was the total Paris experience.If you are looking for posh and modern this is not for you,but if you are looking for a very clean,quaint and comfortable hotel you have found it right here.Our room had 2 large windows,one in the childrens' area and one in ours - both looked over a lovely interior courtyard.While we were there the nights were cool,and we were able to leave the windows open and enjoyed a really good night's sleep.It is a very quiet,residential area - and where can you sleep in Paris and leave your window open and not be disturbed by noise? The added advantage is ,that the room does have airconditioning and we had one very hot day,and were certainly glad of the aircon then!Bathroom is a very good size,again with a large window which we appreciated after 4 people had a shower and meant that the steam could escape in seconds!I know some people have mentioned the shower curtain over the bath and that the floor flooded when they took a shower,but to be honest it wasn;t a problem for us and just added to our "french experience".The towels are absolutely fabulous - large,soft and fluffy!Breakfast was included in our rate and we found the little breakfast area delightful.We never had a problem getting a table and the coffee was very good ,as was the hot chocolate for the children.We enjoyed the pastries,but if it had not been included in our room rate,I would probably find 13euro per person x4 a little pricey.As literally every other reviewer has said,the staff are incredibly friendly and helpful.From the moment we arrived ,to the moment we departed we felt they genuinely wanted us to have a wonderful stay in Paris.They welcomed us every morning with friendly smiles,asked us how we slept and how we were going to spend the day.Their restaurant suggestions are excellent and we had a fabulous meal in the congres de maillot.highly recommended!The Metro with children ,is about an 8 minute walk (without children it is faster!),so we did tend to take a few more taxis than anticipated.After a long day of sightseeing it seemed easier than negotiating the metro and doing another walk with the children.Most taxi fares were around 10 euro (from the eiffel tower) which to us was well worth it.There is a great little supermarket just around the corner ,where we got water and snacks.When we return to Paris,we will certainly stay here again and will recommend to our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Great Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bew212
Reviews.Content: For a 3 star hotel, we could not ask for more. The staff go out of their way to assist and make ones stay pleasureable. For Paris standards, the hotel is spacious and the service outstanding in terms of the price one pays. There are several local small supermarkets and 2 metros within minutes walk. The area is very safe, upmarket and close to all the major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Bon!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ciaranmd
Reviews.Content: Amir at the front desk was priceless. His help and friendliness put us at ease and helped improve our stay. The staff went out of their way to approach you, say good morning, ingage you in conversation, and advise you on the best way to make the best of your stay in Paris. The rooms were immaculate, spacious, and comfortable. The hotel is at a wonderful location. I over heard many guests talk about the fact that they were there on a return visit. I too will visit again when in Paris next. A true jem of a hotel. They have wonderful breakfast hours from 5:30am to 10:30 which is plenty of time for a wee sleep on. One of the best hotel experiences I have ever had. Highly, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, traditional hotel with extremely friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: J0andJames
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the hotel for 1 night, we had read the excellent reviews on Trip Advisor and were not disappointed. If you are wanting a modern, plush hotel this is not it, if you are looking for a quaint, traditional hotel you are in luck, the staff were by far the best thing about the hotel, nothing was too much trouble. The breakfast was nice, a buffet in a nice, cosy dining area. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: tracyo6618
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel was clean and neat. Some rooms are a bit small, but that's expected in Europe. Bathrooms were a really good size. The breakfast buffet was nice with fresh pasteries and coffee. The area was nice, but not close to many restaurants or shops. Metro was only 2 blocks away...very convenient. Quiet area, in a nice, safe neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: younglinedancer
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from this hotel having spent three days in Paris celebrating my partner's 50th birthday. The reception staff were so friendly and helpful, and spoke excellent English. The room was ready a couple of hours early which was excellent for us. The location was easy to find, and there are two metro stations about five minutes away. We walked to Arc de Triomphe in about ten minutes and to the Trocedero in about twenty or so. It is a beautiful residential area, Ave Foch , around the corner is one of the main roads leading to the Arc de Triomphe with beautiful property and park either side. The rooms are fairly small but ours had everything we needed and was bright and airy with air conditioning. We definitely recommend, good value for money, very welcoming, peaceful at night but with easy access to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “We were very happy and would stay again”
Reviews.Author: mysticinsummer
Reviews.Content: Our standard double room had a very comfortable bed, a large bathroom, great air conditioning, tea maker and supplies, shelves to organize clothes and the room had enough space for our empty luggage. The room was clean and well kept. The wifi worked well. The front desk staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The location was close to metro stops. While I prefer to stay in the Latin Quarter it was fun to experience another part of Paris and for the price we paid the room was much more comfortable than what we could have found in the Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BillZ3
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location. Staff was the absolute best - anything we wanted was taken care of. This was our first trip to Paris, and the staff really made us feel like we had good friends in the city!

Reviews.Title: “Very Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: DogsonHoliday
Reviews.Content: We only had 1 night at this Hotel, but it was lovely. The location was great close to the centre of Paris, and also the Bois de boulogne, which we walked through on our way back to the hotel. We were in the room on the top floor and the lift only stops at the landing between floors, so we had to carry our cases up a few stairs, but that was not a problem. From the small balcony there was a lovely view of the rooftops, and when we went to the end of the balcony we could just see the Eiffel Tower. The staff that we met were all very friendly and helpful. We would definitely recommend this Hotel

Reviews.Title: “We loved it -”
Reviews.Author: sweetemily
Reviews.Content: This was perfect for our family of 4 - two teenagers and parents. It had one larger room (European larger) and another room with two singles beds. Loved having separate rooms. Everyone was so nice, so french and whimsical. It isn't fancy if you are expecting that, but it is great. It was clean and cozy with a charming view outside our room - we kept our windows wide open to feel the fresh air and it was quiet. Train station nearby lots of restaurants and cafes about a block or so away. Very nice and safe neighborhood. You feel like a Parisian. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great informative staff”
Reviews.Author: UncleBB
Reviews.Content: We stayed there with my fiancé for 2 nights. We were greeted by the friendly smile of Isabelle who was determined we would have a great time! She let us know all the travel links, restaurants and shops nearby. Our room was small, but i was expecting this as I booked the hotel very late. I had a look at others and they seemed a bit bigger. Hotel was clean and tidy and our bathroom and balcony were a great size. Champs Elysse was 25 mins walk away, Eiffel Tower 10-15 mins on a bus. The neighbourhood is a little bit off the beaten track but felt very safe as I believe there were many Foreign Embassies nearby and therefore a strong Police presence. As far as 3 star hotels go, it's a great place to stay and you won't regret it. For an authentic French meal walk 10 mins to Le Congres Maillot, Pricey but unforgettable experience. The staff at the hotel are more than happy to ring around and book you tables to wherever you want.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels ANYwhere!”
Reviews.Author: USTraveler61
Reviews.Content: Absolutely charming smaller hotel in a quiet, upscale neighborhood of Paris. Everything was excellent, from the rooms, to super helpful desk staff (we don't speak French, but they speak fine English), to the breakfast, to the location. If you're not looking for another cookie-cutter Hilton or Marriott, but a place with true Parisian character, look no further!

Reviews.Title: “nightmare hotel :( faked rooms photos !!!!”
Reviews.Author: loveparis2011
Reviews.Content: the worst experience of my life was ...staying at hotel Foch. we arrived there atfter midnight to find the main door locked, and the guy who was there was struggling to find the right key. we where given " Room" 10 in the first floor "family room to Foch standards " which was horrible, the first thing we notced was the smell of urine in the kids"Room" where the beds where nothing but an old sofa bed with disgussting old unclean covers. we couldn't sleep all night because the beds were smelly, when we asked for new linnen they were worse, smelly with spots. i'm certain that the beds covers were not changed after the last visiter was in! i had to cover the bed with the 4 towels that were clean in the bathroom, to be able to sit on it! to add to our experience we found a Pifpaf in the closet, so i imagine that we were supposed to use it in case any unexpected vistors appear in the room" coacroaches". we were lucky to find a blackberry charger at the hotel and were able to find another hotel by the next morning. i have to say that the man at the front desk was helpfull and kind, but then after spoiling our night i suppose that's the least that they could have done+ the free breakfast before we left the hotel. i wish i had taken some photos, but we were so shocked, and didn't think about it, we just wanted to be out of there!

Reviews.Title: “A true gem”
Reviews.Author: trex_traveller_01
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend in Paris with our teenage son and my husband's brother and wife who had never visited Paris before. We chose the hotel because of Trip Advisor reviews and were not disappointed. If you are looking for a chain, cookie-cutter hotel this is not the place for you. The rooms are uniquely done and totally funky in a good way. If you are looking for charm and the best staff I have seen at any hotel ever, then this is the place for you. From the moment we walked in we were welcomed and made to feel comfortable. It didn't matter the time of day, or who was working the desk, everyone just seemed genuinely interested in making sure we had a great stay. The area is quiet and little off the beaten path, but still only 10-15 minute walk to the Arche de Triomphe. 2 metro stops and one RER stop are mere 5-7 minutes walk away. Within 10 minutes walk there are 40 different cafes and restaurants. On recommendation from the hotel staff, we walked to the Eiffel Tower to see it at night - a comfortable 30-45 minute walk. You miss out on the late night noise but gain a good nights sleep without being so far out of reach of the places you want to see. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb value and great location”
Reviews.Author: FoldHouse
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, very nice clean rooms, good service, very good value for money, we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “a bijou little hotel - in all senses! loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Furby73
Reviews.Content: my friends and i had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Residence Foch. the staff were unfailingly friendly and helpful, especially Emma who was a warm and welcoming host. our rooms were all cosy and charming, and you cannot beat the hotel's location in the heart of the 'old rich' neighbourhood of the 16th arrondissement. it may be on the 'edge' of the city, but there are 2 separate metro lines within 5 minutes' walk of the hotel, so everything is accessible. we will definitely be coming back ... again and again!

Reviews.Title: “A Haven in Paris”
Reviews.Author: JordanKris
Reviews.Content: We spent our first 2 nights in Paris at the Intercontinental Le Grand near the Opera House. Our last 3 nights were at Hotel Foch. My husband and I both agree the stay at Foch was more memorable and enjoyable. We stayed in a lovely family room with our 2 children (4 and 5 years old). The room was lovely and spotlessly clean. The kitchen type table under the window served as our dining room with a view of beautiful gardens each night while our children slept in the adjoining room. Most important was the wonderful staff who assisted us in every way possible including the Manager who went way out of his way to assist us with transport. If you have children consider going to the Jardin D' Acclimation which is in walking distance from the hotel. Good for kids from 3-8 years old. Lovely train ride from entrance of park to the actual Jardin. Farm, zoo and nice amusement rides all combined. A nice treat for them after days of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “What a staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Felipek
Reviews.Content: The staff is awsome, especially Emma. They show to you all the sights to visit and help you with what you need. The room is simple, but very clean! The location is good too, near to the subway and bus to Roland Garros, if you are going to watch a match. I strictly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Top Choice for Paris”
Reviews.Author: EddieC22
Reviews.Content: We read the postive reviews about Hotel Residence Foch and we expected a top hotel. We weren't disappointed. As others have said, it is the great service from the staff that makes it such a special place. Their smiles and hospitality goes a long way. The rooms and location are also very good. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unusual find in a quiet neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: megruhot
Reviews.Content: This unique hotel was a jewel. The staff was extremely gracious and helpful. Really corrected the "French are so rude to Americans" lie. The rooms were clean and although some were small, they were a good value for the price. Will definitely stay there again when in Paris. Breakfast was actually something to write home about.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful small hotel and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: BODHI3
Reviews.Content: How lucky we are to choose this place for our 3 days trip to Paris. We stayed here with our big family 4 adult, 2 youth, 2 children and everyone was more than happy with the small beautiful hotel. Beautiful comfortable rooms, lovely details and friendly helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: cindy90
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located - in a quiet street and close to metro. Front desk staff was very polite and helpful. Room was nicely decorated and very clean. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just as nice on our second visit!”
Reviews.Author: Barglox
Reviews.Content: We returned to Hotel Residence Foch this visit because we had such a great experience there two years ago. Nelly and the staff remembered us and welcomed us with open arms. It is often difficult to find a quiet hotel in a big city like Paris, but nighttime street noise is minimal and we found the beds to be very comfortable and the bathroom well-equipped with little luxuries. The location is ideal, close to two main subway lines and the train as well. We loved the sitting area in the lobby where we could gather with our friends in the evenings. The staff provided coffee, wine glasses, and cocktail nuts for us to use and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, quiet hotel in 16th; great location, well run and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: bill7587
Reviews.Content: A charming, recently renovated French-style hotel near Le Palais des Congres and Porte Maillot. Quiet location, nice rooms and excellent staff. Local ownership, very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem”
Reviews.Author: Stina1978
Reviews.Content: When I was looking for a hotel in Paris for a couple of days and saw that Residence Foch, being rated so high on tripadvisor has got one last room - I immediately went for it and I never regret this fact :) Its an awesome little hotel, there's literally no flaws to it. The location is great, very quiet and at the same time just about 300 m away from the nearest metro station and about 10 mins walk to Champs Elysees. The staff is brilliant, everyone is very polite and ready to help. We arrived at approximately 1pm and our room was not ready yet, we were asked to wait for 15 minutes and while we did we were offered drinks. The room itself is pretty small, but hey, its Paris :))) The bathroom though was pretty big, almost the size of the room. Our room had a view to rue Marbeau with a little balcony, very pretty. There are tea/coffee making facilities in the room as well, which we did find very handy... Oh, and of course free wi-fi access was very convenient! Not many 5* hotels offer it, so it was really nice to have it here... If I am going to visit Paris again this little hotel will definitely be my first choice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: Alevtyna
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located 10 minutes by walk from Arc de Triomphe and Champs-Élysées. However, it's nicely hidden among the typical Parisian houses so that it is a very quiet place. The metro station is 5-7 min away. So the location was really great for sightseeing. The room was small, but we expected that from Paris. The bathroom was very big, half the size of the room. It was very light with a big window and a lot of mirrors. There was a tea pot with tea/coffee making facilities, mini bar/fridge, a TV, iron and iron board - everything you need for the comfortable stay. Though be aware that the rooms are really small and if you have two big suitcases, you will have to figure out where to hide them from your way to the bathroom. The reception was always very smiley, eager to help, very polite. We will recommend the hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite service”
Reviews.Author: Kanerva
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the Hotel Residence Foch. What you'll notice at the very moment you step in to the hotel is excellent service. Somehow the whole staff understands how to make guests feel welcome and the service is good in a natural efortless way. Our room was nice. Very comfortable and nicely decorated, but small. The bathroom was larger that expected, alsmost as large as the bedroom. There were lots of natural light, which was great. There's safe and free WiFi in the room (also coffee/tea, minibar, hairdryer). There's also computers in the lobby you can use for free. The lift is very small, but this was no problem. Breakfast was not included, but it's served downstairs. The hotel is located a bit further from the main attractions, but the area is very nice and there are two metro stations and nice restaurants quite near. It takes about 20-30 min. to reach the main sights. We very much enjoyed our stay at Residence Foch.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotell with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Turbi1965
Reviews.Content: It's a small hotel close to one of the grand avenues. Rooms are cosy and big enough. Amtmosphere is good. Breakfast is rich. Internet connection is for free.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: bartleman
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Paris for two days with our two kids as part of a larger trip to England. This hotel was a little out of the main center, but was very close to the metro station, so we were able to get everywhere very quickly and it was close to some very good restaurants. The hotel was very clean and the room we had was perfect for a family of four. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and the breakfast each morning was great. We would definitely stay here again and recommend this to anyone traveling to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel & great staff”
Reviews.Author: midgelfc
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at the end of March as a surprise for my girlfriend for her birthday. On arrival we were greeted by the most friendly person i have ever had the pleasure of meeting. Unfortunately we never got his name but he made us feel very welcome and gave us a free room upgrade to a deluxe because it was my girlfriends birthday, which was a brilliant surprise and bonus. The room we got was huge compared to other hotel rooms we have stayed in, in Pairs and also cheaper. We paid about 100-120 eur a night which was a bargain considering how highly rated this hotel is! The location of the hotel is also very handy, just of the arc de triomphe with the closest metro stop being Argentine about 8-10 min walk away and as this is one of the central lines it's handy for switching and getting to all the sight seeing attractions. We also walked it up to the arc de triomphe from the hotel which took about 15-18 mins. There are a few cafe's and restaurants on the way to the metro stop which we had breakfast at which saved us money. Also there is a supermarket close to the hotel was handy :) All the staff at the hotel were very friendly and always made us feel welcome and asked if we needed directions or any advice.

Reviews.Title: “Great venue and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: marco_bau
Reviews.Content: Seldom would you consider seeing a hotel in central Paris to be affordable and in an excellent location. I found Residence Foch thru Tripadvisor and it was truly a dleight staying in this hotel last September. I was with colleagues and the staff was most helpful to ensure our stay went perfect. The rooms are adequately sized with a cozy feel to it. Very well decorated and with free Wifi too! Will be returning there this year and am looking forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, location and price.”
Reviews.Author: LisaFlan
Reviews.Content: Great location, very safe area. Hotel staff are very helpful and friendly. Loved this hotel will stay there again. Not suitable for children as rooms are on the small side.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: bscvoyages
Reviews.Content: We visited Paris during early March and stayed for 3 nights. The location of this hotel to Metro was a very convenient , with a short walk of less than 10 minutes, which was easy enough for us to do, as we are both in our early 40's. We can not say enough about the incredibly friendly and helpful staff. Their English was excellent! Each staff member was superb and made staying at this hotel a pleasure. Would strongly recommend this hotel to friends and family. The breakfast is a bit steep for 10 Euros a person but it was handy to have available. The staff were attentive to our requests when we asked them not to perfume the room. All in all an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Charming!”
Reviews.Author: OJ007_11
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel. Definitely recommended for a long relaxing week-end in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Still charming, a little less value for what you get ...”
Reviews.Author: Kipraios
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to residence Foch. We end up spending at least one weekend a year or two in Paris and last time, stranded during the volcano chaos in Europe, we found the foch residence to be extremely good for the price (we paid around 100 euros a night). This time it was 150 euros a night (a big hike) and in a smaller room at that (granted it was a late booking and the owner was extremely apologetic and helpful). I still have to say that location and staff friendliness, customer service are exceptional - and that is rare in Paris - even in the five star hotels we stayed in the prior evenings while I was on business. Because of the price we may be adventurous and look for a differnet option next time.

Reviews.Title: “very good choice”
Reviews.Author: artfry
Reviews.Content: i can see why there are so many good reviews (and strangely for Paris they dont seem polarised as you sometimes get. these were all good). great welcome and excellent service. great room with a good terrace. all good is a good summary.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need”
Reviews.Author: haolepino
Reviews.Content: Just recently returned from a long weekend at the Hotel Residence Foch. Excellent stay. Would gladly stay there every time we are in Paris. A perfect place for a family with young children. The nearest Metro and RER stations were around 7 minutes away by foot. The Arc de Triomphe was an easy 10-15-minute walk. Brasseries and restaurants for every taste and price range are right around the corner on Ave. de la Grande Armee. And on Ave. Malakoff, there is a well-stocked Carrefour grocery store where we stocked up on snacks and supplies. The room was clean and comfortable. Everyone slept well. The staff could not have been more helpful or friendly. Despite terrible weather, we had a wonderful time--in large part due to the friendly and restful accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a romantic weekend in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: NorafromNorway
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend went to Paris for a romantic weekend, and checked in at Hôtel Résidence Foch. We were welcomed by a extremely helpful and charming staff, who spoke perfectly english and knew everything about where to go and what to see in Paris. We had ordered a deluxe room, and got more than what we had expected. The room was specious, clean, quiet and wonderfully charming, with chandeliers and a big and comfortable bed. All in all, we got great value for our money, and would recommend the hotel for everyone who is searching for something comfortable, quiet and romantic.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels we've stayed at in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: SUEC-WONG
Reviews.Content: The staff were very welcoming, very helpful. They offered good recommendations for restaurants, with directions and maps. Room was not enormous, but what hotel in Paris has huge rooms. All very cosy and clean. Breakfast is a little expensive, but you can eat as much as you like, so perhaps save on lunch, or there are plenty of cafes close by, so it wouldn't be a hardship to go out for breakfast. Close to the Arc de Triomphe and handy for main line stations and the Metro. Just sorry it has taken so long for me to get round to writing this review, I've talked about the Foch often enough. Well done.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly and charming hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KuantanCurls
Reviews.Content: We travelled with three young children and needed to find a hotel with a room, or connecting rooms, that could accommodate five people - not easy in Paris. I am so pleased we found Hotel Residence Foch (through TripAdvisor). Hotel rooms in Paris usually are pretty compact, so we weren't surprised that the three single beds they had put in the children's end of the family room were creatively crammed in; the point is they managed to get three beds in there, and with space to move between them, a miracle! Our room was comfortable, spacious compared to rooms I've had in other Parisian hotels. The bathroom was very nicely appointed, and spotlessly clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The first morning the children and my husband slept very late, and I went on downstairs to have a coffee. The fabulously friendly and helpful manager asked why I was alone, and then immediately offered to have four trays made up and sent to the room so the family could have breakfast when they woke. I declined the offer, but asked how it would cost to have breakfast in bed, the manager's response? 'Why madam, nothing! You have already paid for your breakfast, it is our pleasure only that you enjoy your stay.' That is the first time EVER that I have had that kind of service offered in a hotel. Would I recommend Hotel Residence Foche for families? Absolutely, and anyone else that wants a friendly and welcoming hotel to go back to after a long day of sightseeing. The hotel is small, but offers brochures, has postcards for sale in the lobby, and can give you a range of recommendations on places to see, where to eat and how to get there. Our youngest is 5 and we all walked from the hotel to the L'Arc de Triomphe and then on down to the Seine and the Eiffel Tower. It is only 5 minutes from the metro station which connects you to everything. There was a gorgeous pizzeria two minutes along the road, a chemist (pharmacy) and 5 minutes more takes you to the most amazing Lebanese restaurant whose name I forget but the lovely manager knows where it is! Thank you to everyone at Hotel Residence Foch, you made our stay very enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: arh0070
Reviews.Content: four of us stayed here in january 2011.It is excellent value ,rooms are clean .the hotel is in a residential area so rooms are very quiet .Staff is fabulous ,fluent in english and very helpful .In the neighborhood within easy walking distance are nice restaurants ,cheese and wine shops and great patisseries .One night we bought some cheese and a fine bourdeau and had it back at the hotel another evening we bought a fabulous fruit flan and had it back at the hotel with coffee supplied by the hotel staff.Its a bit out of the way near the bois de boulogne so it is essential to get a paris pass and unlimited pass for four days on the metro to get to all the sights ,its about a half mile walk to the closest metro and then an easy ride to the eiffel tower and all the other sites .Nice continental breakfast provided at the hotel which starts the day off well with fresh croissants etc .arh lafayette louisiana

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with very good & friendly service - Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: LotteBerlin
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel very much. We've visited Paris quite a few times and have seen a couple of nice hotels already, but the Residence Foch has convinced us especially because the service personel was so extremely friendly and the interior of the house is very welcoming - classy and cosy. Several Métro and RER stations are nearby. The rooms are rather small but that's pretty normal in Paris. The rooms have TV with many channels (e.g. the German ZDF) and Wifi is free of charge. Everything was perfectly clean. We also liked the breakfast buffet. At 13 € it's very reasonable priced in comparison to restaurant prices in Paris. In the internet you can find very good room rates. We would suggest this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and lovely service”
Reviews.Author: Gutzie5
Reviews.Content: A friend and I wend to Paris for four days and the hotel was perfect for what we were looking for and for the price. We were able to get twin beds and the room was very clean and decorated nicely. You could sometimes hear others in the rooms next door but overall it was quiet and on a quiet and safe street. The staff were fantastic and recommended great sights to see around Paris with great enthusiasm! The hotel is 20 minutes walk from the Arc de Triomphe and was close to the Metro so it was easy to get around the city. I would definitely go back next time I am in Paris and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Yasing
Reviews.Content: I can recommend the hotel because the rooms were nice and bigger then expected. In addition the rooms are very clean and daily the cleaning stuff is doing a great work. We had also a very warm welcome to the hotel with useful tips and recommendations to nice visiting places. The personnel is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, good location, highly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: robnaudrey
Reviews.Content: We just finished our stay at the Hotel Residence Foch, and I must say we could not be more pleased. Our flight was diverted to Munich and we ended up arriving in Paris 18 hours later than we planned. Our room was waiting for us with the night manager ready to help us in. That level of service continued throughout our 6 day stay, and was definitely the highlight of our trip. The staff, especially the concierge, Chedi, were always helpful. Isabel helped my daughter find the right neighborhood to shop in, Nelly greeted us every morning, and Chedi found restaurants for us, recommended how to adjust our plans for the weather, and assisted us with dinner in our rooms when it was too cold to go out. The only downside was the distance to the metro station, but in pretty much any other weather than heavy snow and below freezing temperatures it wouldn't be an issue. The neighborhood is quite pleasant, with all the conveniences like a bank grocery store, laundromat, wine bar, chocolate shop, etc. nearby. Thanks again to Nelly, Chedi, and all the staff. We will recommend the Residence Foch to all our friends, and stay again when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great option in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Larrydarrell7
Reviews.Content: The location is nice quiet street but close to the Champs-Élysées and the Arc de Triomphe. It is perfect place to relax after a day of touring. The Director and the Staff were extremely helpful with sightseeing tips and two local restaurant suggestions that we really enjoyed. The rooms were clean and spacious. The breakfast was on the better end of continental breakfasts with good selection of pastries etc. I would definitely recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Marbeau and the Hotel Residence-Foch”
Reviews.Author: CitroenCollector
Reviews.Content: Many years ago a dear friend of mine recommended an intimate, comfortable hotel to stay in while in Paris. I had been going to Paris at least 4 times a year, and found the only part of the experience I did not enjoy were the hotels. They were either too big, too impersonal or the language barrier was just difficult to overcome. I felt okay at the Marriott, or the other recognizable hotels, but then when you stay there you could be in Cleveland! No, I desired an experience that made me feel like I had my own house, my own family in a neighborhood (the 16th Arrondissement, it does not get any better in Paris?) that was inviting and distinctly Parisian. This is when my pal said the place to go was the Hotel Residence-Foch. A small hotel, not very expensive, with an exceptionally friendly staff and knowledgeable manger, who also was the owner(how often do you get to meet with the owner of such a highly rated hotel?) Well, since my first stay over 8 years ago, this is the only place I stay when in Paris, and I have recommended the hotel to many others, and at last count have had over 15 friends stay there and they could not thank me enough about it. This gem of a place is a treasure, and I sometimes think that if I recommend it too much, I will never be able to get a room. The savvy traveler will understand the qualities of this establishment the minute they enter. The spotlessly clean rooms, the friendly and efficient associates, and the delicious morning "cafe and petit dejeuner," and as an American in Paris, I know that every time I stay there I am truly in my "second" home. The best proof that I know of that I am not alone, is that every time I stay at the "RF" as myself and my friend's refer to it, we run into someone we met in previous visits. There is just one of manyreasons this hotel has been rated one of best in Paris for several years, because it is. If you want to get the total experience while visiting this most wondrous of cities, you will certainly complement your visits to the restaurants, shops and museums, by coming "home" to the comfort and hospitality of the Residence-Foch.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing experience!!! would never go back there...”
Reviews.Author: cavakiereprima
Reviews.Content: We've been in Paris for a weekend which was supposed to be memorable! it was but in the bad way... we took this hotel due to it's good feedback on TA but our stay was probably our worst hotel experience in Europe. Rooms are very small and during the night, no way to sleep with our noisy neighbours and the reception was not really interested in our problem!!! Breakfast service is very bad! the guy doing the service should better find a position in a jail!!! no smile, no answer if you say good mng... seems not really happy doin his job!!!unbelievable for someone workin in hospitality business :(( reception staff seems helpful for sure but there still a lot of work to do for this hotel to deserve a 3 * category even if room rates are expensive!!! really disappointed with this hotel and would never recommand it to a friend :((

Reviews.Title: “5 Star service!!”
Reviews.Author: TimDeGroot
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for 1 night at the Residence Foch, but it was the best! Excellent service by the friendly staff. The room was clean and the bathroom had a lot of space. The breakfast was simple, but very good with fruit, croissants, coffee and a boiled egg! When back in Paris, will definitely go back to this hotel. Thanks for the pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Charming French boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: MKKStPaulMN
Reviews.Content: My 23 year old daughter and I stayed here for four days from Nov 12-16, 2010, and would highly recommend. As stated many times the front desk staff couldn't be nicer and helped us in every way possible including providing an electric currency changer so we could use our curling iron. The metro is 3 blocks away and there are several reasonably priced restaurants across from the metro where you can get a very nice continental breakfast for about 7 euro ($10). The metro is extremely easy to use and we had no problem with panhandlers etc. One of our highlights was a trip to Dellerhins, a restaurant supply store that sells retail. We bought a crepe pan, tart pan and several Eiffel tower cookie cutters for about $70--don't forget to ask for a form to get a refund of the VAT tax. One warning--we bought a La Conierge 3 day metro/museum/boat ride pass that was not as promised. "Free" boat ride wasn't, and there were problems with the museum pass as well. Get a multi day metro pass and decide how many museums you really can see in the days you have and then determine if a pass is a good value for you. I definitely do not recommend the company we used. All in all our stay in Paris was delightful and we would stay at Hotel Foche again.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, wonderful stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: iteach1981
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Hotel Foch over the summer while we were traveling around Europe. I actually chose this hotel because of the great reviews I read on Trip Advisor. We were NOT disappointed at all! This hotel was excellent from start to finish. First of all, Isabel is the most wonderful concierge - friendly and engaging, and very helpful with suggestions on sights and restaurants. When I booked our room, I chose a deluxe room (very reasonably priced) and was very pleased to find when we arrived that we had the best room in the whole place - the Honeymoon suite, and it wasn't even our honeymoon! The location was great, too. We chose to walk everywhere we went (everything was in walking distance), but if you are opposed to walking around the city, there is an underground station just about a block away. Also, keep in mind when staying at this hotel that the elevator is small and only takes you to the 5th floor (I think it's the 5th) and then you have to walk up the remaining flights of stairs with your luggage if you are on the 6th or 7th floor. We didn't mind! We even had a view of the Eiffel Tower from our little balcony! The temperature in the room was also very comfortable, as there was a little wall unit air conditioner. Finally, I have to mention the other concierge as being excellent, though I never did catch his name! Overall, STAY HERE! It's probably the friendliest place in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and superb value for central Paris”
Reviews.Author: gregm13
Reviews.Content: My wife, 2 young daughters (ages 3 and 6) and I stayed at the Hotel Residence Foch for 6 nights at the end of October. The staff (primarily Chedi and Isabelle) were genuinely warm/accomodating and provided advice on transportation, local stores/restaurants, tourist traps, ect. We opted for the "Family Room" on the 1st floor which is huge by European standards. We had a full bedroom complete with a table and 3 chairs and the living room had a couch which folded into a bed - where our daughters slept. The cost of the room was EUR 250 per night which was very reasonable. The hotel and room decor was dated, however we felt that it added to the ambiance of the Residence Foch. Our only complaint was of the shower - primarily because the shower curtains didn't contain the water and the bathroom floor would flood every time we took a shower. We also liked that the hotel is located in a residential area with less than a 10 minute walk to the Metro. There are dozens of restaurants within a 20 minute walk plus a take-away Chinese restaurant, wine shop, cheese shop, bakery (great for morning coffee / croissant), dry-cleaner, ATM and supermarket (Carrefour) all within a short walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Paris”
Reviews.Author: rosie1166
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay for two nights in a superior room with a balcony at the conclusion of a long holiday in France. Our room was small, particularly having two large bags with us. Decor was a little dated but adequate as we were only there for a couple of days. We were a little suprised that the balcony was basically a large window with a grill. We did not have a balcony as known in Australia. When we approached the management they explained that we had a European balcony and re adjusted the payment for the room in our favour. This was unexpected and pleasing. As the hotel is situated in a quiet street near some good restaurants and places for breakfast, we did not use the dining room. The hotel is situated about a 10 minute walk to the metro and we used it to visit all the sights. Overall we thought this hotel was value for money in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Shell081103
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights. It is just around the corner from the arc de triomphe so brilliant location. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms are a decent size for paris and good value for money, they are also very clean. If we return to paris I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, small boutique type hotel in great area.”
Reviews.Author: fourtrinks
Reviews.Content: The Residence Foch was a great place to stay in a quiet part of a busy city, with comfortable beds and dark rooms, good for sleeping after busy days sightseeing in Paris and many, many miles of walking. A wonderful place to return to after long days. The hotel staff were very helpful, good English and had many great recommendations for restaurants and transportation tips. The room was rather small but the bathroom very nice size but it was very clean and we were really just there to sleep. We did not have the breakfast there but there are many options for patisseries and a nice grocery store close, to buy items to put in the refrigerator if meals were to be eaten in the room for convenience sake. We would definitely recommend this, friends traveling around the same time in Paris were in the 1st arrondisment felt it was so busy and expensive for even the basics, we felt very fortunate for all the things good about staying at this hotel, very convenient for the metro and Paris is easy to navigate on the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: BetsyGite
Reviews.Content: This hotel was most convenient to the Metro and convention center. The rooms were comfortable and clean and very quiet considering it is located close to major traffic and restaurants. All of the receptionists spoke exceptional English and couldn't have been more helpful. All questions concerning directions and restaurants were answered efficiently. A great small comfortable hotel at a reasonable price!!

Reviews.Title: “great location for Palais Congresss conference”
Reviews.Author: peppon
Reviews.Content: Excellent location if you are Attending a meeting in the Palace Congress WHICH IS has 10 minutes walk away . Convenience store 2 minutes away you can get WHERE snacks , drinks , etc. . Metro a short walk est aussi away . Plenty of restaurants nearby. The bus IS AirFrance accessible so going back to the airport Was Not after year . The hotel room was small European hotel rooms as MOST are . Howeve , it was very clean , comfortable and beautiful . The staff of the hotel Is a BIG PLUS! Both evening and morning shift staff Were all very professional and Derwent out of Their Way to help us . Great great value for money . Would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem in the city of lights”
Reviews.Author: Tp136
Reviews.Content: Nelly and her staff greeted us upon our arrival with a smile and a room ready to occupy. After a long flight it was a treat to be able to check in early. They were all so helpful, so welcoming that it was a great start to our European adventure. They gave us many tips about what to see and what the best times were to see them. Their directions were so valuable to us as we like to walk. The hotel is in an area of Embassy's so it is safe and within walking distance of all attractions; if you like to walk. If you want to walk the Seine at night and enjoy the cafe's then there are always cabs to be found to take back. The European style breakfast was a nice start to the day and could be had in the room if requested and if anything was needed it was provided. It is clean, comfortable and central with a great staff...what more can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Really pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: ChrissyZ
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, the owner is very helpful and it really is just like a big B & B. Close to Champs Elysee, not to far from the Eiffel Tower, close to metro. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “As welcoming and warm as a B&B in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: samsonite
Reviews.Content: After reading the strong reviews in TripAdvisor and doing much research for a suite that would accommodate three adults and not rob us blind, I booked two nights at Hotel Residence Foch. Upon our morning arrival, the proprietor took care of us very quickly and even brought some tea for my mom who was feeling poorly after a long day of traveling. We got into our bags up the lift in and found our suite (the Blue Room) incredibly SPACIOUS and well appointed. While we were lucky with the weather and didn't have to make use of A/C or heat, we did leave windows open during the night. And, remarkably, it was pitch quiet and very indicative of how residential the neighborhood (the 16th A) is despite its proximity to l'Arc de Triomphe and major boulevards. The beds, including an additional cot set up, were very comfortable with good linens. Bathroom was very roomy, especially for Paris. And,one of my hotel pet peeves was absent: there was really good lighting in the room. Enough lamp options throughout the space for one person to go to sleep and someone else to stay up and read. It's not a luxurious space, but it's one that feels authentic to the city while also being modern with free wi-fi and a flat screen TV. Located in the 16th A., the location is remarkably convenient midway between the Porte Maillot (Metro line 1) and Porte Dauphine (Metro line 2). Breakfast is a bit pricey at 13 euros per person, especially when there are some nice patesseries within walking distance. But, the breakfast spread and atmosphere is very nice and convenient. The most unique and strongest asset of this hotel is its service. The lovely couple who took care of us were helpful with recommendations, suggestions, and helping to book our taxi when we left. The care and personal touch felt very much like a B&B but with the efficiency of a well-run hotel in Paris. Highly recommend. Would stay here again the next time I'm in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Hotel in a Beautiful Part of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Zodalmighty
