Reviews.Content: Hotel Residence Foch is a gem of a hotel, located just west of the Arc De Triomph (5 mins walk from Metro Porte Dauphine, 10 mins from Metro Argentine). The staff gave us a very warm welcome and were extremely helpful and charming throughout our stay. Our room was on the 6th floor with a view of the Eiffel Tower (just the top of it!) The room had a small terrace with two chairs , a table and hanging flower baskets; fulfilling exactly what anyone's romantic expectations of Paris might be. The room was clean, bright and well organised with ironing board, iron, safety deposit box. Anyone who stays in larger or chain hotels might complain that the flowery motifs and cosiness of the room is a bit dated, but it was exactly as advertised on their website and was both quaint and comfortable. Free Wi-Fi was a big plus. Breakfast in the hotel can be a little pricey, but the surrounding area (particularly in the direction of Avenue de la Grande Arme) is littered with patiseries and cafes if you feel like something different. The hotel also has an offer for dinner in a nearby restaurant on Rue Pergolese (set menu with wine - but for almost half the price you would pay normally) The staff of Residence Foch must again be commended for their manner and helpfulness; they even rang ahead to confirm a reservation and obtain directions for us to go for dinner on the Seine one of the nights. It is no wonder that their Tripadvisor Traveller's Choice award is proudly displayed on the front desk. I would recommend this hotel as THE place to stay when visiting Paris

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Warm Welcome”
Reviews.Author: Surreytravellor29
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a quiet, peaceful part of Paris but it is only a fairly short stroll to the Arc de Triomph. The rooms are comfortable and tastefully furnished and the breakfast was good. We had plenty of space in our room for four. The best thing about this hotel was the great service and the warm welcome we received. The next time we go to Paris we will stay at the Residence Foch. PS The hotel recommended Del Papa, an Italian restaurant nearby for dinner and now so do I. The prices there were very reasonable for the area and food excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and convenient!”
Reviews.Author: eipamay
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Hotel Residence Foch. We had a family suite which had plenty of space for everyone. The location was a little far out, but the Metro stations were very convenient and it was a matter of minutes to get anywhere we wanted to go. The staff recommended a couple of restaurants for dinner and both were within walking distance of the hotel and had great food! This was a wonderful stay for us!

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: EuroLily2010
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a two night stay based on TripAdvisor reviews and our ability to get one room for our family of 4. The hotel is in a quiet neighborhood. It's old but clean and well maintained. The bathroom in our room was nice - large and with good lighting. The location of the hotel is great - about a ten minute walk to the Metro station. We actually walked from our hotel to both the Eiffel Tower and the Arc de Triomph and Champs Elysee. We didn't spend much time in the hotel so had minimal contact with hotel staff, but they seemed very nice and someone always greeted us when we walked in the door. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel - thought it was a bit too expensive for our family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Great Service, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: mpeterson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Paris after spending 5 nights at Hotel Residence Foch. The hotel was really great and for the price we felt like we got an awesome deal. Location: The hotel is halfway between two metro stops, Porte Dauphine (Blue Line) and Porte Malliot (Yellow Line). The Yellow Line goes through most of the major tourist areas, like the Louvre, Tulleries, etc. It was very easy to use the Metro as most of the time we did not need to transfer lines at all! The Blue Line goes up to Monmartre which was also convienent. The hotel is about a 5 - 7 minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe, and about a 20 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. The hotel is on a quite side street near the German embassy, so the area is secure. Services: Yes, the rooms are small. The Standard room that we booked (130 euros with breakfast) was adequate for our needs. The bed, two doubles, formed a king but there was only a narrow alleyway on either side of the bed. The only other complaint I had was that the bathroom was just on the other side of a pocket door, which made using the facilities uncomfortable at times as the room and the bathroom were so close. However, the bathroom was large by European standards (it was MUCH larger than the one we had in Amsterdam at a luxury hotel). The hotel desk staff were wonderful, answered all our questions, helped us with our French, and genuniely cared about whether or not we were having a good time. They helped us find provisions for a pic-nic at the Eiffel Tower, lent us glassware, a tray and a knife, and offered us menus for local restaurants. They even have ideas about what tours you should do each day, if asked. Free wi-fi, two laptops, and free printing were really helpful during our stay. Breakfast: Breakfast was a typical european fare, with croissants, breads, yogurts, cereal, juices, tea, coffee, etc. There was plenty of food to go around, and we were always able to find a table and were asked for our beverage preferences right away. The only complaint I have is that the mini bar also includes the snacks on the desk, which look "Free" until you find out that they are part of the mini bar! But, the 3.50 euro pringles were worth it when I was hungry at night. This hotel was a great deal for the price, but the desk staff went above and beyond. Staying at this hotel has given me a new perspective on large hotels were you have to wait or flag a staff member down for assistance. I would definitely give this hotel a look, we had a wonderful time and will be back if we ever go to France again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice location”
Reviews.Author: dazk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights and found the hotel's location to be in a quiet neighbourhood that seemed to have rather wealthy people living/working around there! (Metro stop Port Maillot or Port Dauphine) Very convenient location, walking distance to the Arc De Triomphe and the Champs-Elysees -- but get yourself a NaviGo pass and the Metro will take you just about anywhere! The bathroom had a bit of mould on the tiles though, and the room is small but it's Paris! Staff were friendly and the front desk always had someone there to assist - can't fault the service. If you get the chance definitely try Stephane Gaborieau's restaurant "Le Pergolese" just 1 minute down the road -- amazing food and operated by such a friendly head chef and staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Treated my wife and I like criminals on our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: britainkentbaker
Reviews.Content: I came here with my wife on our honeymoon. The staff was friendly to begin with and very enthusiastic about helping us. We got up to our rooms and walked into the brightest yellow hotel room I have ever seen. I asked if they had anything that wasn't so... yellow, and they were able to move us into a different room that was a more vibrant peach color. The rest of our time at the hotel was fine, we tried to avoid being there as much as possible because the beds were very hard and the decor made you feel like you were staying at grandmas house. On our last morning when it was time to check out and go to the airport, I went downstairs and told the man at the front desk that I wanted to pay on two separate cards. He then rung up the final amount and it was different than what Expedia had quoted me. I showed him the online receipt that Expedia had sent me. My price was in dollars but nowhere on the Expedia receipt did it say that the final price was subject to any change. I expressed my concern with the man at the front desk saying that I had planned my trip around the price quoted to me and that I didn't have enough money on the two cards I had on the front desk. He called his manager and I spoke with him and explained the situation. Meanwhile my wife came downstairs and I left my cards on the front desk and went to ask if I could use money on her card to pay for the extra money they were charging me. When I came back to the desk, the man had taken one of my cards without my permission and had put the entire amount onto one card rather than two. I got on the phone with his manager who said that it was their right to do that and that I was not cooperating and that it was their right to take my card. Bottom line, they caused my bank to overdraft me a large amount, they treated me and my wife like criminals, and they processed my payment without any consent from me. Everything about the situation just felt wrong and it all could have easily been avoided had they had patience and trust in their customers. Overall a terrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff with a great attitude to service and their guests”
Reviews.Author: sminko
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after a recommendation and a look at trip advisor. We were not disappointed. The hotel is within a 10 min walk of Port Malliot (where the Air France bus drops you off). It has a number of useful restaurants close by. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful in every way, nothing was too much trouble. We had the only room in the hotel with a terrace, and although the room itself was small, (and don't even think of it if you are a little on the large side as the double bed is only just, and you need to turn over in sequence) we though it was good value. Everything was spotlessly clean with the linen changed every day. We stayed 3 nights, and the hotel was happy to let us store our bags, free of charge, on the day we were departing. Breakfast is served at the hotel until 10.30, and coffee and tea making facilities are in the room. There is also a small bar. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, charming hotel in quiet, residential area”
Reviews.Author: pkofsky
Reviews.Content: Wonderful 6 night stay during our first visit to Paris. Room with breakfast included met our needs since we were out and around till evening. Metro stations were very convenient. Nelly, Chedi, and Isabelle were very helpful planning our daily excursions. We hope to one day return to this cozy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Parisien stayover”
Reviews.Author: Gerry0
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night on way back from Coast. We wanted somewhere close to autoroute with parking as well as being close enough to a few main tourist sites for our young son. This hotel was perfect - the hosts were extremely attentive and interested and wanted to ensure we were as comfortable as possible. We had a cot with us so they gave us the biggest room possible and there was plenty of room. Great location as we could walk to Eiffel Tower and Arc in one circle. Parking free on streets of Paris in August.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Service at a good value”
Reviews.Author: Flowzat
Reviews.Content: We spent seven nights at this charming excellently staffed hotel. We had two adjoining rooms which were small but comfortable. It's five star rating is mostly due to its excellent service. As the other reviewers have indicated, no problem is too big for the staff to tackle. If you are first time visitors to Paris, it is great to have such a welcoming base from which to explore the city. The breakfast buffet is fine, free wifi is available (although it works best from the lobby) and any and all questions are patiently answered. You do need to be aware of a few things that while not a big deal for us (we would love to be back) might sway your decision to stay here: 1. The neighborhood is very upscale and residential so the ambience is not as vibrant as in many other parts of the city. 2. The metro is only about five minutes away but many of the other sites are sufficiently far away that once you leave the hotel for the day, you should really only come back after dinner (this would have been a big deal for us if our children had been younger). 3. It can be be a bit noisy since sound carries into the room, but it never got of hand. The cons notwithstanding, this hotel deserves its high tripadvisor rank since it provides a lot of value for the money to travelers who are looking to explore the city, especially for the first time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Jsforbes
Reviews.Content: Have told our friends and parents about this hotel and would stay here again. Very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great staff and quiet location”
Reviews.Author: WilliC010
Reviews.Content: I originally booked the Residence Foch because of its proximity to the Palais des Congres, where I was attending a conference. Having stayed there for a week, I found the hotel so pleasant that I would return no matter what the reason for being in Paris. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is on a quiet side street so sleep is not disturbed by traffic noises. My room was very clean, not small by European standards, and nicely decorated. The free wifi and air conditioning were a welcome bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: FloridaSmiths
Reviews.Content: Returned again this year to one of our favorite Hotels, the Hotel Residence Foch. We have stayed at the Residence Foch many, many times and consider it to be the best value in Paris. It is located in a very nice residential neighborhood located near several embassies. Residence Foch is convenient to the Paris Metro and the Bus Lines (On Avenue de la Grande Armee you can catch Bus 73 for a stunning tour around the Arc de Triomphe all the way down the the Champs-Élysées to Place Vendome on over to Musee d'Orsay. The rooms in the hotel are very quite, comfortable and well decorated with WIFI in every room and good HVAC for hot summer days. The baths are nice and well equipped. The breakfasts are excellent. There are many very good restaurants in all price ranges nearby as well as a convenient grocery store. Most of all Owner/manager Nell has an experienced, first rate staff on hand at all times who are very cordial and most accommodating. Don't miss the Hotel Residence Foch! The Smiths Florida USA .

Reviews.Title: “lovely quaint hotel with warm and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Jigbon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in late June. Hot weather plus.We liked the location and the ambience.This is a three star hotel with good quality breakfast, not elaborate but certainly containing enough food including fresh fruit salad which was hard to find in other hotels. The reception staff were very warm and helpful.We were lucky to have a larger room and it had a nice balcony and small but comfortable bedroom.The shower didn't have a place to hang the nozzle above bath height which made showering a tad difficult but the bath room itself at least had some room to it. We did notice that one of the rooms we peaked into was quite small and compact and were glad we didn't get that one as it would have been too squashed for us. The hotel was close to a couple of metro stations and also had some nice restaurants around there although we find Parisian food very creamy,oily and overwhelming.The concierge / manager recommended some restaurants for us but we weren't very pleased with them.One thing to note in Paris.Do the free guided walking tours undertaken by a Parisian .They are fantastic value and well worth the time.Very informative and have a peak at the real Paris. Info is available on the web The hotel is reasonable stroll to the Arc de Triomphe and the Gardins Tuleries down the Champs Elyseees. Overall this was a lovely hotel and for those looking for more homely three star in a reasonable distance of the centre give this a go.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying with old friends.”
Reviews.Author: ratty7
Reviews.Content: My husband, teenage daughter and I have just returned from a 3 week trip to Europe. During that time we stayed at 9 different hotels ranging from 3 to 5 star and I have to say that the Hotel Residence Foch stood head and shoulders above the rest. The main reason being Nelly, the owner and her wonderful staff. There was nothing that was too much trouble... From organising laundry to giving us very specific help on getting to and from various places, the team at Hotel Residence Foch were amazing. They really made us feel welcome and important! The location of the hotel is a 5 minute walk from the Arc de Triomphe away from the Champs Elysees but it is still only 20 to 25 minutes walk away from the Trocadero and is in a lovely suburban area with many brasseries and restaurants in easy reach. The metro is close by and having been too scared to catch trains last time I was in Paris, Nelly talked me through it and made it very easy. I now love the Metropolitain! Our room was clean and large for a European room but it was a family room. We had a separate area for our daughter with a heavy curtain dividing the 2 rooms. The servicing of the room was excellent and they leave more than enough amenities - shampoo etc, for all in the bathroom. Breakfast is not included and is around 13 euro which I thought was a bit expensive but it is such a pleasure to be sitting in the sunny breakfast room chatting with the staff and the food, though limited, was delicious - croissants, pastries, cereals, boiled eggs plenty of hot coffee that it was well and truly worth it. Not a bad start to the day! I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough and can see why it is in the top ten of Tripadvisor's hotels in Paris. Don't expect the Georges V. Think of it more as staying with old friends.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, quiet hotel with excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: bpspring
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a quiet area within Paris to stay and need some guidance and direction with any and all concerns, Hotel Residence Foch is the place to stay. There were many times we needed assistance with tickets, directions, meals, and the staff were more than happy to assist us, especially Chedi! He went out of his way to make us feel welcome in a very different world. At no time did I feel unsafe, even walking in the neighborhood late at night. The free computer use and wifi were a plus for all too! The hotel itself is not plush or extravagant, but extremely clean and quaint. I will miss looking out the window each morning to a lovely view of Paris while hearing to pigeons coo. Thank you Hotel Residence Foch, for a wonderful experience...

Reviews.Title: “Adequate stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: honesttripreviewer
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the great reviews on Trip Advisor and the fact they had a family room that could accomodate 4. It may not be totally fair for us to review since we have not stayed in other Paris hotels to compare this to. But, there still may be some value of my family's perception of the hotel. This is a small hotel. It is on a quiet out of the way street which I think is a good thing. It is less than a 10 minute walk to the metro station. There was one unbelievable employee there named Cheti that might rate as one of the most willing to help hotel staff I have ever met. Wish he had been there during more of our trip. We had some language barrier issues with staff on duty for most of our stay. The hotel was able to recommend restaurants in the area and helped with getting taxis. All of these things were positive for us. Our issues were that the internet did not work well in the rooms, so we did have to use the laptops in the lobby. The breakfast was less than what we might have liked. Again, what they offered may be standard for Paris. We also thought the rooms and the hotel in general were a little dated and dark. It was clean and well taken care of, but just old fashioned. If you are looking for a clean place to sleep in a safe area at a reasonable price for Paris, this might be exactly what you are looking for. We don't necessarily regret our stay here, but would likely look for alternatives when we visit again. I would probably go 3.5 stars on this one.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, and very helpful”
Reviews.Author: SpacemanAlbuquerque
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in late June and I highly recommend it. The people were very friendly and patient, showing us places to see and eat. The rooms were bright and clean. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Where else in Paris can you wake up only hearing the sound of doves?”
Reviews.Author: Steve154943
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned to Vancouver from a week in Paris, staying at the Hotel Foch. We discovered this small but very professionally run inn via Trip Advisor. Only great things to say about everything from staff to rates and everything in between. I travel for business about 20 weeks a year and know a good value when I see it. Hotel Foch is the little secret place you expect only to find after your fourth or fifth trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “All 3 star hotels should be like this.”
Reviews.Author: ajordell
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights with girlfriend. Exceeded my expectations for a three star hotel, although the rooms are fairly small when two guests have one large suitcase each. Friendly staff, good location, very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A charming, immaculate, well-located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Far-flung73
Reviews.Content: We stayed three days and were delighted with hotel, the neighborhood and the easy access, via metro, to all parts of Paris. The room was very clean, spacious and comfortable. The staff was friendly if not the most informative about planning sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely would stay at this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: cia2travel
Reviews.Content: The Residence Foch is a nice quiet hotel within walking distance to the metro and the RER stations (Porte Maillot). The superior rooms are spacious, the breakfast has everything one needs to start happily a day in Paris and the staff is incredibly friendly. Thanks to Nelly, Isabel, Chedi and all the others in the staff we felt at home at the Residence Foch.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely comfortable Hotel with Superb friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: priscillapurple
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had a lovely stay here 15th-18th June. We stayed in the 'Blue room' with a balcony which has Eiffel tower view (top half of the tower). The room was a very good size and the bathroom gorgeous. Bed very comfortable. Also was a great advantage to have tea/coffee making facilities. The staff are so friendly and welcoming, nothing was too much trouble. Isabelle and Chedi are really nice and always available to give you a map/ directions / retstaurant recommendations. It was lovely to have very courteous staff that are very interested in their guests. On the day of check out Isabelle and Chedi offered us to leave our luggage the whole day (until 6pm) without any charge which was a big help. The hotel is approx 10-15 mins walk from the metro however easy walking distance to Arc de Triomphe. Also recommend a Fixed price dinner (38 Euro for 3 courses + Wine and coffee) at Bistro Saint Ferdinand. Really impressed with hotel as it has a great homely, welcoming feel and such friendly staff. Would recommend to any Paris visitor.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel. fab staff”
Reviews.Author: tripper038
Reviews.Content: just retuned from 7 nights at "residence foch", it,s all been said before,butonce again; a really nice small hotel with a great staff. many thanks to Nelly, Isabelle,& all the others that were only too ready to help with advice & suggestions. only criticism is that its a bit far out from the center. but again not that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, OK location”
Reviews.Author: tangiwai
Reviews.Content: Pros: extremely friendly staff, clean rooms, OK size for Parisian standards, large bathroom, free wifi Cons: not best location for sightseeing, breakfast is not included and expensive, some noise at night from street and corridor. Nearest decent bakery is a 10 min walk away Other: situated halfway between Porte Dauphine and Porte Maillot metro stations, about 10 mins walk to either one. Air France bus line 2 also stops at Porte Maillot if you're going to/from the airport. Closest major site is the Arc de Triomphe / Champs Elysees, other sites will require a metro ride. Overall OK hotel but might not recommend to friends only because of the location. Probably good for a business hotel as there seems to be a trade or convention centre of some sort in Porte Maillot

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in the 16th”
Reviews.Author: wtmarks
Reviews.Content: This was our fifth trip to Paris, and for a number of reasons we wanted to stay in the 16e. Based upon the reviews of many Trip Advisor reviewers, we chose the Hotel Residence Foch. We were rewarded with a wonderful stay. From the moment we arrived, we knew the service was going to be outstanding. We were warmly welcomed and made to feel right at home. Our room, number 61, was large by Paris standards and had a small balcony. The bed was quite comfortable and housekeeping was very efficient. The bathroom was small but had a bath/shower combo with a glass curtain to keep water from being sprayed all over the bathroom. Each floor had its own wifi signal. Even though we were on the sixth floor, the fifth floor signal came in the strongest to my iPod. There is a small elevator that stops between the fifth and sixth floors, with an easy ten step climb to the landing for our room. The hotel is very nice but it's the staff that makes it outstanding. Nelly and her staff, especially Chedi and Isabelle made our stay so wonderful. Chedi was very helpful with dining reservations and transportation advice and always had a cheerful "bonjour" at our coming and going. Nelly is the heart of the hotel. She takes a personal interest in each one of her guests and would feel personally responsible if any of them had a bad experience. My wife had a minor medical problem and had to stay in the room two of the days we were there. Nelly personally delivered tea to the room with her kind best wishes. The neighborhood is very safe, probably not coincidentally because the German Embassy is at the end of the block. There are many restaurants nearby, including a small Chinese/Thai restaurant, Italian (Del Papa), Chez George, Saint Ferdinand, Le Congres and others Chedi recommended that we didn't have a chance to try. Also nearby is a small market, a patisserie, fromagerie and boulangerie. If you need a bank, there is a BNP Paribas several blocks away. Transportation is also close by; the bus is 2-3 blocks away and the Metro 8 or so blocks. We easily walked to Roland Garros, the Marmottan, the Champs Elysees and Bois de Bologne. We spent a wonderful nine nights here and I thank all Trip Advisors who recommended this hotel to us. If you need to stay in the heart of Paris, this hotel will be a little far out for you, although the number 1 Metro line is close by and stops at or near many of the most popular attractions. However, if you are willing to sacrifice being in the middle of everything for a quiet, safe neighborhood and a very comfortable hotel with the best service you'll find in Paris at a very reasonable price, by all means stay at the Hotel Residence Foch!!!

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: meirn
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located 5 minutes from the main line of Metro, in a quite & safe neighbourhood. The staff is very friendly and helpfull. The rooms are very clean, well decorated and well maintained, even though a bit small. We had a very pleasant stay and we recommend this hotel without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit as good as the first”
Reviews.Author: retiredplodabroad
Reviews.Content: We came to this hotel four years ago for our 40th anniversary, this on the advice of a UK newspaper article, the recomendation was spot on & we had a wonderful stay in February, Our return this May 2010 with friends, primerily for the Heinekin Cup rugby final, did not disapoint us or our travelling companions. We had a wonderful time, Nelly & her staff as always so welcoming, & going back again was just like seeing old friends.Nelly informed me the hotel is to be refurbished , hopefully next year, but as it is now, still a lovely & safe place to stay. Nothing is too much trouble for them & the location for us is superb. We will re visit again in the near future, most likely with our grandaughter for a Euro Disney visit.Once you find a gem of a hotel, I feel it pays to keep with it.. Les & Pauline Wilkinson, Hereford, UK

Reviews.Title: “Nice people!”
Reviews.Author: Tatak1
Reviews.Content: Following lots of TripAdvisor reviews, we booked this hotel through booking.com and had a very nice experience. The staff was very helpful in suggesting places for us to go, maps and so on. There is a Carrefour city near it, open until 23h I guess, which is very convenient. A 20-min walk to the Metro station, not the perfect location but nice enough if the weather is good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price with courteous service”
Reviews.Author: redvic0
Reviews.Content: There were seven women in our group. We had two of the superior double rooms and one family room for three. While the rooms were small they were sufficient for our luggage and shopping bags after a week in Provence. It is in a quite area, off the beaten path and very safe which was important. Metro stops close by, cab from Eiffel to hotel 16 Euro, split three ways. None of the ladies had any complaints about noise. Great shopping in Nuilly about a 15 min walk NW of the hotel. Sorry we missed it's Sunday market. I think the courteous and pleasant staff make up for anything that might be lacking. Oh, the beds were very comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Do not leave valuables in your room”
Reviews.Author: mikeg51
Reviews.Content: I had checked into this hotel during the airspace shutdown in Europe. Upon checking in I had found the room safe was locked. I had an expensive camera that I did not want to leave unattended/outside a safe. The staff provided a master key that was still unable to open the safe. When I asked them if they would keep my camera in a hotel safe at the front desk they insisted that I leave it in my room and it was perfectly safe. Upon my return to my room a few hours later my camera was gone. Only the hotel staff had the room keys as they keep them when you leave. The door was locked with my camera in the room - you do the math. The room was also on the second floor of the hotel, and the hotel insuror noted that the theft 'may have come through the window'. See attached photo, someone climbing in is very, very unlikely. Maybe not such a safe place to stay if someone can enter the second floor rooms anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service but location not ideal for us!”
Reviews.Author: JCLGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Like most people who have been to this hotel you have to say the staff are very friendly and helpful. For us the hotel was in too quiet an area, we stayed before in the Latin quarter which was much livelier if that is what you are looking for. If you are flying with Ryanair it is a good choice of hotel as the bus to the airport leaves very near by but if you are going to CDG airport it is a longer trek. We also found the hotel very noisy, the cupboard outside our room was obviously the cleaners store cupboard and in constant use from around 7am! The room was also very small but I think this is probably typical of Parisian hotels.

Reviews.Title: “There are actually nice people in Paris! And a lovely hotel as well.”
Reviews.Author: melishore_10
Reviews.Content: Based on tripadvisor reviews, decided to stay here for 2 nights. The staff is incredible - willing to give us recommendations (without ever feeling they were pushy), called us a cab, etc. Just generally concerned about making sure we had a good time. Rooms are very clean - I found them to be typical European size. Location is good - very quiet area but right near major street and nice short walk to Arc One warning on the location - we took the air france bus which was "close by" - it was technically but too far of a walk if you have large bags. I think the cab on the way back to the airport was about 45 euros (while the bus was 15 each/24 roundtrip) which works fine if there is more than 1 person. They also have free wifi and 2 computers in the lounge you can use. I wouldnt call this a place for a romantic getaway per se - but wonderful for what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: KentHippolyte
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Residence Foch is a delightful small hotel in a quiet area near to the Bois de Boulogne. The rooms are well appointed with the added boon for travellers of a courtesy tray. Would that more hotels had them. The staff are both pleasant and helpful. Guests are able to enjoy a good breakfast buffet. If one is making a return visit to the hotel then one is welcomed as an old friend. Nelly, the proprietor, is a gracious host.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and cosy hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Kipraios
Reviews.Content: Everyone has stated it before. The staff are some of the friendliest customer service people I've met, the rooms are quaint and decent. Breakfast is simple but with all the options I need, location is perfect to direct Metro routes to anywhere, Arc de Triumph - Notre Dame - Latin Quarter - Montmarte - Montparnasse - La Defense. Great little grocery store around the corner and enough options to eat close by. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families”
Reviews.Author: funtravel5389
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The family rooms are perfect for traveling with young children. The staff is very accomodating and helped up with directions, restaurant suggestions. The location is great if you want to stay in a quiet, off the beaten path but still be close to access all the action. We loved this place and would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hospitality in Paris”
Reviews.Author: mermaidUK
Reviews.Content: This hotel could not have been friendlier, cleaner or more perfectly located. We travelled with a baby and this hotel made it a very easy and pleasant experience. We will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely friendly quiet and delightful hotel tucked away in 16th arrond.”
Reviews.Author: fckopCOWkpdc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel residence foche for the 2010 paris marathon; great location for the marathon. The hotel has the genuinely friendliest staff I have ever encountered; they even had a little buffet post-marathon with juices and biscuits to welcome back the runners and put on a great breakfast in the morning before the event. It is a quiet area so not necessarily for anyone wanting to stay in a buzzing area. Our deluxe room was a good size and had a balcony (but hardly what one expects a "deluxe" room will look like -- I can imagine the standard rooms being very small (but then that is usually the case in Paris). Very good wifi connection.

Reviews.Title: “Revised My Review”
Reviews.Author: skytalker15
Reviews.Content: After 4 nights at this hotel, I feel compelled to update my review of this hotel. The staff member that was working the front desk when I check in was new and not representative of the hotel's standard for high quality service. I commented on the service we recieved and he is no longer employed. Nelly, the Hotel manager has been fantasic. She has been so helpful and accomadating with my famlily. I would stay here again because of her.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: droberts67
Reviews.Content: After a recent stay I can agree on the hospitality and helpfulness of staff as many have noted here. The location is excellent with metro close by as well as a grocery store- helpful for packing snacks and such for day trips the rooms were tidy but if I may make a recommendation as someone else here has done - please install a rack and curtain for the handheld shower in the balcony room. Every am was an exercise in trigonometry to avoid showering down the whole bathroom. That is not enough of a ding toskd me not tecommed this hotel. All in all it delivered what was promised and we were quite pleased overall

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay with great staff”
Reviews.Author: sloheff
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our trip to London and Paris. We stayed at Hotel Residence Foch based on the great reviews in Trip Advisor and were not disappointed. The hotel in clean and on a quiet street. The rooms are very nice and the staff is wonderful. We had a bike tour scheduled on a day that was quite rainy and they took care of rescheduling this for us, even though it was short notice. We lost a credit card while there and they did everything needed to call the restaurant where we thought we lost it and to help us contact the credit card company. They made great recommendations about local restaurants and things to do. We could not have been more pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in Paris - wonderful family atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: zaals
Reviews.Content: We were in Paris together for 4-days without our young children - to celebrate my significant birthday. We loved Paris and the hotel staff made our stay all the more special. If we go to Paris again, we will definitely stay there - also if we take our children because they also have family rooms - we would be very happy there again. Thank you so much!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: Flip78
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for 2 nights in the Hotel Residence Foch after reading the reviews on TA. We were very happy with the hotel and have already recommended it to one of our friends who have booked to stay this month. All the staff are exceptionally friendly and can't do enough to help you, be it lunch or dinner recommendations or directions to various sites. The room was spacious but it was the bathroom that sold it to me. We have stayed in Paris before and felt the rooms were very small, but not in the Foch. The bathroom was massive and very light. Our room was at the back over looking the garden. The breakfast in very nice and enough to fill you up for a day sight seeing. My other half doesn't normally like breakfast but even he liked it. It is a little bit out of the main drag but an easy stroll from the Metro station. We walked from the hotel down to the Arc De Triumphe which was a short pleasant walk. Lovely also to eat around the corner (ask at reception for the restaurant with the 37 Euro fixed price menu - for Paris prices you can't beat it!) After dinner we strolled down to see the Arc de Triumphe all lit up - very romantic!! Can't say enough about this hotel and the friendly staff -Thank you Nelly and her team!!

Reviews.Title: “friendly, comfortable, convienient and resonably priced”
Reviews.Author: swisscheese4me
Reviews.Content: Very conviently located just 5 minutes walk from the metro or 10 mins to walk to the Arc de Triomphe. Rooms comfortable and the staff very friendly with lots of tips of places to eat. Quiet area. Good covergae around the hotel of the free Wifi - very useful. We also parked for free just on the road outside the hotel (charges only apply weekdays).

Reviews.Title: “Friendly comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: malaykah
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights with our 18 month old. As has been mentioned- the staff couldn't have been more friendly or helpful. They had suggestions for things to do with our young son and went out of their way to get him settled in for breakfast. The breakfast was adequate; I liked everything but felt the price was a little high for what you get. But the convenience made it worth it. It was very cold while we were there so we took cabs a lot more than we would've liked so I can't comment too much on location as it was so cold that everything felt far! As for the rooms: they are older but comfortable. I don't think they did a great job with cleaning them every day. It felt more like they just straightened up. It is also very loud in the rooms if the people in the room above are moving at all. The floors are very creaky and you can hear the guests above you in the shower and the bathroom. The free wifi is also a great perk.

Reviews.Title: “Cheerful staff, failure to warn guests of criitical information, far from Paris center”
Reviews.Author: Glyncas
Reviews.Content: This is a cute though quite worn hote, located way too far away from the main action of Paris for a tourist with a long desolate walk at ll at night from the train but run by cheery smiling managers who, for directions to the subway and the neighborhood patisserie are quite competent. But on a day when the clocks have been changed their cheeriness serves no purpose. Although I told them of my flight this past Sunday, the 28 of March, asked them for information about getting to the airport, no member of the staff thought it necessary to tell me, a tourist who doesn't watch local TV announcements while visiting that the clocks had been turned one hour ahead, As I arrived at the airport one hour instead of two hours before the flight, the gate was closed and I missed my flight, had to rebook at substantial cost to me, miss a day of work,, etc., stay an extra night in a hotel. This could have been avoided if they had taken the time, as other hotels I am told do, to give guests a notice of the clock change. This is essential for people who make various reservations while visiting a city.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: 760i
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in room 61 (de luxe) for 4 nights in march 2010. The staff is extremely friendly and gives you every information you ask for, in addititon to some secret ones ;-) The lift is tiny, but nice to have, because the stairs are quite steep and narrow. Our room was spotless clean and very comfortable. I think the size is over a Paris average. The free Wifi is also very nice to have when away from home. The area is very safe and calm with many embassies in the neighbourhood. There are a lot of good rstaurants close to the hotel. We had a nice stay in this Hotel Residence Foch and would certanly like to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice if unspectacular”
Reviews.Author: Kevlondon
Reviews.Content: Booked here for a one-night business trip based solely on its high TripAdvisor rating. I wanted a room with a balcony as I'm a smoker, and so I booked a deluxe double for €180, including wifi. The owner gave a very friendly welcome, and assigned me to room 71 - at the top of the building, and apparently his favourite room. the tiny lift rattled up to the 6th floor, and I had to continue up the stairs from there. It's worth noting that perhaps half the rooms in this hotel can only be accessed by climbing or descending some stairs due to the lift depositing you midway between floors - worth considering if you are less mobile or have lots of baggage. The room itself was large by Paris standards, with a good-sized bathroom. Decor was quaint, and certainly more interesting than a chain hotel. Furnishings were of reasonable quality and a small desk was available. Entertainment consists of a small flat-screen TV, but no radio or alarm clock. Balcony was big enough for a couple of chairs and a table, and the whole room overlooked the quiet courtyard. My only complaint about the room was the lack of a proper shower. Instead it was bathtaps with a shower head connected - no hook to hang the shower head, and no curtain. I really don't understand why hotels do this - surely it just means the floor getting drenched every morning?? But for this, I may have given the hotel 5 stars. There was a good selection of newspapers both morning and evening, and breakfast was fine if a little limited - no hot food, unless you want to boil your own eggs. Overall a nice enough experience - well situated for my work, and at only 5 minutes' walk from a line 1 metro station, ideal for a tourist stay in a quiet and safe neighbourhood. There's a small Carrefour supermarket just around the corner on Avenue de Malakoff that's open til 11pm, and plenty of restaurants within moments of the hotel. I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: StirB
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel, with amazingly helpful staff. It is also excellent value, and its location as a 3 min walk from Port Maillot metro / Champs Elysées is very convenient for getting out and about to all of the main tourist attractions in Paris. Didn't have breakfast there, but the dining room looked well appointed and clean. Staff were happy to speak in French or English. One other nice touch, complimentary newspapers in English, French, German and a nice chill-out lounge / reception / bar area was nice to come back to and sip a G&T after a long day's sightseeing! Would fully recommend this hotel as part of a romantic or sightseeing weekend, it encapsulates the warm, chic feel of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: CoffeeParis
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely helpful with dinner and sightseeing suggestions. The hotel is located about 7 min from the train station and restaurants, which is great. In addition, the walk is nice, in a safe area. I totally recommend this hotel for a cozy getaway. Do not expect luxury and spacious rooms, but this is crowded Paris, and for the value, it's a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed and pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: magidero
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and found all the staff very welcoming and helpful and would definately recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: ParoLondon
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Residence Foch. The staff were all friendly and we had a pleasant and relaxed time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel & service!”
Reviews.Author: Exkwisit
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 2 nights stay at Hotel Residence Forch and were surprised by the great service and the complete hotel. The congierge helps everybod with pleasant Paris imsider hints for trips & places to see. The hotel looks as nice and romantic in its typicall french style like it does on their webpage. We'll be back. From March 2010

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for those with a budget”
Reviews.Author: Huckatola
Reviews.Content: I am currently writing this review from the reception area at the Hotel Residence Foch using the free wifi service. The hotel is located in a side street close the route 1 & 2 metro links, which can be used for access to the centre of Paris or the North of Paris, where the Gare du Nord Eurostar station is situated. The location is not too bad and sits close to a number of embassies so you know the security will be pretty good. The area feels pretty safe. We booked a stay based on the reviews in TripAdvisor and paid just Euro90 for one night (room only). The last time we were in Paris we stayed in a hotel that was nearly Euro300 per night so was expecting a huge difference. To be honest the room was a little on the small side but is was clean and had a TV, kettle, safe (free to use) and a powerful shower !!!! The bed was comfortable, quite wide (compared to some hotels) and extra bedding was available in the wardrobe. We did not eat in the hotel but there was a small restaurant next to the reception on the ground floor. We stayed on the first floor at the front of the building facing the road. Despite this, noise was not a problem as the street is not particularly busy. Access to all floors is by stairs or lift (big enough for two with luggage). The staff in the hotel are very good (especially Chedi on the reception desk during the day) and have lots of tips and ideas for you to consider for your stay. In fact, unlike some other hotels, you get a sense that the reception staff really care about making sure you sample the very best of the city. There is nothing bad to report at this hotel. To be honest, for the price, you can't really go wrong with booking this hotel. Happy holidays !!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: APL83
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel 3 nights for business meetings in Paris. The standard rooms are quite filled with the kingsized bed, yet there is still place for comfortable stylish desk - supplemented by free wifi. Bathroom is spacious and just right. Breakfeast is excellent - both choice, quality and quantity. Service is also remarkable, as is the cleaning. Had very useful help in getting transportation, and tolerance with late checkout. Bottom line - if you can live without the oppulance of a top chain hotel and want a cost effective place to sleep, your at the right place.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, now the only place I'll stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: DaveHkg
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff; excellent local advice, great location and the best value for money in Paris. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “First time in Paris? DO try this one!”
Reviews.Author: adin_beduin
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, friendly service, good value for the money. Oh, and quiet. We definitely recommend it for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Perfect! Thanks from Kim & Ray!”
Reviews.Author: Syvret87
Reviews.Content: This hotel was literally perfect for our three night stay in Paris. As soon as we arrived we had a warm welcome by the night staff and an overwhelming amount of knowledge about Paris and where is best to go in such a short trip. This was brilliant trying to pick where to visit and when. Their restaurant reccomendations were also fab! They even booked a table for us for one evening. The housekeeping were also very friendly, helpful and always left our room spotless when we got back in the evening. It is not at all far from the metro station Porte Dauphine and a leisurely walk to the Champs Elysee, Arc de Triumphe and Eiffel Tower. Overall, we had a wonderful stay and would like to thank everyone at Residence Foch for helping us have such a wonderful stay. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “So friendly and helpful - would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: MelanieRykens
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel. Friendly staff who always are ready and willing to help. Take their recommendation on restaurants - amazing quality and good value. Will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: mrsbinney
Reviews.Content: Hotel Focjh is a simple hotel that does lots of important things very well. We had a wonderful stay and would not hesitate to recommend it to friends and family. What makes the hotel so special is the quality of service. Nelly and her team were friendly and incredibly helpful; nothing was too much trouble. They gave a number of restaurant recommendations (Auberge Dab and La Villa Corse were both very close by, great value and fabul;ous meals) and ideas on how to spend the day. The room was simple, but spotless and tastefully decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, very quiant and pretty decor.”
Reviews.Author: vik_n_miks_trips
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed for Valentines weekend. We booked a deluxe double but were upgraded to family room at no charge! We love this hotel! Here is our review... Good points: 1. Outstanding service, every staff member was extremely friendly and went out of their way to help us in any way possible, including sightseeing advice. 2. Room decor & reception area were very pretty & homely. 3. Clean and tidy hotel. 4. Good location - Close to two metro stations & around the corner from Arc du Triumph. 5. Rooms & bathroom were surprisingly large by parisian standards (family room) Bad Points: 1. Our double bed was two single beds pushed together, so there was a small gap between them. 2. Shower worked great, but not as luxurious as the photos on the website. Bad points are very minor and would not stop us going to this hotel again. The staff were the selling point as they were so helpful and friendly. I love the tiny lift, so cute! (Even though hard to get into with luggage!) LOVE this hotel and would definitely go back again. Definitely reccommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: tomsuebrown
Reviews.Content: The service was exemplary. Everyone was so helpful and fun. We asked for a quiet hotel and that was what we got. We could hear no traffic at all and slept very well. The down side of that is of course it is away from the hub eg the Latin quarter. The bathroom was clean and the water hot. The fittings modern. The room was rather small but this is Paris so was expected. Will return again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with fantastic location and even better staff”
Reviews.Author: damonaustralia
Reviews.Content: Travelled here with two friends, and were extremely impressed with the hotel. Large, clean rooms serviced every day and the friendliest and most knowledgeable staff I have experienced in any hotel, including five star. A short walk to major attractions and located in a quiet, up market area of Paris. The staff not only helped us out with Paris attractions and personal restaurant recommendations, but also kept us up to date on news back home in Australia. They were also happy to help people learn French and nothing was too much trouble. A true gem and I will most definitely return when I have the pleasure of visiting Paris again!

Reviews.Title: “A truly outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: RomanRemains
Reviews.Content: In a city full of at best average hotels, this hotel is truly outstanding. Nelly and her team understand that the key thing that makes for a good hotel (basics things being covered of course!) is how they treat you as a person. If you stay here, you feel like you are a truly valued guest. For those who understand customer relationships, you will appreciate the eye contact, the smile, the walking out from behind the counter (to remove the barrier), the question "is everything OK?' whenever they see you. The practical advice is simply tremendous and the help we received from Chadi in planning our 3 day stay was simply superb and really made us get the best from our break. The room was very good - a bit on the small side, but generous for Paris. Everything was clean and in good order and there was plenty of space to hang up clothes etc. A few practical tips - and if Nelly and the team are reading this then please take this as constructive comment! 1. Unless you eat a lot for breakfast, then its much easier to go to the Pattiserie at the corner of Rue Pergolese and Malakoff (a two minute walk) where they sell wonderful Butter Croissants for 1 Euro and also have a counter service for coffee (at 1.50 Euro a cup). My suggestion to the hotel - have an "Express Breakfast" option of Coffee and One Croissant for say 5 Euros and the "full help youself service" for 13 Euro. 2. Do not use the map that's currently featured on the hotel's web site - you will get lost! I'd suggest you use google maps but most importantly of all as you arrive at the Port Dauphine Metro station DO NOT leave the platform without checking that the entrance you are about to take is for "Bd de l'Admiral Bruix". Leave by any other exit and you will be in trouble! If you are travelling to Port Maillot leave by the "Malakoff" exit (again check when you are still on the platform). 3. Don't expect to be able to watch CNN - the connection keeps breaking up. Bloomberg is just fine though. One very minor point "BBC Entertainment" (the lst of the 3 English langiage channels) is no good if you are from the UK as its full or repeats about 4 years old. BBC World or BBC News would be a better bet - but hey, who spends much time in their hotel room with so many wonderful sights and restaurants around! A radio station (music) of some kind would be good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay In Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Big_R1981
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel solely on its reviews on Trip Advisor and was not disappointed. I am not really one for essay type reviews so I will keep it simple Excellent location, only 5 minutes from two convenient Metro stations. Really friendly staff fluent in English who were willing to make great restaurant recommendations. We stayed in the double deluxe room which had lots of little Parisian features making it even nicer! The only minor point I would make is that the cleaners started at 0800 meaning less sleep than ideal! But we can forgive them that, as the rest of the place more than made up for it!

Reviews.Title: “Feeling good”
Reviews.Author: Miktravel
Reviews.Content: Nice retreat for a city break - if you are looking for a nice, comfortable, pleasant place ... here we are! Nicely located near the end of the Champs Elyssee, walking distance to Tour Eifel etc. But most outstanding: service and attention by Nelly and her team are remarkable: they make you feel welcome and being a guest in their home! You have a question ... you get an answer. So - time we spent there we always felt very very good! Its in a residencial area, so you have (down-to-earth) shops, coffee bars, restaurants etc. nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Staff. Amazing Hotel. Worth Revisting!”
Reviews.Author: Rheadieuk
Reviews.Content: When we arrived in Paris, the Air France shuttle bus dropped us off at the the Arc de Triomphe. Residence Foch took a bit of searching to find. However, a few turns later and we were there. From the second we arrived, the staff were fantastic. Helpful, charming and always eager to offer advice if ever you need any. They recommend a number of great restaurants and in particular a bar which offers a spectacular viewpoint for looking over Paris at night. The staff at Residence Foch were simply exceptional. The staff were also keen to help with transport advice such as the metro and RER system which turned out to be fairly easy to navigate. The room itself was lovely. The bedroom was big enough to accommodate both myself and my girlfriend without feeling restrictive at all, and the bathroom was far bigger than we expected. It was very clean and excellent value. Anyone who is considering a trip to Paris should most certainly give Residence Foch a try. The next time we visit Paris we won't hesitate staying at Residence Foch a second time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Personal Service”
Reviews.Author: Panna
Reviews.Content: The friendly team at the Residence Foch Hotel, made our weekend they were great, they drew all over a map for us all the things we wanted to know. The walk to the metro was approx 5 minutes (Porte Maillot) and Arc de Triomphe and Champs-Elysees were within easy walking distance to. Residence Foch hotel is located in 16th district of Paris, very residential but with choice of restaurants and coffee shops around. Our room was comfortable and cosy plus very clean. The only negative I can think of is it was a little noise early in the morning on the hall/landing sometimes, saying that we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: BritInTheMidWest
Reviews.Content: This is not a boutique hotel and the room I had was very small. But it was one of the best hotels I have every stayed in in terms of service and personal attention from the staff. I would highly recommend this hotel as a base to explore Paris, it is relatively close to the Metro, RER and the shuttle to Beauvais.

Reviews.Title: “Someone to care about you”
Reviews.Author: criancadodeus
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel. We selected it based upon the reviews from tripadvisor and were pleased with our stay. The hotel was clean and located in a very protected part of Paris. You cannot never go wrong with a variety of Embassy Guards! Metro stations were a 10 minutes walk way and the neighborhod was fun to explore. Fancy apartments, interesting parks and of course all of the diplomatic sites. However, the best part was the service. The hotel staff did everything possible to ensure we had a great stay and that we really took the time to visit Paris. Instructions on the train and Metro were great as well as suggestions where to eat. The best part was people asked what you wanted to do and then provided guidance based upon your preferences. We really felt that we were home away from home and would go back there.

Reviews.Title: “3 star hotel with 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: Henry_Morton_Stanley
Reviews.Content: Small (25 rooms), conveniently situated in a safe, well-regarded area of the city. Easily accessible on Air France Coach 2 from Paris CDG airport (35-45 mins). 3 star hotel with 5 star service. 5 minutes walk from 2 metro stations - Porte Maillot and Porte Dauphine. Friendly, attentive and knowledgeable staff especially Chedi who was a lovely character. 15-20 minutes walk from Arc de Triumphe and Champs Elysees. Clean, comfortable rooms. Lift to all floors. Nice bar/reception area with comfortable seating. Good value in an expensive city. Breakfast available. Selection of decent restaurants within 5-10 minutes walk. Good pizza and pasta at Del papa just around the corner. 3 tiny gripes. We were in 41. Guests above us we a bit noisy. Floors are a bit creaky but then it is an old building. Take ear plugs for a hassle-free sleep. Plenty of hot water for a relaxing bath but shower unit in room was weedy and could/should be improved. Not enough choice at breakfast. Toast (with selection of jams) would be a simple but welcome addition. Charge would be fairer at between 8 - 10 euros. 13 euros per person did not represent good value in my opinion and was a bit disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Very good residence type hotel”
Reviews.Author: dendo2
Reviews.Content: Great value for money in Paris: -Small but very clean rooms -Friendly staff -Charming hotel design -Great location Only problems are: -A little difficult to find the hotel. I recommend going by Taxi. The direction from the airport bus station was a little difficult. -Room was a little to cool even after adjusting the heaters

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Inviting with Top-Notch Service”
Reviews.Author: Bouzouki
Reviews.Content: Our stay there was made perfect not by luck but by design. There are many cute hotels in Paris but this one is special because of its owner and staff. You are instantly charmed by its warm and personable staff as much as the attractive surroundings. The hospitality comes from the heart and that's what makes it exceptional. We felt at ease and comfortable there while visiting Paris with our two children (13 and 11). HRF is tucked away in a posh-but-reserved neighborhood of city apartments and embassies. It is a short walk to Metro and the Ave des Grandes Armees (the Champs Elysee west of Arc de Triomphe). It has all the advantages of access while not being in the center. Paris is a very walkable city and this is as good a base. We walked all the way to Notre Dame. The Eiffel Tower is close, too. Our room (#30) was adequate size (large by European standards) and afforded a courtyard view. It was well-stocked and clean, had TV, WiFi, duvets, glasses, and minibar. The bath was large, having a tub with shower, large sink, toilet and bidet. The beds were very good. Breakfast was included for us. We found it delicious; considerably more generous than the standard continental breakfast. Breads, croissants, jams, cheeses, cereals, fresh fruits, eggs, yogurt, juices, coffee, tea, and more. It was constantly replenished and the tables were very clean. We ate like gluttons. We did not feel rushed. Jean-Louis and staff are the heart of this extremely capable operation. Every question, request, and special accommodation was cheerfully tackled. They even helped me resolve a mobile phone problem. We booked based on the rave Trip Advisor reviews. We did not go wrong. I highly recommend HRF. They are very competent and truly enjoy what they are doing.

Reviews.Title: “Very charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: cityhopperBelgium
Reviews.Content: We traveled with our kids (10 and 13) and booked a family room. The room was spacious, very clean and charming. The beds were very good. The hotel staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast is not extraordinary, but offers enough variety and our kids liked it. The hotel is well located: close to two metro/RER stations, on walking distance from the Eiffel tower and the Arc de Triomphe. The free internet worked well.

Reviews.Title: “The excellent reviews are all true, and deservedly so.”
Reviews.Author: ballagareyman
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading all the excellent reviews on trip advisor and in the press. I looked at cheaper hotels around the monmartre and paggalle area but after seeing those areas for ourselves I am glad I chose the Hotel Foch. It was a surprise trip for my wife's 40th birthday so it had to be right, and right it was! The staff were freindly and helpful, the rooms clean, spacious and very charming Parisiene in their decor. The location was good, we felt safe at night, especially important as we had our 8 year old daughter with us, there are excellent restaurants nearby ,all packed with locals including an Italian which served pizza which my daughter loved. Metro stations are a few minutes walk, one of which will take you straight to the louvre, ask the friendly staff for directions. As an added surprise, I arranged with my in-laws to stay at the same hotel. They were drinking coffee in the reception when we arrived, my wife and daughter loved it. My in-laws are more used to staying in much larger, grander hotels so I was worried they wouldn't like the Foch, but after staying a whole week there, they said they would definately stay there again. The next time we are in Paris, so will we.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Friendliest staff ever”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne076
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this hotel. We stayed in a family room. There was plenty of space for the 3 of us and all of our luggage, the rooms were nicely decorated, and the beds were very comfortable. What made the biggest impression on us, however, was the staff. From the moment we arrived, until the morning we checked out, everyone on staff was so friendly and helpful with whatever we needed. Nellie, the owner welcomed us and made us feel right at home. The young man working the reception desk the night before we checked out ( I'm sorry I didn't get his name) gave us an excellent recommendation for dinner, Le Relais de Venise. When we returned that evening he let us use a computer & printer to print out our boarding passes. The next morning when we checked out, he called a taxi for us, and even served us coffee while we were waiting. I will definitely stay at Hotel Residence Foch the next opportunity I have to visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A great weekend away... at a hidden gem ..”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveller16
Reviews.Content: There have been many comments about the staff - and they really do take an ordinary, quiet little hotel and turn it into something special ... please take the time to stop and chat to them as they will help you get so much more out of your trip , especially if you are unfamiliar with paris. We stayed on a 3 night break package for €130 / night for a standard double which i consider good for paris , the room was clean , compact but had everything you needed - but we looked in some of the family and deluxe rooms and they were much, much bigger. In general the hotel is well presented and clean , there is a little bar area and a breakfast room . I have stayed in nicer hotels , and cheaper hotels - but this is great value and so convenient in paris . The area is a quiet , safe and very smart residential area and a couple of embassies are on the same street. The hotel is a 5 mins walk from metro line 1 and RER Porte Maillot and around 10 mins to metro line 2 and RER at Porte Dauphine. It's 10 mins walk from the hotel up to the Arc de triomphe / Champs Elysees and 2 mins from the huge Park of Bois de bologne. There are many places to eat on the Ave grand Armee (5 min walk ) and around Porte maillot . But some can get expensive - best value was bistro San ferninand ( recomended and booked for us by Shadi the assistant manager) €38 for 3 courses with wine and a glass of champagne - but book early on a weekend as they were queueing out of the door when we left. The staff go out of there way to make sure you have a great time - they give great advice on booking restaurants , what to see and how best to plan your days to avoid the crowds ( and the weather) . Nothing sems to be too much trouble for them ... I hope one day to go back ( hopefully when the weather is a little better ! Thanks Nelly , Shadi and the team at HRF - we had a great time !!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: paguma
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel and I suspect the people who are disappointed are people who had unrealistic expectations based on it's high TripAdvisor rating. You have to keep in mind that it's a 3 star hotel and compared to other 3 star hotels it is excellent. Cons: - The metro is a bit of a walk. Not a mile as some people have suggested, but a decent walk. - The rooms aren't as noise proof as more modern hotels. Pros: - Price is good (at least it was for us) - Service is top notch. You will have as much help as you want. All the staff is very friendly and helpful. - location is good I would recommend this hotel to most people. I would not recommend it to older travelers with a lot of baggage unless you are prepared to use taxis. It's kind of a long trip to walk to with bags after a metro trip.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Ever !”
Reviews.Author: Krystal10
Reviews.Content: I Totally felt in love with Hotel Residence Foch, Everything is Perfect , rooms are great, Very Very Clean, Staff are Professional. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, will be back!”
Reviews.Author: clarabutt
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels in Paris but this is my new favourite, and it's hard to add anything new to the glowing recommendations here. The staff were so friendly, nothing was too much trouble. The room was bigger than average with a real bath in the bathroom - OK, not a full size bath, but still very welcome after a long day! The location was perfect, in a charming residential side-street, no street noise, less than ten minutes walk to the nearest Metro, a little further to l'Arc du Triomphe. I can't understand the few negative comments bemoaning that it is in a residential area and ten minutes from the Metro - if you want to be right in the centre of things, you inevitably pay for the privilege, not just in terms of the bill but with street noise from traffic, people, etc. Similarly we have been to places too close to Metro stations, where you can actually feel the vibration from the trains in the hotel!! Anyone who knows Paris knows that walking around the city is part of the experience, and this certainly is a nice neighbourhood to walk around.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Visit in Paris”
Reviews.Author: SisterSister2009
Reviews.Content: Thought that the hotel was cozy and the staff outgoing as well as very helpful. Optimal location if you don't mind walking and superb location if you are interested in getting around on the metro or catching the bus to the hotel. Would have preferred that breakfast was included in price but there are lots of places in Paris to eat so I did not find this to be a distractor. Rooms are small but typical european style. Would highly recommend. MHR

Reviews.Title: “I don't know why the rating is that high..thought it was a mistake”
Reviews.Author: lilahC
Reviews.Content: We had been to Paris three times. And we do know that the hotel is small and expensive in Paris. So when it comes to deciding on which hotel to stay, I came to this website. And this one was the top rated hotel so I booked it. I was really disappointed. We paid 200 Euro for a night (Breakfast was not included). And when we arrived at the hotel, it was in a residential area. I don't know why other reviews said its location is good as it's about 10 minutes walk to the metro. Also, this hotel is more like a bed and breakfast to me. We had a lot of luggages, and were hoping to have someone to help us. But we had to help ourselves. In the room, it's relatively big for Paris standard but the paint is chipping and the carpet was coming off and the light fixture was not being fixed.. The bathtub was clogged. We watched CNN for the whole duration of our stay and it was on and off.. the signal wasn't good as well as the internet connection. We wanted to switch hotel but didn't do it as we had too many luggages and since it was in a residential area, no taxi was avaiable and also the internet connection was so slow that we couldn't search for hotel. When we came home, I looked at a nearby hotel (think it was Best western). The rate was 170 Euro for a triple room and breakfast included. And even closer to metro. A decent hotel makes or break your vacation. I thought 200 Euro should at least be able to get a more modern room but ended up with huge disappointment. And the whole time we were wondering how did it become the top 5 hotel in Paris. I guess if you want a quiet hotel, this one will serve the purpose. But if you want to be closer to restaurants, metro or more tourists area. This is not gonna be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: vegasglobetrotter
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for 4 nights at the Residence Foch after reading reviews on trip advisor and a blog from the Traveling professor. I can't say enough good things about this charming boutique hotel near the Arc du Triomphe. It is in a quiet neighborhood with a market and pharmacy within 4 blocks and loads of good restaurants. One, Maestro Italiano on rue Pergolese, is one of the finest Italian restaurants I have ever eaten at. Chedi and his two lovely female co-workers were extremely nice and helpful with directions and recommendations for restaurants and other timely hints. The room was very spacious by European standards and my wife and grandaughter and I had a delightful stay. I will definitely stay here on my next trip to Paris and suggest it over all the cookie cutter large chain hotels. This place was like staying with old friends.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff makes the stay.”
Reviews.Author: lightpackers
Reviews.Content: Once the lights go out, you could be anywhere in Paris. What distinguishes Residence Foch from other hotels, is its people. When speaking with you, they come out from behind the desk and you are greeted on a one-to-one basis. Suggestions on transportation are given in great detail, restaurant recommendations are provided with offers to make reservations where appropriate. We dined at Ferdinand's based on both the staff's suggestion as well as previous postings. We were not disappointed. Once they ehard we were from the hotel, that opened doors on a Saturday night. By the time we left, there was a line of diners out onto the sidewalk. It is quite easy to use both the Metro and the RER, depending upon where you want to go. As always the Musee D'Orsay is a must and L'Orangerie as well, to see the Monets. We would recommend Residence Foch without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great neighborhood, great staff, good value for Paris”
Reviews.Author: mulliganidaho
Reviews.Content: Lots of convenient public trans, including CDG transfers. Staff truly welcoming. Would recommend for an authentic Parisian experience in the high-rent neighborhood. Nice reprieve from the hustle of Paris center whilst sill convenient. Only complaint: in room electric tea pot set up is really part of the minibar & the instant coffeeis E3.50 (@ $5.25US for a small cup of Nescafe). Room is larger than average Parisian-sized, & fresh & clean with free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Sunshine in Paris : Stay here!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Max S
Reviews.Content: Great location, great service and friendly people! Small rooms, but good size for Paris. Free Internet Manager was so warm and helpful i nicked named her "Sunshine". Hotel should be nominated as best deal in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: kaffyjaffy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very close to everything. The room was soooo cute. The staff was beyond friendly. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Service , Very Good Staff”
Reviews.Author: kouroshmo
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed there between 27 Sep. 01 Oct. 2009 . The location was good just 10 min. walking to Etoile , 15 min. to Eiffel Tower . It is just 200 meters to Porte Marriot Station . The hotel has very good staff that give you all useful information you need . Take Care Nelly , Yunes , ....

Reviews.Title: “like a great B&B in Paris”
Reviews.Author: econnyc
Reviews.Content: Foch was a great place to stay. the staff was very nice and eager to help. the only issue was a minor fuse blown due to the wife's hair dryer

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Positive Attitude in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: viptraveler
Reviews.Content: Residence Foch has great service and is a dependable place to stay in Paris. I recommend it highly!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Fred111
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at bigger hotels, newer hotels, and more expensive hotels, but we have never stayed at a hotel with as accomodating and friendly a staff. The staff went out of their way to ensure that we had a great visit in Paris. Our room, and the hotel as a whole, was absolutely spotless. Our room was good size and the bathroom was larger than I expected. We had a room with a balcony and it was nice to wake up in the morning, after a relaxing sleep, and stand on the balcony and have a view of a very peaceful street. The hotel is in a nice area with several very good restaurants very close. Two metro stations were within a 5 - 10 minute walk and we had no problem walking to the Eifel Tower our first night in town. While we only had breakfast one morning, it was very good. I can highly recommend this hotel to anyone and will stay at the Residence Foch on our next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “As promised”
Reviews.Author: IngridUSA
Reviews.Content: We found our stay very enjoyable. As suggested by others all staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is 4-5 blocks from both the Port Maillot and Port Dauphine Metro stations. Nelly had a requested bottle of Champaignwaiting. The rooms were somewhat older, but a very comfortable style and larger than expected. In addition to the subway, there are numerous moderate and higher priced restaurants within 5-10 minutes walk, including Le Relais de Venise - L'Entrecôte at Port Maillot.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastique!”
Reviews.Author: Gelyn
Reviews.Content: Small, charming hotel with perfectly delightly, incredibly helpful staff - Nelly, Mohamed, Isabel & Jean Claude were positively wonderful - helping us with directions and making other arrangements for us!. We were able to see virtually all the sections of Paris as 2 major metro stations were nearby. The lobby is cozy, the breakfast room cheery, the breakfast offered a wide variety of choices, and there's a precious garden. Our room was extremely quiet and had every amenity one would want.
