It was the perfect choice for our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Best small hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: JaneHaslemere
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived at the hotel early on Sunday morning, having travelled on the overnight sleeper train from Rome. The hotel is in easy walking distance of two metro stations. We were warmly welcomed and were given breakfast. Due to the early hour our room was not ready so we left our luggage at the desk and went for a walk in the Bois de Boulogne which is only a five minute walk away. All of Paris were out jogging and cycling and doing tai chi in the sunshine. Later in the day we returned to the hotel and to our room which was small but fully equipped with everything we needed. The bathroom was large and clean. I had requested a quiet room as we had never had a good nights sleep in a Paris hotel due to traffic noise. The hotel took us seriously and gave us a room overlooking the internal courtyard garden. We had the best two nights sleep I can remember. The room was silent and the bed was very comfortable. I had not realised before booking that the hotel is in a very quiet street in the embassy district so any room would have been peaceful. The breakfasts were very good, so good in fact that even my husband did not need lunch either day! The hotel staff were the crowning glory of the hotel. They were friendly and helpful. They all spoke good english but were happy to allow us the time to practice our less fluent french. They were continually concerned for our comfort and welfare. They advised on restaurants in the area and things to do. The hotel is due for a major upgrade in early spring 2010 so we will have to delay our return for a while. In over thirty years of staying in Paris hotels, this is the best so far. I relied on previous trip adviser customers comments when I made the booking and the hotel surpassed my expectations. Jane and Nick, Haslemere, UK

Reviews.Title: “Fully met expectations”
Reviews.Author: rwlid
Reviews.Content: Totally lived up to our expectations and we can confirm every other positive comment that has been said by others on this forum. Nelly and Isabelle were incredibly friendly and helpful and went out of their way to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable. At one stage they seemed to acting as a restaurant reservation service for us and nothing was too much trouble for them. Our room (No 40) had a small separate sitting area and was quite and peaceful at the back of the house. Tea and coffee making facilities were also provided which is unusual in Europe. Breakfast was also provided for an additional 13E, but we were quite happy with a croissant and a café in the patisserie around the corner (Rue Pergolese and Avenue Malakof), their pastries are also absolutely decadent, I would heartily recommend the raspberry tarts. The hotel is conveniently located in a quiet area but very near both the Metro and RER. The Champs Elysee and Eiffel are also about a 20 minute walk. In conversation with Nelly, I understand that the hotel will closed for 3 months early next year for a full renovation. This will be a good move as the current décor is showing its age. Nelly said she would have to increase the price slightly but try to keep to a minimum of 20E per night, which considering the price of hotels in Paris will still be excellent value. The only negative, which does not detract from a maximum 5/5 score, was the Wireless LAN (or lack of it) in the hotel. On occasions I could connect, but the signal was so weak it was useless. I understand they are going to correct this as part of the renovation. In summary a great place to stay in Paris and we look forward to seeing the hotel (post renovations) on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, value for money”
Reviews.Author: LB-21-B
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the center of Paris, in a great location. You can find restaurants near it (Avenue Malakoff, Avenue Grande Armee, Rue Pergolese), the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees are really near, 7-10 minutes walk. The owner of the hotel is very kind and so are the rest of the employees. The breakfast is very good and in a reasonable price. The room is very clean and big enough for Paris, where most of the hotels of the category are extremely small. The bathroom was very big. We stayed in the 4th floor.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: BCtravelers3
Reviews.Content: We truly enjoyed our stay at Residence Foch. The hotel staff were friendly, helpful and kind. They provided us with maps of the city, helped us plan our days, recommended great restaurants and could all speak English. The hotel was clean, comfortable and within walking distance to main attractions and metro stops. The hotel also offered a buffet breakfast that included fruit, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, pastries, cheeses, meat, cereal, tea, coffee and juice. I would highly recommend this hotel for its comfort and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, good location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: shivsnco
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, clean with smart decor it a very accessible location in an area of piece and quiet. Its major bonus though is its staff. Of the ones we spoke with all were friendly, welcoming and helpful. with suggestions of which restaurants to eat at, where to shop and which metro stations to access. Despite a slight problem with our original booking Nelly and her team quickly sorted this out without any inconveniance to ourselves. We had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully decorated, perfectly sized, friendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: 7ofnine
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at Hotel Foch. Everyone was incredibly friendly, nice and helpful. The hotel and rooms were beautifully decorated, very French, in yellows and red. There were beautiful stain glass window panels facing the elevator on every floor. The walls were sponge painted and stenciled - everything done with care and taste. The bathroom was completely tiled and quite a good size. There was a hair dryer, iron and ironing board, shampoo, shower cap etc - all the nice little extras, as well as gear to make coffee or tea in the morning. The drapes on the window were lovely, as were the prints on the walls, beautifully framed with multiple mats. The hotel is a perfect size - not too big. There were 6 floors, with only a handful of rooms on each floor. As others have mentioned, our room, though delightful, was quite small (judging from the floorplan we had the smallest room on the floor.) The bed took up most of the room! However, this wasn't a big deal as we spent most of our time out and about the city. One thing we definitely appreciated was that the room and hotel was very quiet. We slept well. :-) Residence Foch is located in a pleasant, residential section of Paris, which is an enjoyable walk after escaping the crowds on the Champs-Elysees. When arriving in Paris, we took the Air France bus from CDG airport to Port Maillot, and from there it was an easy walk to the hotel. The #1 and #2 metro lines are both close to the hotel so it's very easy to get all around Paris - although walking is a great way to enjoy the city! All in all, we had a wonderful time at the Residence Foch and were very impressed with how everyone bent over backward to be helpful and friendly. This ambiance certainly enhanced our trip to Paris! The hotel breakfasts were also excellent. There were pastries, eggs, cereal, cheese, coffee, tea .... enough to keep you going well into the day.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service (found in France?)”
Reviews.Author: TahitiTurtle
Reviews.Content: I booked Residence Foch based on Tripadvisor recommendations and it fully deserves the good write-ups it gets here. Implausibly, a French hotel becomes the role model for excellent service - who would have thought. The location I found to be good - ideal if you have business in the West-end or need to do some of the key tourist sites. If you have to cover more ground, taxis or metro travel will be required but that would be the case anyways as Paris is quite spacious Though it isnt an issue in Paris or anything I worry much about, all the embassies in the area means there is armed police and militaty petrolling this area at night, so it is very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Janet4666
Reviews.Content: I took my granddaughter to Paris in early June and stayed at Hotel Foch for a week. I cannot say enough about how wonderful the staff was. No such thing as "snooty" Paris here. Even when we tried our simplistic French on them..they responded in kind. (No need to speak French...all staff speak English very well.) Our room was small but very comfortable and pretty. The staff kindly helped us with suggestions and directions to whatever our day entailed with a great attitude. Wonderful place...Janet and Haile from Canada

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in great location - we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: havona
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Foch for 3 nights to celebrate our 4th wedding anniversary at the end of August. We thought the hotel was fantastic all round – the room was well maintained with a comfortable bed and large bathroom. Guests are really well provided for, there are daily newspapers in 4 languages, the rooms have all the amenities you would expect - mini bar, hairdryer, aircon, free wireless internet, a kettle etc. The hotel really is very clean, and being that little bit further out of town in a residential area, we felt safe and it was very peaceful! The staff are extremely helpful and personable. We were able to check into our room hours early, which was much appreciated as it meant we could freshen up after a very early start on the Eurostar! Chedi was so lovely – he had really good recommendations as to the best way to get to places, where to go when and where to eat. All his recommendations were excellent. One morning I went down to breakfast alone and despite him being very busy, he noticed my husband had not joined me and offered to prepare a breakfast tray for him, which I thought was just great. All in all this is a really good choice for a reasonably priced hotel in Paris. Its close to metro stops on line 1 and 2 which mean its easy to get around and there is even a Velib bike station on Rue de Malakoff just around the corner, so if you chose to use the bike system you are able to ride home! We recommend this hotel highly to anyone who is thinking of visiting Paris and we will be returning ourselves. We also did a bike tour with http://www.bikeabouttours.com/ which we really enjoyed – even if you are a frequent visitor in Paris it would be enjoyable as you get to see so much of the city. For a first time visitor like me it was wonderful! Give it a go! Also recommend the museum pass as it works out much cheaper than individual entries.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Felicity99England
Reviews.Content: We used the trip advisor to make our decision on this hotel.The reviews were 100% accurate. The hotel staff were extremely warm and exceptionally helpful.The bedroom was perfect with a lovely balcony.The area was quiet and safe with restaurants near by. A most enjoyable stay in an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best customer ever!”
Reviews.Author: hobara
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and the service was by far the best I have ever experienced in any hotel. We arrived early in the morning, knowing it was too early to check in but just planning to drop off our bags. Most hotels would just have taken your bags and said to come back later. But here they pulled out the city maps and after first asking us what we wanted to do in Paris proceeded to draw together a very detailed and personalised agenda for our stay. the staff constructed their recommendations in such a way that we spent a minimum amount of time travelling to attractions and maximised our time at the actual sights. For evening meals when we asked if there were any good restaurants in the area, we were again asked what our preferences were before they made recommendations. Once we'd decided ,the hotel made the reservations. Each evening when we returned to the hotel, the staff aked how our day went and what we'd like to do tomorrow. If only some of the other establishmnets I've stayed in over the years had been as thoughtful. The only area I was slightly disappointed with was the size of the room. But hey! this is Paris. And anyway we were doing so much, shopping, sightseeing and dining we were never in the room So all-in-all an absolute gem of a hotel in a quiet area but within walking distance of some of the city's main attractions. And if you fancy giving your feet a rest the Metro and RER are only round the corner. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Best front desk staff ever! Gret locaciton, good value for your money!”
Reviews.Author: kral24
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just few minutes walking from arc-de-triomphe.It is really close to metro station. You have easy accses to main place. I strongly recommend this hotel and I would also like to tell you the story I had; In the 2nd day of my trip I lost my iphone. All day long I search every where I possibly could but I couldn`t find it. When I got top the hotel the staff told me that they found it in the garden;That is the story I want to tell because most of hotel stuff wouldn`t do so. They would just say couldnb`find it and would give a end to it but front desk director John Louie didn7t do so.Shortly I really recommend this hotel and especially John Louie and his collegues

Reviews.Title: “Look no further...this is the place!”
Reviews.Author: ilovetotravel1995
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this little hotel! I booked based on Trip Advisor reviews and was not disappointed. The rooms are immaculate, the staff is was very attentive and kind. From the moment we arrived to helping us load our luggage into the taxi to head to the airport for our departure, they were there. Always pleasant and smiling. Anyone that says that the French are rude...our sorely mistaken. They were more friendly than many places I have been in the US. Like other reviews, I would say that this was in a perfect location, still close to everything by metro, but away from the crowds. It's located on a quiet street in a residential area. We felt very safe walking around. Just around the corner from this hotel, you can find a small market and one of the best chocolate shops we came across. If you are thinkng of coming to Paris, I would recommend not renting a car, but taking the metro everywhere. There is limited parking and driving is intense. We were unsure of the metro and RER, having never used it before but found it so easy and fast and flexible. Also definately buy a museum pass! We did spend a day at EuroDisney and loved it! Not as big or grand as the parks in the states, but very fun! We are big Mickey fans and it was nice to break up the week with a little fun! The only downside to this little gem is the beds. They are very firm. If you like that, than you'll rest well. Room number one, as previously mentioned, is right next to the kitchen, so I would definately recommend asking for a room that is off the main floor. I would find this bothersome as well. The rooms are small and cozy, especially the ones for two, but the bathrooms are large for Europe. You're in Paris, things are going to be tight! :o) But have a good attitude and everything works out! I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “very clean but some rooms rather small”
Reviews.Author: nettle_shaun
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for a romatic weekend in paris. We received a warm welcome and the hotel was relatively easy to get to. There are 2 metro lines within walking distance for us (a little too far for the elderly, especially in the paris sunshine). The welcome was warm and the staff were all very pleasant. The location was very quiet and in a really nice (and safe feeling) area of paris with lots of embassies. We were perfectly happy to walk around at night. We wandered down to the eiffle tower and al the way to notre dame (it's a pretty long walk). There isn't much close to the hotel so expect a little walk for dinner. The room we stayed in was one of the cleanest we have ever stayed which is a big plus for me. The only disappointment was the size of our room, when we arived we were told there were no more doubles so they had given us an extra large bed. This actually meant 2 singles pushed together (although there was a single sheet etc over the two). Anyway, if you don't mind not sleeping near your partner this is fine but for us it generally meant one of us was stuck in the dip - not very comfortable! The room was also pretty pokey - looking at the fire exit floor plan we had the smallest room on the floor (the other rooms are much larger so ask to move if you get a small one). There wasn't really much room to move around the bed and very little room for baggage (lucky we were only vsiting for the weekend and not as part of a tour of france or we would have been in trouble). We didnt have breakfast at the hotel, preferring to pick a cafe where we could people watch . All in all nice clean and friendly hotel, we wouldn't usually stay in a 3* but it was cleaner and friendlier than most of the 4* hotels we have stayed in. For under £100 a nght in august at the weekend this place truly exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous location, great hotel, best staff in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: bex_bissell2
Reviews.Content: My husband took me to Paris for a surprise 50th birthday present and we had a fantastic time. This hotel is spotlessly clean, the bed was really comfortable and the room was tastefully decorated in traditional style and had everything we needed. Its in a great location so a lot of the main sights are within easy walking distance if you are reasonably fit and active. There are metro stations and the RER only a few minutes away if you want to go to Versaille, Sacre Coeur/Montmartre, etc. It is also in a relatively safe area as it is surrounded by embassies so there are always a lot police drifting about day and night. The staff at the hotel went out of their way to make sure we were comfortable and also enabled us to do as much as possible during our stay, their advice saved us valuable time and money which was much appreciated due to the current exchange rate. Choose this hotel for that reason alone if you are not familiar with Paris, ALL the staff are ACE!!! There is a little shop around the corner that sells most things you might need and a very nice partisserie five minutes walk the other way to buy your lunch if you want to picnic. There are also lots of restaurants/cafes nearby. Port Maillot, ten minutes away, has a large indoor shopping centre but we didnt have time to visit it. I think parking near to the hotel might be difficult due to restrictions because of embassy security, ring before you book and enquire if you intend travelling by car. We flew to Charles de Gaulle airport and then took the Air France coach to the Arc de Triomphe, much less trouble and reasonably priced. We would certainly go back to Paris as its a lovely city and definitely stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Olimur
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 nights in this great little hotel. It was booked in a rush based on the previous reviews and I'm glad it worked out so well. The location is very good, away from the hype of the city centre but within easy access of all sights including the train to Versailles. The rooms are by no means big nor luxurious but for the price in Paris it does the job and has A/C. I can understand why a previous reviewer would be upset over being in Room 01 as it was only on the last day I discovered while having breakfast that this was a bedroom and was shocked. It is definitely too close to the dinning room. My only complaint was the cleaner stomping up and down the stairs in the morning when I was trying to sleep in but this was made up by the friendliness of the staff. I would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of room 01”
Reviews.Author: Pete_and_Ness
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay in Residence Foch because it was highly rated on this site. Obviously none of the other reviewers had the misfortune of being placed in room number 1. If you look at the photo attached, the door on the right is room 1 and the door on the left is the kitchen! You have to walk through the dining room to reach the room and can hear the conversations and music from the lobby a short distance away. We were awoken at 7am on Sunday to the sound of plates clanging and microwaves beeping. We gave up trying to sleep at 8.30 and spoke to the assistant manager who basically said we were imagining the noise and that this was one of their best rooms which had been specially reduced in price for us. A check on their website showed that we were paying the regular double room price! By the way, don't book through Expedia as breakfast is not included in the rate despite being advertised as the same price as going to the hotel direct (which does include breakfast).

Reviews.Title: “No longer any need to wonder where to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Peteroni
Reviews.Content: The first trip to Paris as a tourist foot soldier. Have done the downtown glitz palaces on business, but none of them can touch this for the sheer warmth of welcome and willingness to help. It's clean, comfortable and well located to get to all the places that have to be seen, but what really makes it stand out is the human touch, you may be a newcomer but you are treated as if you are their longest standing customer.

Reviews.Title: “Always triple A !”
Reviews.Author: Palisade
Reviews.Content: No need to explain further because it is simply a fantastic hotel ! I am a repeat customer and this will not change !

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service - 3 Star Price”
Reviews.Author: supercuda
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Residence Foch for eight days in July. Nelly and Chedi, as well as the other staff members were extremely friendly, courteous and helpful. The hotel is in a very upscale residential area only a short walk from Porte Maillot and the Arc de Triumph. A number of very good and not too expensive restaurants are nearby. Other amenities, such as grocery stores, wine stores, dry cleaners, etc., are also within walking distance. After our eight days in Paris, we rented a car and traveled through the Loire Valley and Normandy. Nelly provided great incite as to things to do and see in these areas. We had a wonderful trip to Paris and Northern France, any our stay at Hotel Residence Foch was a big part of that. I strongly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: roombudYork
Reviews.Content: We are 4 ladies and long-standing friends who love our girly getaways and decided on the fantastic city of Paris this time. I booked the Hotel Residence Foch for several reasons - the great reviews, the prices and the look of the place. Also, no need to pay anything in advance. It's always a bit nerve-racking when you've taken responsibility for booking the accommodation in case it turns out to be awful, but I needn't have worried - we loved it! The hotel is a delightful bijou haven on a quiet, classy and safe street. It's beautifully decorated throughout ; the pleasant, peaceful reception/lounge with gentle classical background music and laptop for visitor use; the spotlessly clean bedrooms and bathrooms, complete with tea-making facilities and nice toiletries and the great unhurried breakfast (gorgeous rolls!) which was included in the price. It is not pretentious nor does it try to be luxurious and we just felt so comfortable there. However, the pièce de resistance about this place is the staff. They are superb - particularly Chedi of the permanent smile, who served breakfasts and printed off our boarding cards for us, Jean-Louis, the efficient, humorous receptionist who recommended the 2 day yellow bus tour (which was brilliant). Absolutely nothing is too much trouble for these guys. If we had any little negative comments at all (and we struggled) we would comment on the bedrooms being on the small side and the towels could be larger and thicker. The nibbles on the tea tray is the bedroom were not actually complementary (to be fair it was in the guest guide which we didn't read) so could (and did) add about 11 euros a day to your bill when you pay at the end of your stay. But these things fade into insignificance beside all the positives. Having said that would we stay here again? ABSOLUTELY! Would we recommend? DEFINITELY!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 09rose
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a lovely quiet part of Paris which is only a 10 minute walk to the Metro/RER. Nelly and all her staff are extremely helpful and they will help you organise your day in the morning and let you know the best places for eating, visiting and shopping. You are always greeted with a friendly face and they always make sure that you are enjoying your visit and asking if there is anything they can help with. The hotel is in a lovely street full of beautiful buildings and in a very safe district for walking back to at night. We had a lovely holiday and it was definitely made better by staying in such a wonderful hotel with excellent staff. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tres bon!”
Reviews.Author: AmericanLouie
Reviews.Content: An excellent choice in a quiet, convenient hotel. Say hi to Proprietor Nelly Rolland and the rest of the staff who will have you soon smiling. Complete service and guidance through Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A+ Service, Service, Service”
Reviews.Author: Jaceallan
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the service provided by the staff of the Hotel Residence Foch. Nelly has put together a great staff who does everything they can to make your stay the best it can be. Special recognition to Chedi who always had a smile and a kind English word to say every time he spoke. My wife and I (30 yrs old) stayed for 6 nights in room 62. We had a view of the Eiffel Tower and a great patio to sit and relax after a full day of sight seeing. The hotel is located on a quiet street just 10 minutes from the Port maillot metro, which gave you access to anywhere in the city. We always felt safe walking to and from the hotel. There is also a Carrefour market with great snacks, drinks, and chocolates that is open from 7-11 Mon-Sat. Breakfast included unlimited Coffee, Tea, orange Juice, and Milk. Yogurt, cheeses, a great selection of breads, excellent jams, fruit, eggs, and meat. The water pressure in the shower was a welcome surprise as well. In the end, I highly recommend the Hotel Residence Foch. Living in NC, I researched Trip Advisor in advance and I am 100% glad we made the decision to stay at the Hotel Residence Foch. It was perfect for what we wanted - great service, a comfortable, safe, clean, and affordable place to sleep with accommodating staff to navigate through the French language barrier. Thanks for everything! Jace & Cheryl

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Pipcosta
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here from the 12th to the 15th of July to take in the Bastille Day celebrations and enjoyed every moment. The hotel is perfectly situated within a five minute stroll to good restaurants (we especially enjoyed the Bistrot Saint Ferdinand), parking, and the metro (Port Maillot). The hotel is situated in a safe location within an Embassy district. The staff is all friendly and very helpful. We stayed in a superior room on the 6th floor. The room while not over large was comfortable and well maintained. Breakfast was very good and served with a smile. Overall a great stay at a very good hotel. We will certainly use it again for our next Paris visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: helene123Chicago
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent five nights here at the end of our 40th anniversary trip to France. It was just wonderful. We got a really warm welcome from the Manager and staff. Our (grown) children had arranged for us to have champagne and flowers for a surprise on arrival, and the staff were all very excited to hear how we liked the surprise. She had done the flowers herself, and everything was beautiful. Great location, on a residential street near two Metro stops and plenty of neighborhood restaurants, patisseries, boulangeries, etc. nearby. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a very good hotel with friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Carthage5
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Hotel Residence Foch and had a very enjoyable stay. Whilst the room was on the small side (which appears to be typical of city centre Paris hotels), it was very clean and air conditioned. The continental breakfast was good and the staff were always freindly and helpful. The hotel is located in a relatively quiet area of the city and is about a 10 minute walk away from the nearest metro station at Porte Maillot; with hindsight a hotel in a more central location would have suited us better, though this doesn't detract from the hotel per se. The only minor negative about the hotel was the wi-fi signal which was non-existant in the room; otherwise a very good hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A good value combined with exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: lbearpal
Reviews.Content: The foremost feature of this hotel is the staff, each of whom bends over backwards to accommodate your wishes. They took extra effort to find us restaurants that offered value rather than the touristy/pricey ones and they handled our comings and goings with dispatch. Having visited Paris several times before, we were also advised by staff of wonderful new things to do that we would not have found on our own. The rooms are adequate in size (our first stay was in a suite that was more than adequate) and kept quite clean. The linens are good and the beds firm. If you are looking for glitzy this is not the place however. Instead you will find an "old shoe" kind of place that fits comfortably. Unlike many other hotels that are located in bustling, noisy neighborhoods. Foch is down a quiet street in a nice residential neighborhood and the balconies look out onto the backs of other residences across the way. That places Foch several long blocks from the Port Maillot or Argentine Metro stops which are necessary to access most of the sights of Paris although the Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees are within a five minute walk.. There are also several good neighborhood bistros within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: Gadgetsmom
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about this hotel, or maybe Inn is a better description. From the moment we reserved our room the staff were warm, welcoming and extremely helpful. This trip was a graduation gift for my 18 year old daughter and my 22 year old niece. One is an artist studying fashion design, and the other is a pastry chef. Needless to say the only city we considered was Paris. This was a first trip abroad for all three of us. The girls had studied French in school, but are far from fluent. this was NOT a problem, even when we veered away from the tourist areas into the parts of Paris where the locals shop and eat (which we did several times). The Parisians were always helpful and considerate once they realized we did not speak French very well. I started off working with a travel agent who tried to convince me that we would be best served by a private tour company that wanted to charge us HUGE amounts of money for guided tours. That was not an option financially,and with the help of Chedi and the other front desk staff at the hotel we managed to see much more of Paris than we could have imagined. Upon arriving at the hotel mid-morning Chedi recommended we go up to our room, shower and change, then gave us an itinerary for the rest of the day that would rival any tour guide's plan. We stayed in one of the family rooms,and had ample space. The room was beautifully decorated as well as extremely comfortable. It was the blue room on the hotel website, and was exactly as pictured. The neighborhood is residential and quiet, and an easy walk to the Eiffel Tower, Arc of Triumph, groceries, restaurants, metro and RER. Possibly the more expensive, big name hotels in the city can offer you more "luxury", but if you want to really immerse yourself into the Parisian lifestyle and feel like you are the most important clients at the hotel, I highly recommend Residence Foch.

Reviews.Title: “They deserve an award”
Reviews.Author: Paranoid27
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel Residence Foch for 4 nights while at the World Congress of Gerontology. The best thing for me was the location, which was next to the Palais de Congres. The service in the hotel was exceptional. The personnel were very friendly and did everything to make the stay pleasant (I was not used to that). They helped me with the reservation at a different hotel, looked up information and in general made sure everything was fine. The rooms were very nice, especially the second one with a terrace on the 5th floor and the attention to details was seen everywhere. Obviously, the hotel is quite small, so you won't find the restaurant or many other services. But for bed & breakfast and a relaxed stay, I was more than satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “A Spectacular Find!”
Reviews.Author: SaundraBF
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris and the Hotel Residence Foch made the stay perfect. This charming B&B is lovely with an incredibly helpful and pleasant staff. It is located on a quiet street that is conveniently near a Metro entrance that puts you anywhere you need to be within 15 minutes. My friend and I travelled with our 2 daughters and stayed in the second floor family room that was more than spacious enough for the 4 of us. The bathroom was great and the breakfast was also excellent. We will definitely stay there again when we return to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable First Trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: BOB_Phila-Pa
Reviews.Content: This was a special trip for my wife and I as we were celebrating our 30th anniversary. The staff and hotel made our first trip to Paris an unforgettable one. Since neither of us spoke French, we were a bit concerned getting around Paris. As it turned out, Nelly, Chandi, and the staff were all fluent in English and were extremely helpful with suggestions on everything from dinner recommendations to directions. The location of the hotel is within 5-10 minute walk from 2 Metro lines (#1 and #2) and the RER-C train line. Many restaurants are within a 5-10 minute walk as well. We stayed in Room 71 which was quite nice. We appreciated a warm greeting and great breakfast each morning. We had a laptop, and internet access worked well. The staff were also helpful with providing the right adapters for US voltage. We would certainly stay here again and would highly recommend the hotel based on a wonderful 4 day experience.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home; Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jaade
Reviews.Content: The location couldn't have been better for what I wanted to see and do while in Paris, and the fellow at the desk was extremely helpful and friendly. The rooms are a little on the small side, but everything I needed was there. I would certainly stay there again while in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Two_Fogies
Reviews.Content: Many positive things have already been said of the hotel and overall we would agree with them. We stayed here with friends in March. The welcome and service we received during our stay was excellent. The staff and management were very helpful in aiding our site seeing tours around Paris. We stayed in Room 071 at the top of the hotel. This had a small balcony that you could stand on and by looking to the side see the top of the Eiffel Tower. This is the first hotel that my wife and I disagreed on rating. She thoroughly enjoyed her stay and would give the hotel a 5 star rating. I was a little disappointed, perhaps because of the expectation set by the reviews, and thought it a little tired in places. What I say as being in need of a coat of paint, she saw as character. The other critical factor for me was the fall in the value of the pound against the Euro and thus the perceived value for money compared with other hotels we had previously stayed at in France. We were told that there are plans to renovate a number of rooms, perhaps if we visit after this and the pound has improved (if it ever does) then I may change my views.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous People”
Reviews.Author: unionjack1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of June. We were taking our 13 yr old grandson to Paris and London and then on to visit family in the UK. We had a family room which was clean and comfortable and most of all QUIET. No traffic noise at all. We had no view of the Eiffel Tower but the friendly and helpful staff more than made up for that. They really went out of their way to make our visit a memorable one. We always had a good breakfast here and the price was reasonable for Paris. We decided not to bring a laptop but no problem here since they offered the use of a laptop in the lobby with internet access. We would definitely stay at this hotel again and would highly recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience at the Foch”
Reviews.Author: ukmum2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the Foch for our first time in Paris. From the moment we came in the service was exceptional, to include the help at the desk in mapping out the sights and advice on using the metro. The room was exactly as advertised, with thoughtful touches like travel toiletries and BBC/CNN on the tv. Everything was very clean, including the bathrooms. The staff could not have been more courteous, offering assistance and inquiring about our stay every time we came through the lobby. The hotel is on a quiet street but restaurants and the metro are within easy walking distance. Breakfast was more than ample, and we were offered a choice of hot drinks as well as papers in several languages. On our final day, the desk held our luggage while we did some last minute sightseeing and then offered us bottled water for free as we left. A great experience and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - highly recommended to all!”
Reviews.Author: Tanea H
Reviews.Content: My work colleague and I stayed at the Hotel Residence Foch for two and a half days on our way back home to New Zealand. It was our first visit to Paris. I booked the hotel on the recommendation of Travel Advisor's satsfied customers!! We weren't disappointed! What a wonderful hotel!! Yes, the room was small but perfectly adequate and well equipped with everything we needed. The bathroom was modern and everything was clean, clean, clean!! The staff at reception were professional, friendly and helpful and always ready to give directions or make recommendations. There was a supermarket within five minutes walk (plus restaurants and cafes) and an easy stroll to the Avenue Des Champs Elysees/Arc De Triomphe and metro stations. We have an awesome time in Paris and spent most of the time away from the hotel. However, it was a highlight of our day to return to our quiet, calm oasis. Thank you all very much - I'm not sure when we will return to Paris but you can guarantee we will be staying at the Hotel Residence Foch!

Reviews.Title: “Great price, clean and very friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: terziCT
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at this hotel based on the tripadvisor ratings. We were greeted with great cheer on our arrival. The room that we stayed at (#71) was at the top floor. We had a little balcony that actually sawthe Eiffel Tower. Since it is not close to a subway line, we ended up taking cabs. Flagging a cab was a not a big deal however, on our last night when we got into a cab the driver really got pissed at us because we wanted to go to rue Marbeau. Was not sure what that was all about. Briefly, if you are in a budget and looking for a decent and clean place, I can highly recommend this hotel. However, if you are looking luxury this is not the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bexmr
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel during the second week of May, 2009. The staff was friendly as everyone states - really very helpful with sight seeing and restaurants. The only issue is that the charm of the old building also reveals its one problem. You can hear everything that everyone says in the stairwells. While my husband and I were there on our 15th wedding anniversary, there was another American family there. The kids were cute but loud in the hallways, and I'll never forget the woman's husband's name...I heard David, David, David over and over again. Maybe a nice sign in the reception area reminding other hotel guests to please remember that their are other guests in the hotel would be nice and not offensive. Not the hotel's fault, but maybe something to consider. Otherwise, just a great hotel in a very nice area with a 10 minute walk to a metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Regal experience at commoner prices, thanks to HRF!”
Reviews.Author: HughKToronto
Reviews.Content: Just got married (our first) and started our honeymoon with a couple free nights at Mercure Montmartre, which was also a nice stay and located steps away from Moulin Rouge and lots of action spots. When we got to Hotel Residence Foch (HRF) we became concerned from the lack of immediate access to tons of cafes or things to see. Then we spent our first night in the dream suite: The Blue Room. It made me feel like I was sleeping in a guest bedroom at the Sun King's Versailles. We loved it for it's charm and beauty (the bathroom is superb) and realized what was missing with the first hotel: Peace and quiet at night! Of course the view from the balcony of a sparkling Eiffel Tower helped and we quickly realized the bus (line #82) led us swiftly to where we wanted to go. Of course the staff were excellent as pretty much every other review will tell you, ALWAYS friendly and helpful. If you get married and are lucky enough to come to Paris, you simply won't find a better overall experience for the price you pay, Formidable!!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: scottd01
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely perfect for my weekend away with my fiance. It is 5 minutes walk from the bus station, 15 mins walk from the arc de triumph, 15-20 miuntes walk to the eiffel tower (excuse my spelling) and very close to an underground station so easy access anywhere in paris. The staff are second to none, very friendly and efficient, the go out their way to ensure you enjoy your stay - one of the receptionists even phoned a restaurant we had booked to inform them of a food allergy. If I had to be critical, the only bad thing I can think of in this hotel was the shower - the bracket holding it to the wall was a little loose so it tended to flood the batchroom. However, this was only a very minor issue, everything else about the hotel was perfect. Next time Im in paris i will definately use this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back”
Reviews.Author: jclarke23
Reviews.Content: 9 of us stayed here in January & had a lovely time. The hotel is perfectly located & the staff were wonderful. I have stayed in Paris many times & this is by far the best hotel I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at Hotel Residence Foch”
Reviews.Author: ClaudiaAB
Reviews.Content: We stayed nine wonderful nights at Hotel Residence Foch in May 2009. Our stay in Paris was absolutely fantastic, from the time we arrived until we left!! Before our trip, I was very impressed with the staff. I e-mailed the hotel with questions about tours, places to see, distances, etc., and someone at the desk always wrote me immediately with the information that I needed. I especially enjoyed corresponding and talking with Chedi before our arrival. And this wonderful hospitality continued on our entire visit of 9 days!! We were greeted by the nicest people - they served us coffee when we arrived. Nelly, the owner, is the friendliest, most cheerful, and most helpful person that we have met. Each morning she would help us with our plans - giving us wonderful ideas of what to do and see. It rained most days that we were there, and the one sunny day that we were planning to go to the Louvre, she suggested that we enjoy the beautiful sunshine and go somewhere outdoors. We went to Versailles that day, and were so happy that we did!! Chedi continued to be as helpful as he had been before our visit. And in the evening, we especially enjoyed visiting with Youssef, who was so nice!! What a lovely staff! We prefer B&B's rather than large hotels, and this was perfect - so charming. We had a very pleasant room that overlooked the street. It was decorated nicely and was very clean. The hotel is in a great location - close to two metro stops, a train station, and a gorgeous park where my husband ran each morning. We felt safe coming home at night. It is a very pleasant walk to the Arc de Triomphe - and a nice walk to the Eiffel Tower, where you must have coffee and croissants at Carette at the Trocadero. We actually walked to and from most places in Paris. We did take the metro a few times - when it was raining, when we went to Montmartre, and when we went to mass at Notre Dame on Sunday morning. We did walk back from Notre Dame, and the Latin Quarter - it is a great city to walk around!! There are wonderful restaurants right near the hotel. Our favorites that were recommended by the hotel are Bistro Saint Ferdinand, Chez Georges and L'Auberge Dab. The food and service at those restaurants was excellent. One of our favorite restaurants was one that we saw while we were eating across the street at Chez Georges. It is Le Relais de Venise "Son Entrecote" on Blvd. Pereire near Porte Maillot. When we came out of Chez Georges one night we saw a long line around the corner, and we went over to see what was happening. The people were in line to go to dinner at this little restaurant. They told us that it is very popular with locals. It has a set menu of salad, meat and french fries - with the most delicious meat sauce! I don't even eat that much meat, but we decided to try it, and it was one of the highlights!! The sauce is to die for - and the waitress comes back and gives seconds on everything! The layered chocolate dessert was absolutely delicious! It was a great experience. We also went to the dinner show at the Moulin Rouge one night. Chedi called and made reservations for us. It had been recommended by other guests at the hotel, as well as our friend who lives in Montmartre. It was so spectacular - as good as any Broadway Show - and the dinner was excellent!! We can't say enough about how much we loved our stay. Paris is absolutely gorgeous - one of our favorite cities - and staying at the very charming Hotel Residence Foch made it just perfect!! We would definitely stay there again - and hope we can return soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel especially as only 3 star”
Reviews.Author: JohnandCarolineUK
Reviews.Content: 8 of us stayed here for 3 nights. The rooms are small but modern, spotless, smart and very well equiped. Staff are very helpful, nothing is too much trouble. 3 star clearly under rates it.

Reviews.Title: “What a Delight!”
Reviews.Author: RichKandCK
Reviews.Content: Hotel Residence Foch (HRF) made our first trip to Paris most enjoyable and comfortable. Nelly and her staff were helpful and gracious in all aspects of our stay. Although not located in the center of Paris the location afforded easy access to CDG airport via Air France shuttle and all parts of Paris via the Metro. The Foch is also within walking distance to Arc de Triomphe and Eiffel Tower. Avenue Victor Hugo is only 10 minutes away with all high end shopping and eateries. The immediate area around HRF is safe and quiet with a glimpse of really living in Paris. We enjoyed the local stores along Rue Pergolese. We most certainly will return to HRF!

Reviews.Title: “well positioned and very friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: philWeston_s_mare
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed at hotel residence foch for four nights in may. the hotel is well positioned. only a ten minute strool to arc de triomphe and about twenty minutes walk to the eiffel tower. there are also two metro stations very close by. the room, although not that large was well equiped, clean and very pleasent. the staff were great and would help you in any way possible.

Reviews.Title: “1 1/2 days in Paris”
Reviews.Author: shellenay
Reviews.Content: Excellent Staff Great hotel Excellent Location Highly recommend! The Blue Room is lovely :)

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel with wonderful staff in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mvron
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel from 6th to 10th April. We chose this hotel primarily based on the reviews on this site and were delighted with our choice. I had requested a nice room with a balcony or view as the trip was a present for my partner's birthday. We were delighted with the 'blue room' (featured on the hotel's website) assigned to us. Everything about the hotel was wonderful - the staff was exceptional in every regard and the location could not be better. We took a large number of the hotel's business cards on departure as we intend recommending this hotel to anyone we know visiting Paris. This hotel really is an excellent choice and we will certainly return to it on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Really friendly charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: loulots
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Residence Foch for my husband's 50th birthday. The staff were immediately extremely friendly and helpful. They very kindly helped us to make reservations for restaurants on the telephone and were able to recommend good places to eat. Nellie even gave us a small bottle of champagne to help us celebrate! The room was fairly small but the bathroom made up for it being of more than adequate size and very clean. The hotel is quite a walk from the Arc de Triomphe but near enough to metro stations. Getting anywhere in Paris seems to require a great deal of walking! We very much enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Residence Foch and would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money and much-much friendliness”
Reviews.Author: IndiraMiric
Reviews.Content: We stayed with two kids at Hotel Residence Foch for three nights in May 2009. Excellent location, cleanness, abundant breakfast and - above all - friendly, funny, helpful staff have made our stay in Paris even more wonderful. I would recommend this hotel to all families visiting Paris for a couple of days. Proximity of Bois de Boulogne is an additional bonus - rent a bike here and ride around if you're tired of having walked in the centre of Paris for a day or two! Zsuzsa/Indir Kurtovic

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: WW_view
Reviews.Content: I can only echo the other reviews, this is a very good choice. The staff are the best part, all of them at all times of day are friendly and helpful. We were upgraded to a suite which had an extra bed. Original plan was that our young son would sleep in our bed but the hotel decided this was a better alternative which we could only agree with. Breakfast is in a small area beside the lobby which you expect to get very busy but despite the hotel being full we never had any difficulties. If you want to make the most of the area then ask the staff. Some directions have nothing and some have a bunch of restaurants. It's a short walk to the metro and RER at Porte Maillot which will take you anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: chellye
Reviews.Content: My family of 2 adults and 3 small children stayed here on a stopover to the USA. We had a family room with a pull out couch and baby bed. The room was quite spacious and attractively decorated. The staff was family friendly and helpful. Loved this boutique hotel and would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but not worthy of this top 10 ranking”
Reviews.Author: pskj2009
Reviews.Content: Wanted to give this hotel a "Good", but as the choices go from a 3/5 Average to a 4/5 Very Good, I went on the better side. The hotel was good to be honest. A nice 3 star. We were put in a good room with a small terrace (which very was nice), and the staff were very friendly. Have no complaints at all, but then for the price we paid (£120 per night) I would expect to have no complaints. I am suprised that it is ranked on this website at number 6 (at the time of writing) out of over 1500 hotels in Paris. Its definately not on the cheap side as there are plenty of 3 star hotels about, and I wouldn't say that the hotel exceeds my expectations in terms of value. If this really is the 6th best hotel in Paris, then it doesnt say mucb for the Paris hotel industry. Overall, I would recommend it as a safe bet, but dont raise your expectations too much simply because of the ratings. For the price you pay, you expect to get a nice 3 star hotel, and thats what you get. I may be coming back, but if you hold out for the free night offers on lastminute and expedia, you can get a decent 4 star for the price of this one.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a girlfriend getaway!”
Reviews.Author: tigertail94
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in February with 3 friends. We loved this location!! It had the charming, quaint feel of a Parisian neighborhood, but is a short walk to the metro stops and busy city. It was a pleasant walk through the neighborhood in daylight, but creepy at night for 4 women. We learned quickly to take the busier street (Ave Admiral Breaux??) from the metro directly to our street after dark. Hotel staff might be the best I have ever encountered. The helped us with directions, looked up terms in the English/French dictionary for us, made dinner reservations for us, dug around for a fuse when mine blew on my converter-- were fun and friendly always. We had 2 rooms next to each other with no view. Twin beds were great, much more comfortable for friends traveling together. Rooms are SMALL, but we expected that- it's Europe. It was everything we needed, we were only there to sleep and shower. Internet was great, we had no problem emailing the hubbys and checking up on the kids each night. We did have breakfast there our first morning. It was very nice, a bit expensive but convenient and with plenty of options. Once we got a feel for the area we went out each morning, because we were there to see the city, after all! The only problem we had at all was getting a taxi to the airport our last morning, we asked twice before we left about a taxi for 4 with luggage and were assured it would be no problem. Then, morning of, suddenly it was impossible to get one big enough, we would have to take 2. Until we complained, and then they were able to get one. Really not a big deal, but this factored heavily in our decision not to use an airport shuttle service. I would stay here again and recommend it without hesitation if you are looking for a quiet, charming hotel with an exceptional staff. I can't wait to come back!!

Reviews.Title: “This is a little gem”
Reviews.Author: TheSmithsUk
Reviews.Content: It is very rare to find helpfull hotel staff in Paris,now I know why....They all work here! Great little hotel,clean,well located & sort of quiet.... A bit of sound proofing would not go amiss ....We heard every move of the people above us. That said, I would recomend it to everybody. will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: olalaoparis
Reviews.Content: Very clean! Good location - good and safe area! Nice staff - very informative and friendly. One of the persons upfront though me how to pronounce the basic everyday sentences and this was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful hotel that I would highly recommend and is great value”
Reviews.Author: Boro79
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel from Trip Advisor reviews and knew very little about it but were pleasantly surprised. My husband and I had never been to Paris and did not even know the area that the hotel was situated before we arrived however discovered that it was in the perfect location. The hotel was mererly 10 minutes walk from the bus drop off from Paris Beauvais airport and as our room was not ready on arrival the receptionist whom was so friendly and helpful gave us a map and highlighted places to go and see and detailed to us how to get there and what metro lines we needed etc. We had a wonderful day on her advice and when we returned our room was lovely. It was spotlessly clean and very spacious with great views across the rooftops with a small balcony. Throughout our stay the staff were always helpful, polite, friendly and courteous and were like our own private tour guides of the city. There are numeous restuarants and cafes in the area to suit every budget and the hotel staff were more than happy to recommend some of the best. It is ideally situated being close to both Metro lines 1 et 2 and also the RER ensuring that everywhere in the city was easily accessible. In addition it's only 15-20 mins walk from le Arc de Triomphe and we walked the whole way down to the Notre Dame. We cannot recommend this hotel highly enough for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: petra82
Reviews.Content: We are a family with two children aged 14 and 18. We stayed in this hotel for six nights and had two rooms, 61 and 33. The rooms were nicely decorated, clean with renovated, clean bathrooms with windows and all necessary equipment. Room 33 was rather small, 61 was spacious. The hotel is family style. In gereral our stay there was very nice since the rooms were quiet, cleaned everyday, towels changed daily, people really helpful everytime we asked for something (reservation in a jazz club, Eurodisney tickets, info etc). The neighbourhood is very nice and safe (empassies around, Germany's included) and the metro station very convenient to use for two major lines. Arch of Triumph only 10 minutes on foot. Restaurants around also. The breakfast room is small and breakfast rather basic. Better find a boulangerie and try the wonderful croissants. I would definately recommend it .

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: tmjephson
Reviews.Content: Staff were so welcoming and approachable which was a relief as I was a little daunted being around the french without being able to speak french. The hotel was older than I expected but I just fell in love with getting a hint of what it would be like living in Paris. I was disappointed to find that there was no restaurant in the hotel but then again there were gorgeous cafes and restaurants just minutes away. The staff were available 24 hours and so keen to help with any enquiries. I have already recommended this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “A Special Place”
Reviews.Author: AbbyFromTexas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently traveled to Paris for the first time. This was my first trip to Europe; we are already planning our next trip to Paris and would definitely stay at Residence Foch again. We felt totally welcome and knew that the staff would help with anything we needed. There was always someone at the front desk who spoke English and was ready to help. Our room was perfect.. although small, it reminded us of similar hotel in NYC. We didn't spend much time in our room, so we didn't need a huge amount of space. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel.. seemed a little high for the food choices. We were always anxious to get out and walk the streets. The hotel is close to Arc and Eiffel tower. We enjoyed an evening walk to the Eiffel tower to see it after dark.. felt totally safe walking the streets nearby. We also walked to Louvre and Notre Dame. Wifi was great. We used it everyday. Overall.. thanks to Shedi for a perfect vacation.

Reviews.Title: “At home in Paris”
Reviews.Author: lormel
Reviews.Content: I couldn't have been happier with our stay at Hotel Residence Fochs. My daughter and I arrived at 8 am from the States. We followed the website's directions and arrived at the hotel easily from the Air France bus. Even better was that our room was ready for us! The staff gave us a map and highlighted sites we were interested in. The hotel is located in a wonderful residential neighborhood. Although dark at night, my 13 year old and I felt quite safe arriving late at night from the metro which is close and provides easy access to many areas in Paris. Its a fun walk to the Eiffel Tower, and Champs with lots of great local bakeries and chocolate shops on the way. The basic double seems standard size for Paris, but the family suite we moved to when the rest of our party arrived was roomy. Breakfast was good. The best part of this hotel though is the staff. I awoke with an eye infection one morning and Nelly was kind enough to write a note in french for me and direct me to medical care. What could have ruined a trip became a small blip. Always being greeted with a smile and a willingness to make your trip a good one can never be underestimated!

Reviews.Title: “Cute and Cheerful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lovingagoodholiday
Reviews.Content: After a leisurely Eurostar trip from London we were welcomed and checked into the hotel very promptly. The gentleman gave us a map of Paris and quickly circled the main attractions and highlighted the routes so we could find our way around. We had booked a deluxe double room after viewing the website as we believed that if those rooms were more expensive they would come under the 'superior quality' heading. The room we were given was definitely not superior quality; but in saying that it was generally what we might expect from a three star hotel. (The website makes the hotel look four or five star.) The room had a reasonable amount of space around the large bed, a chest of drawers, a small cupboard, iron and ironing board, TV, tea and coffee making, an ensuite and Juliet balcony. My husband wanted to smoke on the balcony, but found it a little daunting as it seemed to lean (perhaps an optical illusion?). The bed was comfortable, but you could feel the join in the centre where they had obviously pushed two smaller beds together. It was also quite low to the ground, which definitely took away some of the appeal. Some of the tiles in the bathroom were cracked, and the ceiling in the bedroom needed some repair, but otherwise it was clean, quiet and in a good location. Breakfast was Continental and 13 Euro (around $24 Australian). Cereal, boiled eggs, juice, coffee, croissants, rolls, cheeses etc. I asked for toast on the first morning (had even learned how to say it in French), but was told they don't serve it. That was a little disappointing. The breakfast room itself was charming, with nice tablecloths and place settings, and overlooked a small garden. There was a sitting room with magazines and a laptop with free internet access. I managed to send a short email there one day, but it took me forever as the keyboard is slightly different to the Aussie one with letters in different places. Oh well, can't have everything :). There were quite a few good restaurants quite close by (wine prices quite high) and there were two Metro stations (different lines) within easy walking distance. Once we became used to the hotel being a little less luxurious than the website showed, we relaxed and went with the flow. It was generally a pleasant stay and the staff were very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Penny022
Reviews.Content: Hotel is generally clean (although noticed some black mould on bathroom wall). Service is friendly. Room is very small. There are bigger rooms in the hotel but not available for single person despite paying for a double room. Main problem was noise. Definitely would recommend avoid rooms ending with "0". Bed is separated from elevator by thin stud wall. Re location, the hotel is quite a distance from centre. At dark I would recommend a taxi (on the main street around the corner from the hotel there are working girls busy).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service and good location, will be staying again.”
Reviews.Author: oxygen445
Reviews.Content: Every member of staff was welcoming and very friendly. Advice on where to go and what to do was fantastic. Location is very good, quiet and slightly out of the way, but easy walking distance from metro stations and the Arc de Triomphe.

Reviews.Title: “Home in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Sister2Travelers
Reviews.Content: On arrival at Residence Foch we were met with gracious, welcoming hospitality. This did not surprise us as Nelly and Isabelle answered all of our correspondence promptly and with every attempt to meet all of our requirements. No request was too much for them to address. We were a group of six adults for part of our stay and for the second part another group of friends joined us. Coordinating the accommodations for all members of our party was handled with seeming ease on the part of the staff. Jean Louis with his genuine smile and quickness made each morning a delight. He answered questions, arranged for transfers to the train station, called museums, recommended excellent restaurants and did all of the things an attentive concierge would do. His happiness infected us with joy and he makes a stay at the Residence Foch an experience that makes one feel at home, albeit with a personal staff! Wasuf and ____ attended our every need, as well , from explaining the use of the house computer, to bartending and sharing dishes with us when we brought home desserts from dinner. If you are looking for competent, gracious people to enhance your time in Paris, we gratefully recommend the staff at Residence Foch. Our room, one of the family suites, and we would encourage booking these, included a sitting area, a bedroom with very comfortable mattresses and a large ensuite bathroom. Each room includes television, phone service and a stocked mini-bar. Smaller rooms in the hotel include these same amenities. With the friendly ambiance of Residence Foch even these are recommended. Because our stay was divided into two parts, we stayed in two different family suites and in both the coordinated walls and linens added to the beauty. Because of a garden on the lowest floor, we dealt with mosquitos a few nights, because we slept with windows open. The few times that we needed air conditioning, it worked perfectly. We cannot say enough about the location. About four blocks from Porte Maillot and one block from the Grande Armee, the Residence Foch is situated on Rue Marbeau, a quiet street in the 17th arrondisement, where several embassies are located. About three blocks from the restaurant we found an excellent boulangerie/patisserie for croissants and coffee and afternoon snacks as well as numerous fine restaurants and brasseries. After a day of sightseeing, it felt wonderful returning to the hotel to freshen up and then, be able to go to restaurants nearby that served delicious meals. We highly recommend Residence Foch and when we return to Paris, we will surely stay at wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: jsc700
Reviews.Content: I requested a particular room that was confirmed 6 months in advance but when we got there the room was booked. Breakfast was supposed to be included it wasn't and it was horrifically priced for what was available. Go to a sidewalk cafe for breakfast instead. The location was good however.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Baixas
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very friendly staff. The owner is also very friendly. Monday to Friday, she talks to the residents at breakfast, asking them if everything is OK. I stayed in room 62. It's a small room with a queen bed and a big balcony with a view of the Eiffel Tower. The room has a small closet but many drawers. The hotel is a 5 to 10 minute walk to the Metro station, with many restaurants in the neighbourhood. There is also a grocery store (Carrefour City) on de Malakoff avenue. I ate breakfast at the hotel: it's 13 Euros with many choices including fresh fruit salad, fresh fruits, cheeses, cereals, jams, eggs, etc. and most importantly, as much coffee as one wants. Finally, the hotel street is very calm and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: lessthanphil
Reviews.Content: Gem of a hotel. Great place to stay. Probably some of the most helpful and friendly staff I've ever encountered in a hotel. Rooms very clean, tidy and well maintained. Beds made up and towels refreshed daily. Tasty continental breakfast for a very reasonable price. In all, one of the best hotels I've stayed at, Nelly and her team (all of them) are a credit to themselves, nothing was too much hassle for them. The location is great (it's in what is effectively Paris' equivalent of Mayfair, London) with some fantastic restaurants within 2/3 minutes walk (try Del Papa for great Pizza/Pasta), La Pergolese for something a bit more fancy or La Villa Corsa for great seafood. The hotel is a great base for exploring Paris from, lovely place to return after a hard days walking! Would definitely reccomend to friends/family...In fact, I already have.

Reviews.Title: “Better than anywhere else I've stayed at in Paris before!!”
Reviews.Author: AltyDave
Reviews.Content: What an absolute gem of a hotel.The service was faultless.Excellent location.Having spent part of my working life in Paris in a wide range of City Centre hotels..... Im annoyed that I missed this one !!! A big thank you to Nelly and her team - most welcoming,nothing was too much trouble. Would I recommend this hotel ..... of course !!!! I probably shouldnt as it will be more difficult to get a room next visit!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - comfortable, friendly, helpful”
Reviews.Author: AlistairP
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay. The staff were extremely helpful. The hotel was clean, comfortable, good location for both business and pleasure. It is quiet compared to many other hotels I have stayed at in Paris. I hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Paris”
Reviews.Author: RobTheTraveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at 6 different hotels in Paris and in January spent 6 nights at Hotel Foch, I read approximately 40 reviews from other guests at the hotel before booking and the reviews created a very real expectation of the hotel. The travelers on this site have rated this hotel correctly; one of the best in Paris for a 3 star hotel (should be 4 stars). The people who work at this hotel are amazing and enjoy their jobs. Nelly Rolland is the owner of this 25 room hotel (beautiful building) and has a lot of pride in her hotel. She has earned the excellent rating from trip advisor. Nelly is such a charming, vibrant, outgoing person, perfect for running a hotel. Chedi, the daytime manager is as good as any hotel manager I have ever met (include the Ritz Carlton’s and JW Marriott), my wife and I appreciate all your kindness. Wasef, the night time manager, great guy, always smiling, had fun sitting in the bar lounge area a few nights enjoying a glass of wine and the company. This hotel is great for business and tourists as well. Everyone speaks fluent English. The location is very good and quiet. My NEW favorite restaurant in Paris is the “Bistro Saint-Ferdinand” recommended by the hotel, Laurent, the manager, is the hardest working guy in Paris, The food and service is excellent, Parisians love this restaurant, the price fix menu includes champagne aperitif, a bottle of wine for 2, appetizer, entrée, desert! It is a 10 minute walk to the restaurant, what a deal! For first time travelers to Paris, most hotel rooms are small; this hotel has several different rooms (business or family). You can hear some noise at night from people going up and down the stairs, which was not bad except one night there was a big group and they stayed up late drinking in the lounge area. If you are on the upper floors you would NOT have this issue as much. The rooms are well kept, clean, WARM in the winter, cannot say the same for some 4 star competitors (best western). Complimentary WIFI in the hotel was great as well and the Hotel also has a laptop you can use. Will stay at this hotel again, Here is a tip if you take the train from the airport to your hotel, be prepared to haul your luggage up stairs which not a good option if you have a lot of luggage or children.

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Wonderful Stay at the Foch”
Reviews.Author: pixfield
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Residence Foch for six nights, February 13-18. I had room 51 which is located opposite the street side of the hotel. When I arrived at this charming boutique Hotel, I was warmly greeted by the owner , Nelly and one of her staff, Jean-Louis. They both speak English exceptionally well. The hotel is in a quiet, upscale, residential and safe area of Paris, near metro and RER lines. There are restaurants, supermarkets, boulangeries, etc. in the immediate area. The hotel is very nicely decorated and has a pleasant, “fresh” look about it. The rooms are immaculate and comfortable. The linens and furnishings are of high quality. There is none of that residual tobacco smoke smell that I have experienced in many other Paris hotels. I had the feeling that the owner is very involved in every detail of the hotel. She is dedicated to making sure that each and every one of her guests has a positive stay at her hotel. The staff is especially attentive. Cheddy and Jean-Louis courteously and efficiently handled my requests to make restaurant reservations, transportation arrangements and help with all of my travel needs. They even made arrangements for my travel partner to attend a yoga class in the area. If I needed a wine glass, they cheerfully got it for me, if I needed a corkscrew, they cheerfully got it for me. If I had a question on how to get somewhere, they cheerfully answered it for me. If you think you would get this type of treatment at a “chain” hotel, think again. The hotel is equipped with free, fast wireless internet service. I had six peaceful and quiet nights of sleep at the Foch. I woke up to a delicious breakfast served downstairs every morning. I have to tell you, I have stayed in many hotels in Paris in many visits to the city. I must say, the Foch is the best hotel I have stayed in while visiting Paris. My traveling companion remarked that every evening we arrived back at the Foch, that she felt like she was “coming home” and not staying at a hotel. She is right. When you spend the day touring the wonderful city of Paris, it is certainly comforting coming home to a classy and cozy place like the Residence Foch. This is an outstanding hotel. Now that I have stayed at the Foch, I know why it has the great reputation that it does.

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: edentonjack
Reviews.Content: Hotel Residence Foch is a cozy, but bright hotel in a quiet residential area. Our stay began with a warm greeting, cups of coffee, and an orientation of the area, the metro and the key sites to see. For the rest of our stay the staff was just as helpful and accomodating as those first few minutes. Any request (including help with our French vocabulary) was met by an enthusiastic response. The room is small, but adequate, with updated and fresh decoration. Each floor can be reached with a lift. We found the breakfast a reasonable value as we tend to eat a hearty breakfast and a light lunch. We found the location very handy to the metro, the arc de triomphe and many restaurants, brasseries, and cafes'. We recommend taking the number 2 Air France bus to Porte Maillot to reach the hotel. If you have any large sized luggage the train is a challenge, especially at rush hour. We couldn't have been more pleased and will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem, an excellent find :)”
Reviews.Author: tigermilk80
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights in Paris at Residence Foch having had a fantastic time. The hotel is in a great location, just 10 minutes walk from le Arc De Triomphe and 15 mins walk from La Tour Eiffel. Within 5 minutes walk of the hotel there are plenty of restuarants to choose from, French and Italian in particular. Nice touches like chocolates for Valentines day and the friendly and helpful emails before our trip really made Residence Foch stand out for its service.Staff at the hotel were extremely friendly and helpful, and were happy to give directions and recommendations. As we were there for Valentines day we asked the hotel to book a restaurant in advance. They suggested La Villa Corse, just 2 mins walk away, which had excellent food and service. The owner also recommended an lovely Salon de The for breakfast on our last morning. The room was a reasonable size, considering the average in Paris, and had a large, bright bathroom with bath and shower over (a really powerful and hot shower which was fab!). We will definitely recomment this hotel to our friends and would stay here again if we return to Paris. Thank you for an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “what a pitty!”
Reviews.Author: Steven061
Reviews.Content: The location is very convenient. It is residential and calm yet not too far from the main streets. The hosts were very kind. The interior is cosy and comfortable. Nothing fancy. Unfortunately, I never experienced such a horrible feeling... I suddenly woke up around 7 am, frightened that someone was walking around and robbing something in my room. I looked around, turned on the light and realized that no one was there and fell asleep again. My sleep became very poor as I woke up again for all the ups and downs in the staircase (you can hear the wood floor cracking every time someone steps on it). The worst thing is a few minutes later, the person in charge with cleaning up was carrying the vacuum cleaner like it was a soker ball, and closing and opening the closet doors in the corridor like crazy and rather violently. Never in my life have had I to stand such a thing! The worst thing is that when I told the owner about it she said it never happened before!!! She didn't even offer to pay for breakfast nor she offered a cut in price. I thought, what a way "not to take your responsibility"!!! It's indecent. When your job is about offering a service you DO take into account the customer!!! I do travel a lot in Italy, US, Asia and Russia and never in my life have I encountered someone denying a problem so easily and not even apologizing. It's the least she could do!!! I always wrote positive reviews and thank God never experienced something really negative like that time. I had to take a plane shortly after and realized I would be in a bad mood for my next appointment thanks to them!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: alfred29fr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful : nice, quiet, good location. The director is very professional and nice. Alfred from France

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: milmalcolm
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel reasonably well located, clean with friendly helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: ParisTokyoMilan
