Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel the end of Jan for 5 nights. The Air France Bus from CDG to Porte Maillot was not available on our day of arrival due to a strike. Instead we took a taxi for 40 Euro, which is reasonable. This is our third visit to Paris and we have stayed in both chain and bontique hotels before. This hotel is definitely the best. 5 - 10 minutes walking distance to Metro, great selection of restaurants, grocery stores in a safe and upscale neighbourhood. The room is smallish but this is normal for Paris. The bed is comfortable and the bathroom is good size and modern. Wi Fi is free and works great. Of course, the best quality is the staff. They are friendly, always willing to help, speak good English and provide great recommedation on restaurants, directions, etc. We will definitely stay at this hotel again!.

Reviews.Title: “Met all our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: SylvieH10
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel based on the TripAdvisor reviews, and we were not disappointed! My daughter and I went on a weekend shopping/sightseeing trip. The hotel was convenient to where the Airport bus dropped us off (Porte Maillot) and convenient to metro. There was also a nice selection of places to eat within walking distance of the hotel. Our room was very nice, a big bed (actually two twins put together), with a very nice modern, large bathroom, by Parisian standards. The best quality of this small hotel, however, is the staff. They are very enthousiastic, and are very willing to go out of their way to assist you in every way possible, without being intrusive. I will definitely stay at this hotel again! Sylvie and Megan, Washington, DC

Reviews.Title: “great choice in the 3 star category”
Reviews.Author: lkamman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Foch in January in the larger "chambre familiale" which was ideal with our 16 year old son. It is very conveniant to take the air France bus to Porte Maillot from CDG and walk 6 blocks to the Hotel. The staff, to a person, is delightful and helpful with any questions. I speak some French but their English is quite good. The breakfast for 13 euro is reasonable-great rolls,croissant,cheese,meats, hard boiled eggs,cereal,yogurt. It is a quiet location and yet you are close to 2 metro stops, restaurants and a small grocery store. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ivorhooper
Reviews.Content: Went to Residence Foch on 22nd Jan for just 2 nights. Stayed in the family suite and was very impressed with everything about the hotel. The staff were very pleasant and helpful, the room was very large for a Paris hotel and was decorated beautifully. The location is perfect especially if you have flown in to Beauvais airport on a Ryanair flight as it is 15mins walk from the Port Maillot bus stop where the shuttle bus stops at. There is a good selection of restaurants and cafes nearby and the metro is easy to get to. All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: FdV62
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night in December 2008. The hotel staff is very friendly and go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. The location of the hotel is in a quiet area very close to the Metro and walking distance from good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great attitude.”
Reviews.Author: Pancuse
Reviews.Content: I have been in Paris several times. Staying from fancy and expensive hotels all the way down to the "charming" classic Paris hotel. I gave Residence Foch a chance given the reviews and they were right! It is a superb small hotel with every single individual working there willing to go the extra mile to make your stay more pleasant. The owner is also available (Madam Nelly) ready to help you out on anything and always with a big smile. Next time on Paris I will be back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel !”
Reviews.Author: enogastronauta
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights 5,6,7,8 Jan 09 Hotel Foch is a great place to stay. The howner Madame Rolland and her staff is very friendly and helpfull, many thanks to Chedì and Mehmed for their professionalism. We needed a doctor for our daughter and Madame Rolland was made available with love, one hour and a Doctor was in our room. the Hotel Foch is a little jewel in a quiet area of paris,if you want hustle,car traffic this hotel is not good for you. Near to the metro (about 500 mt), restaurant, bakery,cafè, laundry, and other. our family room was large, lovely decorated, very clean and comfortable (tv-flat air cond, wifi, mini bar, tea and coffe facilities, iron and iron board) Buffet Breakfast is excellent. I work in italian hotel, and believe me when I say that the hotel Foch is the right choice in Paris. Will stay here the next time. Famiglia Bellucci - Lucca - Tuscany- Italy

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nereid1
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel Foch on a website and were trying to decide between a hostel like place and Residence Foch...boy were we glad we decided to go with Hotel Residence Foch! From the beginning the staff were delightful. We took an all night train from Venice and came in early in the morning. Even though check in was much later, I had emailed and requested our room if possible be ready early, and it was. They were delightful! They offered great advice and gave us a good map of Paris. One night after an all day extravaganza at the Lourve we were exhausted and just wanted to watch a movie and eat in. Not only did they order the food for us and pay for it (putting the bill on our room), but they set it up so nicely on a room service tray and brought it to us. I loved everything about this hotel, but especially the service. The room was comfortable and clean, and we slept so very well. Thank you so much for the wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Stay-”
Reviews.Author: speedyland
Reviews.Content: I am so grateful that we found this hotel via Trip Advisor. This was our first visit to Paris & the hotel ambience, staff, and location absolutely made our trip perfect. My husband, 12-year old son, & I stayed in one of the Suites. The rooms were spatious, nicely decorated and clean. Plenty of closet room and drawer space. The Mattresses were very comfortable. The staff was attentive and responsive. When we visit Paris again, we will return to Hotel Residence Foch.

Reviews.Title: “Desrves its Top Ten place”
Reviews.Author: macalan
Reviews.Content: This hotel prides, and bases much of its business, on its high Tripadvisor rating. I hadn't been to Paris before but doing the usual research showed that hotel rooms are generally small and expensive and without spending a lot of money it is hard to predict how good the quality will be. Luckily we came across Hotel Residence Foch, a small but charming hotel near the Champs-Elysees. Firtsly, the staff is unfalteringly friendly and helpful and gave us tips on how to get around and where to find gorgeous local restaurants. We had nice breakfasts of continental style with a range of cereals, fresh breads, cold meats, tea/coffee, etc. We had a reasonable room only rate for a slightly small (as expected) clean room with a large en-suite. The heating was good given the cold time of year and the bed was cosy and comfortable. We would highly recommend a stay at this honest and pleasant hotel and look forward to going back some time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff & Location”
Reviews.Author: gjob
Reviews.Content: I just spent 3 nights in Hotel residence Foch & I must say I was pleasently surprised. The staff were excellent- very friendly & could not have been more attentive,recommending excellent restaurants nearby etc. The hotel itself is located on a quiet side street where a number of Embassies are located. 2 metro stops are within a 3 minute walk. The rooms are typical of most european boutique hotels - being on the smaller side, however they were well equipped with safe, minibar etc. when I return to Paris, I will definitely return to the Residence Foch where I know the staff look after their guests rather than in some impersonal hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “If you want clean, comfortable rooms for an affordable price in Paris”
Reviews.Author: whirled_trevolar
Reviews.Content: then you should book this nice little family hotel. With three stars, you should not expect the most luxurious or spacious room in Paris, but a nice, clean room at an affordable price. This hotel is located in the upscale 16 th district, very close to the Parisian subway (Porte Maillot) and walking distance to the Arc de Triomphe and even the Tour Eiffel (25 mins). If any American still wants to use the adage "the French are rude, " he ought to stay at this hotel. The people are extremely helpful and very friendly; Nelly (the owner) and her staff will accommodate any of your needs and desires in whatever language you speak (they're fluent in English, Spanish and even French!). It is rare that I have encountered a similar experience in the US. So, if you're heading to Paris, look into residence Foch, if you want to enjoy the city more than your hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hmsoapy
Reviews.Content: I booked three nights at Hotel Residence Foch due to the positive reviews on here. My friend and I were not disappointed. As soon as we arrived, we were warmly greeted. Our room was comfortable and very clean. The hotel is very close to Ave Foch, a beautiful avenue with very presigious residences and lined with chesnut trees which leads up to the Arc de Triomphe. We used the Port Dauphine metro to get where we wanted, which was only a few minutes walk. The staff at the hotel were friendly and welcoming. They were extremely helpful when my friend had her wallet stolen on the RER. They helped us to find the police and even offered to translate for us. They spoke excellent English.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Staff Make This Hotel One Of The Best”
Reviews.Author: ClareScotland
Reviews.Content: Discovered this hotel via trip adviser and was impressed by its reviews. In reality it matched up to all that was said in its favour. We arrived to discover our room had been upgraded to a suite free of charge and to find that the truly charming staff were completely geared to ensuring our stay was great. Their charming, patient response to my very rusty, cobwebbed use of the French language was absolutely delightful. Centrally located the hotel has much to offer. Despite its close proximity to the Champs Elysees and Arc de Triomphe, it was incredibly quiet with no traffic noise and guests encouraged to respect the request for quietness after 10p.m. This was a truly wonderful trip and the hotel an amazing find - chiefly because of its attentive, yet not intrusive, lovely staff. Thank you all. We'll most certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly, comfortable hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: thepolarbeer
Reviews.Content: Hotel Foch really contributed to an amazing stay in Paris and we would definitely recommend it to both business and personal travellers alike. - Charming rooms, comfortable and well-equipped - Good location in the western part of town - close to the tube and Arc de Triomph/La Defense business district, in pleasant residential street - All of the staff we met were extremely helpful and personable - the service being the best we have encountered in all of Europe - Breakfasts were pleasant and enjoyable in comfortable surroundings Note, the hotel is located within an old, character building so it is not very sound-proof and very light sleepers should be aware that noise from other guests is audible within rooms. Look forward to returning as soon as we can!

Reviews.Title: “one night stay”
Reviews.Author: Welltravelled4
Reviews.Content: We decided to visit our beloved Paris for one Saturday night as a birthday treat for my husband. Travelled Easyjet from Bristol which is always (in our experience) very good. As, unfortunately, we could only manage one night, we decided to stay near the 'Air France' coach drop off at the Arc du Triumphe. The Hotel Residence Foch is actually a 20 - 25 minute walk so not quite as near as we thought. We sifted through the Tripadvisor reports and selected this hotel as it looked lovely and we were not wrong. We requested double room no. 62 as had seen photos of this on a previous review - lovely room with large balcony overlooking the street but very quiet as so high up. The bathroom was also very nice with good shower with closing doors (no bath). The breakfast was just ok in my opinion, and when we asked for more coffee we were only brought enough for one person. There could have been a larger selection of breads and pastries. But anyway, the breakfast area was pleasant enough & with the classical music playing it made it quite relaxing. Don't think we'd stay here next time, prefer the Opera Quarter.....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: ECrowther
Reviews.Content: This is a small boutique hotel near Porte Maillot, walking distance from Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees, in a quiet residential area, convenient to the Porte Maillot metro (3 blocks away). The staff is extremely friendly and helpful in every way, and assistant manager Jean Louis is effusively so. They really make you feel at home, taken care of. The building is a tall, narrow one with cozy rooms that are reasonable in size for Europe, very clean, tastefully decorated, comfortable and modern amenities (bathroom amenities, kettle with coffee/tea, in-room safe, shoe shine sponge, a small minibar, extra pillows and blankets, well-positioned flat-screen TV, and sufficient electrical outlets for several devices. We had 2 rooms on 2 separate stays, and all 4 rooms were very nice. We did find that in 1 of them, they had put 2 twins together to make a matrimonial bed (very common in Europe), the gap was quite perceptible, and 1 of them was too hard for our taste. There also was a bit of noise at night, not from the street at all, but because people going up and down the narrow, creaking staircase, talking and opening/closing doors could be heard. If you need absolute silence, it might bother you. The breakfast is served in a cozy and attractive dining room, and the food is perfectly decent, with a small variety of choices. They bring in fresh bread each morning, the most important detail. Also yogurt, cold cereals, milk, fruit, eggs, crackers and the like. We were happy here and will stay here again, without question. Remember, if you need anything, just ask the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home.”
Reviews.Author: anacasales
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located. Close to Port Maillot Metro Station and also Argentine Metro Station. Close to RER station. Excellent location. Very classy. Excellent room. Very big room compared to other hotels we already stayed. Excellent rate with a breakfast tha is unforgettable. Such a clean and silent hotel. We literaly felt like home.

Reviews.Title: “It's like staying at the home of a wealthy Parisian friend”
Reviews.Author: DyerMaker
Reviews.Content: Located in the 16th Arrondissement, which -- to Manhattanites -- is basically the "Upper East Side" of Paris (even though it's on the western part of the city), Hotel Residence Foch is nestled in a mostly urbane residential neighborhood. The hotel is situated on a short, narrow street, next to the United Arab Emirates embassy and at the far end of the street from the German embassy. As an ex-pat living in France, I think that the location and accommodations combine to give you a taste of what it would be like to actually live in Paris, among its most well-to-do denizens...complete with servants who are at your disposal. Given the location, be prepared to walk. Then again, if you're not prepared to walk, you probably aren't up for a getaway to Paris in the first place. You're very close to the Arc de Triomphe and a handful of restaurants and brasseries. There's a wonderful park nearby if you're jonesing for a stroll away from the press of tourists. And Il Trocadero...and the Tour Eiffel are a spirited walk from the hotel, which is actually more like a high end bed and breakfast with its individually decorated rooms and small but excellent staff. Prior to making our reservations, we had read here on TripAdvisor that the hotel is a short walk from the Metro...and it's true: it's actually a pleasant stroll. But if you've got luggage, as we did, it's a real hassle. At the very least, if you take the 1 train through Paris to the hotel, make sure that you depart from the rear of the train and save yourself many intersections and at least one round on your way to the hotel. The service at the front desk was exceptional. The staff was highly attentive. We booked two rooms and they made sure we were close together. And we were only charged for the breakfasts we actually consumed. The staff will gladly speak English...and they prefer to do so when making long explanations so as to avoid miscommunications. We will be returning to Paris frequently and we think we've found the "go to" place for our future stays.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: travellinon46
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately only got to spend one night at the Hotel Residence Foch , our last night after a months holiday in Europe. Great service we were warmly welcomed. Shade gave us great advice on last minute shopping spots and restaurants with live music for our last night in Paris. We were upgraded to a suite and the suite was spacious and spotlessly clean. Definitely recommend it as a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rodrigo_SaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Residence Foch for 6 nights and everything was perfect. In a great location, quiet neighborhood (very safe),within walking distance to Eiffel Tower, Champs de Elysee and easy access to the Metro and the RER stations (to go to Versailles for example). The room was very clean and had everything we needed. The bathroom was spotless too. It was a non-smooking room on the 2nd floor, with a small balcony. Breakfast was very good. The service was excellent and the staff (so many thanks Chedi and Nelly) were warm and always happy to help. We can highly recommend this Hotel!!! Thanks for our perfect saty in Paris. Rodrigo and Isabela (Brazil)

Reviews.Title: “Family Hotel, Residence Hotel Foch Paris”
Reviews.Author: poppyh1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way back to UK for 3 nights and were impressed with the friendly and quite 'close' ambience. No winding step staircase to an upper room here - but a proper lift! And a waiter who 'runs' around the tables at breakfast and obviously enjoys having you in his dining room. A word of caution about the local directions - if getting off the metro at Port Mailleau, make sure you have your bearings on the way in - we came out after a night at Moulon Rouge and got hopelessly lost finally getting a cab 400m home! Head to St Germaine - shops cafes markets fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “A liitle gem!”
Reviews.Author: LaForge
Reviews.Content: Excellent, clean and tidy hotel in a lovely area with charming and attentive staff. Would recommend highly and chose it after the other recommendations on Trip Advisor. Definately a place to return to when in Paris. Well done.

Reviews.Title: “The essens of lovely Paris”
Reviews.Author: jonkb
Reviews.Content: We where four people staying at the Hotel Foch at the end of october, and let me just say it was perfect. The hotel and its exclusive neighborhood made our trip something special. There are very easy to get aroud the city from here and the Champs-Élysées are just a few minutes away from the lovely hotel entrance. At the Hotel Foch u stay in a central and quiet with among other a real prince as youre neighbor. But its not the hotel or the neighborhood that makes this the perfect hotel experience...its the staff. We have lived at hotels in Paris with the double rate of the Hotel Foch, but the service and the homey feeling wheren´t close to what Nelly and her excellent staff gave us 24/7. A state of the art example for other hotels. This is our home in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: handu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were so impressed with our stay at Hotel Residence Foch! The concierge and staff were so friendly and helpful. The location was great, next to Le Bois de Boulogne which was a good option for morning runs. Close to Metro/Train station, and walking distance to Arc du Triomphe and Champs-Elysées. It's in a quiet area, not the bustle of the Latin Quarter. The room was small but clean, with a nice-sized bathroom. Highly recommended, and we would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow.”
Reviews.Author: pugsy57
Reviews.Content: This hotel , perfectly placed in Paris for any sight seeing worth seeing is just perfect in every way, clean spacious rooms, polite and respectful staff and English speaking if your language skills are typically British like mine. Great places to eat nearby and a great place to stay do that you are close to the parisian nightlife. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: California_Pygmalion
Reviews.Content: Great hotel located near the Champs Elysee & Arc de Triomphe. Blue line of metro will take you right up to the Sacre Couer, Montmartre & Red Light locations (Anvers stop, blue line "2"). If you enjoy to walk, hotel is only a couple blocks to the Arc & Champs Elysee (take the Avenue Foch). Staff/Features: Hotel staff is superb, providing 24 hour customer service. They all speak english fluently. The owner is a very nice woman who is more than helpful. The staff provides valuable suggestions/brochures to main attractions & local restaurants ( I used to live 2 metro stops from the hotel location and I love the area). There is internet service in the main lobby as well as a laptop for your use. Some rooms provide service, I believe, but check which rooms. Price: I found this hotel to be reasonably priced (well worth what you receive from the hotel). At the time we took our vacation, the hotel was rated #9 of 100 on TripAdvisor. You can look up prices through TripAdvisor when you click on the hotel's information. TripAdvisor will provide you with multiple different discount sites to choose the best rate. Food/Bar: Breakfast (fruit, croissants, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, coffee, tea, etc.) is served buffet style for approx. 13 euros. Worth it to us since we did not want to hunt down a boulangerie or sit in a restaurant for an hour (if we had more time, than possibly). There is also a bar in the hotel lobby that is open at all hours (however, no one ever uses it according to the staff). We stayed in a room above the lobby and we did not hear anyone downstairs. For dinner the hotel suggested a wonderful Italian restaurant around the corner, "Del Papa". Rooms: Rooms range from standard to deluxe (even between the two types of rooms there is a range). If you are tall, request a large bed (6'7" person slept comfortably). We stayed in room 14 on the second floor. Space was not huge for this room but it was a very nice room. There is a safe in the closets to protect any valuables & coffee/tea kettle in your room. I did not find an AC unit in the room but you can open the tall windows to receive some fresh air. You can hear a little bit of noise to the room adjacent to yours but I'm a pretty light sleeper & the noise didn't wake me up. Location: If you fly into Beauvais (RyanAir flights), the bus drops you at the city depot which is located within 4 blocks of the hotel. On the hotel website, they will provide directions & a map on how to reach the hotel from the other airport. I just provided Beauvais info b/c the hotel directions said "Use Public Transportation". Metro/Bus:From the hotel, the closest metro lines are Porte Dauphine (end of blue line "2") & Porte Maillot (yellow line "1"). The hotel will provide you a city map with the train and metro lines. We walked to the Champs Elysee and took the tour bus "Les Cars Rouges" (red tour bus) that stops at all the main sites. If you are visiting for a short time, I highly suggest taking one of these buses b/c you are able to see a lot more instead of jumping on and off the metro. The tour bus I suggested you can hop on/off for two days and the closest stop to the hotel is "Etoile". It's a double decker bus (great for all those photo takers). I found this bus stops at all the attractions except for Montmartre/Sacre-Couer (just have to take 1 metro line but get ready to walk up some stairs). Tour Suggestion: On a seperate note, if you have the chance to take a boat ride down the Seine, I highly recommend this. I used to take visitors on a boat ride at night b/c the city's attractions are very different at night (Concorde, Notre Dame, Eiffel Tour). We hopped on a boat near the Eiffel Tour at 7 p.m. and we were able to see the Eiffel Tour lit up with the European Union stars and color. Also, extra treat is seeing the Eiffel Tour at 8 p.m. (probably on the hour when it's dark) b/c it sparkles for a couple minutes. Hope this helps!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: janRotoruaNewZealand
Reviews.Content: i can not recommend this hotel highly enough.We had the most charming room, Room 10,was very large with a lounge and writing desk,looks out to a pretty courtyard.The staff were so friendlt and helpful and that was all the staff.they are very knowledgeable and have maps and advise a plenty. walking distance to arc de triomphe and place de la concorde. we didn't use the Metro ,just walked everywhere We contacted the hotel for bookings and paid E 160 a night.,

Reviews.Title: “Genuinely Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Peter11435
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Paris and I was therefore keen to choose a hotel that had been highly recommended - the Hotel Foch has certainly been that on Trip Advisor and now I can see why. It is located in a quiet, seemingly high class district of Paris that is convenient for both the Metro and the RER. The best thing about the place however is the staff who are both friendly and appear genuinely keen to help and/or offer any advice required. Having selected a standard room, it was understandably small being a city centre location, it was however clean and included a bath too. Overall the Hotel Foch represented good value (£133 a night for two people in a double room) for what is unquestionably an expensive city to stay in

Reviews.Title: “Home From Home”
Reviews.Author: Aplanblakbry
Reviews.Content: We can highly recommend this Hotel. In a great, quiet location, within easy access to the Metro and the RER stations. A real home from home experience. From the minute we arrived we received an excellent, friendly and most helpful service. The room was relatively small yet perfectly adequate. It was extremely clean, (I’m fussy about clean!) comfortable with air con if required and very pleasantly decorated. A bright, modern en-suite bathroom with complimentary toiletries was cleaned daily to perfection by the housekeeping staff. Reception could not do enough to ensure you were equipped with all the necessary information to ensure you made the most of your time in Paris from supplying detailed mapping of the area and travel routes to a host of recommended restaurants three of which we sampled within very close proximity to the hotel and were not disappointed with. A lovely continental buffet breakfast awaited you every morning until 10.30am, great if you’re not the earliest of risers! This part of the hotel was also beautifully presented, a lovely little area, pleasantly decorated with very attentive but not intrusive staff. Everyone was so polite and ‘at your service’. All in all a lovely part of our stay in Paris! We’d have no hesitation in booking Hotel Residence Foch should we find ourselves looking at a trip to Paris in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: harleysmom56
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was extremely helpful. Nothing was a problem, and their restaurant recommendations were outstanding! Rooms are clean and comfortabe and include tea maker and mini bar. Baths were spotless. Location was very convenient to the metro. We will stay here the next time we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “loved the Hotel Residence Foch”
Reviews.Author: tedotedo
Reviews.Content: Lovely, friendly hotel, comfortable rooms, great location. Nice breakfast. Staff are so welcoming and helpful, it really made my stay so pleasant. I left my video camera there when I left, next week it was back with me having been posted off by secure courier.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: DevonOscar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 3rd to 8th september and it was really lovely. The hotel staff were all so helpfull and friendly and happy. A special thank you to the reception staff who were really lovely. The hotel is very nice ,very clean and nicely kept .Its very conveniently placed for most of the main attraction and the area is very safe and theres numerous cafes and restaurants which are very good Del Pappa is Italian and theres another one which is also very good but we cant remember its name,its in a road called Avenue Malakoff , but you will fined all you need. Theres also some very good boulangeries in the area if you fancy some good cakes etc. We will definitely return to this hotel, and would recommend it, you should book early if you go though as its very popular .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and friendly”
Reviews.Author: jandjnewhampshire
Reviews.Content: Comfortable room in an old building in the embassy area of Paris. Close to metro and the tourist areas. The staff are excellent and extemely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful!”
Reviews.Author: Where2Gowhere2go
Reviews.Content: A good location close to the Champs de Elyse and within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower. In a quiet neighborhood, the rooms are nice and the hotel is charming and quiet. The best part of the stay is the wonderful man at the front desk who has the best tips for visiting Paris. He is delightful!

Reviews.Title: “This is a lovely hotel, the rooms are quite small but very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: DeeSunborn
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, the staff are very helpful, the rooms are small but very comfortable and clean. Breakfast was very good.We stayed with my son and daughter in law and we all thoroughly enjoyed everything about the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and lovely people”
Reviews.Author: NeilandJo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights from the 3rd August, with my girlfriend. Our room was lovely with a large bathroom which was spotless. The neighbourhood was very quiet and our short walk to the Champs-elysees every morning was great to get to all the sights. The service was excellent and the people were warm and always happy to help. Thanks for making our perfect stay in Paris very comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel with an exceptional staff.”
Reviews.Author: KristinKorea
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a family suite (quad room) in July 2008. The room was about the size of two regular European hotel rooms with one bathroom. It had one king bed (two twins pushed together actually) and two other separate beds - a cot and a day bed. It really was perfect for us - a family of 4 with kids ages 8, 11. The location is OK - a 5 to 10 minute walk to the metro station with restaurants and grocery markets close by. The Arc de Triumph is a 10 minute walk and the Eiffel Tour 20 minutes. We had to take the metro to the Louvre and Notre Dame areas. The breakfast, although is an additional cost, was very good - your typical European breakfast with breads, pastries, yogurt, cereal, meat, cheese, dried fruit, and boiled eggs. The service at this hotel is perhaps the best service I have received in any hotel including many 5 star hotels I have stayed at. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly and I can't say enough good things about every single employee I encountered. In summary, there might be places to stay that are a bit closer to the main attractions, but the price (180 Euros for a family of 4 in high season) and more important, the staff, make this hotel highly recommended by our family!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: macsima
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here right after landing in Paris for the beginning of our European Summer Tour 08. The hotel was fairly basic, but was clean and had most everything you would need. The location is what sets it apart. Quiet area, but close to all, with a view of the top of the Eiffel Tower from our balcony. For the price, in Paris, this can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and Cute Hotel”
Reviews.Author: muwa2007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at the Foch and absolutely loved it. The hotel is cozy and comfortable and our room was great. The room and the bathroom were both clean and comfortable. The breakfast was also great. The staff is very friendly and extremely helpful with answering all of our questions. The hotel is within 10 minutes walking distance of two metro stops and is located in a quiet safe neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: italin84
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful! Located in a quiet up-scale Paris neighborhood, this charming boutique hotel is conveniently located close to the Metro and a variety of shops and restaurants. The rooms are spacious, beautifully decorated, and well appointed. The staff was friendly and could not have been more helpful. We will definitely plan on a return stay the next time we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, and all the basics done very well.”
Reviews.Author: Vicky_and_Andy
Reviews.Content: The first thing I noticed when checking in was a large sign on the reception desk saying "if you like this hotel, please write a review on tripadvisor.com." Well, it's pretty obvious that lots of people like this hotel, and after 3 days there I can see why. Although this hotel is not flash, and there's nothing fancy here, the basics are done very well. Every staff member I encountered was extremely polite and helpful, and there really was service with a smile - a real genuine smile, and not a forced "have a nice day type" smile. My room was adequately sized, larger than other rooms I've had when paying the same price in Paris. The room was spotlessly clean, and well decorated. The bed was comfortable, the TV and air conditioning worked, there were tea making facilities in the room, and a separate chair. The bathroom was well equipped decently sized, and the shower powerful. Breakfast was of a good quality - the coffee and fresh fruit salad were particularly good, as were the freshly baked croissants. There wasn't a lot of choice, but that wasn't necessary, because what was there was great. All in all, this is a great hotel, and in my opinion by far the the best of comparably priced Paris hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel For Me In Paris!”
Reviews.Author: cookie43
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Paris several times and this hotel was hands down my favourite. It was much better than the 4 star hotel in the Latin Quarter where I have stayed previously . I stayed in a twin room for three nights with my daughter. When you walk in, you know you are in Paris, it radiates charm. Every staff member was friendly, polite and ready to assist you in anyway possible. Our room was cozy and beautiful with a lovely French window. The first thing I did when I walked into the room was get my camera out. It was that beautiful. The room was spotlessly clean, the maid service was excellent. I had breakfast there each day, the breakfast room was very lovely and I enjoyed the company of fellow travellers from many different coutries, including France. I also enjoyed the lovely service and the variety of breakfast items available. We enjoyed the quiet neighbourhood. If you walk two streets over the area has shops, restaurants, bakeries, groceries etc... There are two Metro stops close by, no more than a 5 minute walk. The area has a local feel to it which I really enjoyed. We arrived on the Air France Coach and found the hotel within a 5-10 minute walk. There was no need for a taxi or a metro. The roundtrip Air France shuttle was 22 euros. We took it back to the airport from the same stop without incident.

Reviews.Title: “cosy little hotel”
Reviews.Author: christinehen
Reviews.Content: We had a short break in Paris in January and this hotel was recommended by a few of my colleagues. We were not disappointed. The staff are very friendly and helpful, the rooms were comfy, cosy and clean with a lovely bathroom. The tea and coffee making facilities in the room were very welcome at the end of a long day walking and sightseeing. The area was very quiet at night but at no time did we feel unsafe. There were plenty of restaurants in the vicinity (although some of them were on the expensive side but this is Paris!!) The breakfast was lovely, just enough to set you up for the day. We were within walking distance of the metro and train station (and the Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysee) and it was easy to get to our shuttle bus for Beauvais from there too. All in all, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay- all the Christmas lights were still up- quite romantic -and even the weather was kind to us. Would go back.

Reviews.Title: “small but clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: hgaeo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Residence Foch with my family at the beginning of June and everything was fine: very clean rooms, friendly staff and close to metro station... Nelly is gorgeous! 5 stars from all of us! Stefano from ITALY

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: emretoronto
Reviews.Content: I stayed here June 17-19 based on reviews I read here and for the price the experience was way above my expectations. From the airport I took the RER B line then switched to the RER C (at St MIchel Notre Dame) which has a Foche Ave stop. Its a five minute walk to the hotel from the exit (the exit is also right beside the Port Daphine metro station) and the hotel is in a beatiful neighbourhood. I arrived way too early for check in but I think they see this all the time as the staff told me I can leave my bags and go exploring. The staff are extra friendly and were more than happy to answer any questions. I must have asked them everything from directions, to restaurant recommendation to how to say phrases in french. I was travelling alone and the room was a bit small but it was perfect for me. It had all the amenities including a/c, iron with board, mini bar, tv etc..plus my room (#22) had a french balcony overlooking the street which was a nice touch. Bathroom was modern and everything was very clean and crisp. TV had about 20 channels everything from sports to movies to sit coms - but of course you're in paris so I don't know how much TV watching you should be doing. They also have a laundry service but there are dry cleaners in the neighbourhood. There is also a butcher, grocery store, bakery all within 5 minute walking distance of the hotel. There is a computer in the lobby with internet which is free to use to check your email or surf the net. The hotel is near Foche and Ave de la Grande Armee both of which lead to the Arc de Triomph. The walk is about 10 minutes to the Arc and from there you can walk (or take the metro but really you should walk..) down Champ Elysees, maybe cut across Montaigne (as far as I can tell this is where all the high fashion stores are), across the Seine to the Eifell Tower and then along the Seine to anything else you want to see.... The hotel has breakfast which I had one day. In most cafes you can get breakfast for about 5-6 euros maybe a little more and this will include a hot drink, a croissant, juice, half a baguette, butter and jam. The hotel breakfast is more expensive but you have a wider choice of jams, honey, nutella, cereal, different pastries and so on. I think if you're in a rush it might be worth it otherwie stop by any one of the 1,000,000 cafes :) I only got one name, Isabella, who was working the front desk the days I stayed there. I also met the owner who was in with her newly born baby. Just to give you an idea of the type of service - I was going to the opera in the evening and needed a shirt dry cleaned. The local dry cleaner couldn't turn it around by the time I needed it but the owner said she would take care of it. When I returned to my hotel room that evening there was my shirt, nicely dry cleaned waiting for me.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nickelass
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the reviews I read on this site, and was pleasantly surpsied during our stay there. First, the hotel is in a nice, quiet location off the usual tourist track. Some find this a disadvantage, but we found that great restuarants packed with locals were only a few blocks away. This was a great break from the countless brasseries near Champs-Elysee that seemed to all have a similar offering. We also took the metro a few times, which was only about a 10 minute walk away. The rooms were small, but our bathroom was actually quite large. Another group in our party actually had a nice balcony with a table! It was perfect for gathering at the end of a day to talk over a good bottle of wine. There was also a garden terrace in the back of the hotel that all guests could use. All of the rooms were incredibly charming! The hotel staff was also very nice, and helped us with any requests. Overall, this hotel was a great value and I really did like the location. I've been to Paris before and stayed on Rue di Rivoli, which is quite busy. I actually preferred the Foch's quiet location off the beaten track.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhh, Paris!”
Reviews.Author: SherrySparkle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the lovely Residence Foch for 8 nights in May 2008 and enjoyed every single aspect of our stay. After looking through lots of different hotel booking sites and reading many, many reviews the clincher for me was that I simply fell in love with the look of the "blue room" on the hotel website. Residence Foch has a classic look that is charmingly French without the over the top scarey, flowery decor that so many Paris hotels seem to have (hmmm, red stripey wall paper matched with lurid florals - not my cup of tea thankyou!). I requested the "blue room" when I booked and this wonderful hotel obliged by allocating us the 7th floor room with balcony views of the Eiffel Tower. All of the staff were extremely friendly and helpful and were always cheery and willing to encourage our pathetic attempts at speaking french! My only concern - having not been to Paris before - was that the location seemed a bit out the way. A poster on another forum gave me the advice to "choose a hotel you like and don't worry too much about the location as nothing is very far away in Paris". What good advice - with 2 Metro stations and an RER stop close by the location was never a hinderance during out stay. After spending a few days visiting some of the crowded attractions it was nice to come back to our quieter area each night. There is a good selection of restaurants within walking distance to choose from including Italian and Indian. Also a laundromat, supermarket, patisseries and bike hire stations in nearby streets. All in all a wonderful place to stay and I wouldn't hesitate to recomend it to friends or stay here again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Return visit to Hotel Residence Foch as good as the last time”
Reviews.Author: brad_moffat
Reviews.Content: Well, I was as good as my word from my last review of this hotel, I went back to this hotel as I knew it would be good. I'm sure the standard of hotels can change over time but I can assure you that the standards are still as impeccably high as they were on my last visit to Hotel Residence Foch. Not much has changed: the staff are superb, the breakfast is very good even if it is a little pricey at €12. The 16th arrondissement is an exclusive and expensive part of the city but the hotel is only 5 minutes walk from Porte Maillot and 10 minutes from Porte Dauphine so finding somewhere for a cheaper petit dejeuner shouldn't be too difficult. The room we had this time was a twin with the beds pushed together and this was fine. The bedroom and bathroom were clean and bright and made for a comfortable stay. TV reception was poor, but then my French isn't that great anyway. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel and would not hesitate to return for a third visit.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: cheerioh
Reviews.Content: Review is late since we stayed early May 2007 - but I wanted to write how much we enjoyed this hotel. We arrived early in the morning and our room was not ready. The staff allowed us to leave all our bags (there were a lot of them) at the hotel until the room was ready. The room was small (it is Paris), but was extremely clean and comfortable. The staff were excellent in advising how to get around and where to go. It is close to the Metro, and close to the shuttle to the airport but not the closest to the main attractions of the city - if you are planning to walk. A good 20-30 minute walk (though it was a great way to end the day for us) back to the hotel. It is on a side street so it is quiet at night - though at the same time if you are alone could be a little eery. Morning breakfast buffet was great. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “J'adore Hotel Residence Foch”
Reviews.Author: cestmagnifique
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my trip in Paris and Hotel Residence Foch was a wonderful place for me to stay. The hotel is located very close to the Porte Maillot station and walkable to Champs Elysee and the rest of France. The staff was very friendly and helpful. It's such a quaint bed and breakfast. My room faced the little courtyard. I have never felt so welcomed. The staff was very knowledgeable and made my first time in Paris such a joy. I'll definitely be returning to Paris and to Hotel Residence Foch.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: MiamiMo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small and on a side street. It is about a 5 minute car ride to the Arc of the Triumph. The elevator is the smallest elevator I have ever been in. Four people fit inside tight with no luggage. It was maintaned clean. The front desk attendant helped take our luggage up. The bathrooms were clean and I did not see anything gross. The room had a flat panel tv. I stayed in a four person room with 2 twin beds and one queen bed. The beds were comfortable. We had a view of the interior courtyard...nothing specatcular, but that was fine. There was airconditioning in the room which we did need to use. My only complaint would be the parking. If you bring your own car, which we did as we rented a car, the parking is very bad. It was very difficult pulling the car over to unload our luggage as there is no space. The side street that the hotel is located on is a one way street with cars parked on both sides of the street and only space for 1 car traffic in the middle. There was no where to stop except for the garage driveway of the home next door. We stopped there temporarily to unload our baggage and the homeowner came out and started to scream at us in French that we could not park their although all we were doing was unloading our luggage. Then when we went to park the car, we had to go about 5 blocks away to finally find a parking area. We had to walk back to the hotel through the isolated streets at night. We had no way of knowing if it was safe, but we did not encounter anyone on our walk back to the hotel so everything worked out. In conclusion, if you drive your own car, this hotel is not the most ideal one for you, if not, then it's a great hotel for the money considering the prices in Paris and its ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “Who says the French aren't friendly?”
Reviews.Author: Inverloch
Reviews.Content: No doubt there are many lovely little hotels in Paris but the Residence Foch is not only all that, but has that important element that makes a "nice" hotel a great one. Of course you can spend hundreds of euros to get 5 star luxury, but for a price affordable to the average traveller, Residence Foch delivers a 5 star service with the friendliest French you have ever met. They make you feel so very welcome, with the bouncy ever smiling Jean Louis, helpful Al, and Nelly, the gorgeous young owner (baby due any time now!), solicitous and making sure all is in order. Restaurant tips, ticket information, transport, opening times. etc... no problems. You are never made to feel uncomfortable asking. Rooms are lovely, decorated in cheerful provencal yellow, with fresh bedding, and bathrooms immaculate and modern. Of course they are not large but perfectly adequate. There are thoughtful touches not usually available in european hotels such as , kettle for making tea/coffee, iron/ironing board and a safe as well as the usual mini bar. There is also free broadband and computer to check email. Breakfast is a substantial buffet. cook your own poached/boiled eggs, breads, cereals, fruits, ham/cheese, etc.. served in a delightful cosy breakfast room. We were always so happy to return to our little corner of Paris at the end of the day and be greeted by Nelly and her staff. What more can I say?

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in 16th in Paris”
Reviews.Author: choochPerth
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our first trip to Paris, where we stayed at the Residence Foch for 5 nights. Everything was great, absolutely no complaints. The staff were warm and friendly, and really went out of their way to help. They spoke excellent English, which is great if your French isn't so good, and provide good recommendations for meals, tours and getting around. The 16th is a quiet - and nearly boring - part of the city, but public transport easily accessible and cheap to get anywhere else. We paid 160Euro per night, were very happy with value for money this represented, and happily recommend to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: T.B.Patriot
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Paris and had a wonderful stay at this great hotel. Front desk was incredibly friendly and the rooms were excellent. It is a little out of the way but still the rest of Paris is quite accessible with two metro stops about 5 minutes away. Because it is in a residential area, night time is very quiet so you can sleep nicely. If you want hustle and bustle then this is not the place for you. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: MHow
Reviews.Content: Our second stay and as good as the first visit, the hotel is charming and warm in atmosphere and comfort. Nelly and her staff are absolutely fantastic, always friendly, helpful and greet every time with a big smile. The hotel is in an excellent upmarket location in a quiet side street but close to all public transport and easy to walk to Eiffel tower and other main sights of Paris. The rooms are tastefully decorated and beds very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Foch”
Reviews.Author: FelixStowe10
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 11 for three nights and concur with the previous reviewers that the hotel is a great place to stay. The staff generally makes or breaks a hotel and the staff here definitely added so much to our stay. They are all cheerful and endeavour to help in whatever way they can. The hotel is not large and has the feel of a family run business. The bedrooms also aren't large but are well equiped and the bed comfortable. You pay extra for breakfast - 12 euros at present - which seems a lot but isn't when compared with what else you could get elsewhere. The hotel is not central but the metro Daphine and Porte Maillot are 10mins easy walk away. With the metro being so cheap (1 euro 50) then this is not an issue. Eating out is expensive and probably more so in this area than in the centre. But there are plenty of eating places within 10mins walk which the hotel can advise you of. All in all the hotel is excellent value and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: purpletrippy
Reviews.Content: There are few places one goes where people truly care about you and your well being. Hotel Residence Foch is one of those places. Not only do staff go out of their way the ensure your stay in comfortable, but they also proactively offer you advice on how to make your trip as memorable as possible. The location is very central being a walking distance to many of the sights, and has two main metro stations very nearby. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone staying in Paris. =]

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: adventuregirlLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for one night in mid December. With Paris the choice of hotels is vast but this was a great choice. the location is perfect and everything is easily walkable from this hotel. The staff were extremely friendly and we had the top room with a terrace which was fantastic. Id totally recommend this small hotel for a weekend break in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A Most Enjoyable Experience”
Reviews.Author: treasureireland
Reviews.Content: Chris and Margaret Gold Coast Australia We have visited Paris on many occassions, staying in 3 and 4 Star Hotels. They were usually clean and comfortable, properly operated and located among many other similar hotels. Nothing really to complain about, but nothing exceptional either. Then we stayed at Hotel Residence Foch, to be honest the room was very clean and tidy, typical French decor, with a typical French outlook. What we expected. Not many hotels in the locality, more apartments for the locals and not too many typical tourists. We actually felt like we were in Paris not in an international locality competing with other tourists. Quite inspiring. Yet located in a nice part of town not far, walking distance in fact, from the Arc De Triomphe What we didn't expect was the ambiance, warmth and friendliness that you experienced within moments of entering. Nothing was a problem, directions, restaurants, places of interest, no matter what we seeked assistance for they delivered, without exception, and with a smile. You actually felt comfortable not foreign, which we value particularly when your stay is usually for only a few days. Breakfast was enjoyable, everything fresh and French. The cost was comparable to many other hotels in this range, very reasonable for the style and location. If your looking for a hotel where people care about you, and try their best to make your stay pleasant and a very memorable experience, then try Hotel Reidence Foch, we did and we will most certainly again. By the way, and my wife would vouch for this, I am not easily pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SteveandKaren
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights (7,8,9 March). Accomodation beautifully decorated and clean. Staff very friendly and extremely helpful. Buffet breakfast with an extensive selection to choose from. Hotel is in easy reach of two metro stations which take you to direct to major sites. We would have no hesitation in recommending to friends. Plenty of restaurants in the vicinity of the hotel, make sure you follow recommendations from the hotel staff otherwise it can be very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Freyberg
Reviews.Content: I had spent many months reviewing a variety of Hotels when planning our trip to Paris. I even booked several! Then I was fortunate I found Hotel Residence Foch it sounded just right. And I was! Our stay was truly fantastic the reception staff made us very welcome! Nothing was ever too much trouble. Our room was beautiful and of a high standard for a three star hotel particularly in Paris, yes the room was small but from previous experience that is the norm. The other benefit to staying in this area was the choice of restaurants, and the underground was only a 10minute walk, we recommend this hotel and would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Cosy Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scottash121
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed here for 3 nights over the Valentines weekend. I thought this hotel was great. The hotel itself is located in a nice neighbour hood were you do feel very safe. Its in a quiet location, close enough to reach the sites, ie Arce De Triomphe, Eiffel Tower etc, but is not bustling with tourists. The staff in the hotel were extremely pleasant and were always willing to help. The hotel room itself was big enough for two. The bathroom was of very good size. We didn't sample the breakfast. I would have no hesitations to reccomend this hotel to anyone, I will be back to hopefully! Many thanks.

Reviews.Title: “This really is a nice friendly hotel in a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: raven88
Reviews.Content: We booked on the strength of the other reviews and because I was working in the 16th Arondissement. The room was small but OK, good size bathroom and it's true, the staff are wonderful. Other reviewers had said they thought that the breakfast at €12 was expensive. if you just want a coffee and a croissant it is, but if you want cereal, juice, boiled egg, ham and pain au chocolate then it is good value. Only downside was that on our second night a room on the floor below got flooded and the noise of renovation the next day started at 8am and went through to 5pm. The staff were very apologetic and I know some guests were very angry. To me, these things happen. Close to metro and some good restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Stay at Hotel Foch”
Reviews.Author: Dislover
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Hotel Foch for three nights this January, 2008. The location of the hotel was about a mile from the Metro, with not a lot of restaurants or cafe's nearby. The room was very small, with just enough room to get in the bed on each side. We had originally picked the hotel because of the reasonable price, and positive reviews but again and again we were disappointed. The first night we realized we could hear every sound outside of our door, and coincedentally they happened to be doing construction in the very next room. Electric drills, hammers, the works. We asked to change rooms but there was nothing available, but we were assured the construction would stop soon. Around 7PM it ended. We went to take a shower, and to our dismay there was NO hot water. Not only that the shower head was bursting bouts of dirt all over the bathtub. We were very disappointed at this point to the point of wanting to check out and when we expressed our concerns the plumber of the hotel came up to our room and started SCREAMING at my husband saying my husband did not know what hot water was (because there isn't a difference between freezing and warm in his mind apparently). We ended up staying at the hotel because we had already paid and were given attitude for the rest of our stay. Also, we found out that the hot water heater had broken the night before from the receptionist. Instead of being honest about their problem, they lied straight to our faces and tried to deny any problem at all. We would never stay at hotel Foch again, or suggest it to anyone we know.

Reviews.Title: “Springsteen”
Reviews.Author: Citytraveler76
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during 3 days in december for the Springsteen concert in Bercy. The staff was very helpful and kind, the small elevator was fun indeed :). Our room was small but had all it needed, lovely view of the top of the E tower blinking during night time. The breakfast had everything a travelver needs to explore the city. The location was very good, close to metro and good resturants and small shops. Will stay here the next time in june when The Boss comes back.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Paris under 200 Euros”
Reviews.Author: SAM585
Reviews.Content: Having been to Paris many times and stayed in 3 and 4 star hotels throughout the city, I was still searching for a hotel I would go back to. All seemed too expensive, too small, too noisy, had no shower pressure, uncomfortable beds or snotty staff. So, I took the advise of Trip Advisers reviewers and have finally found the most wonderful place to stay. Everything from the other reviews is correct. The location is great - in a quiet street with a small shop and dry cleaners around the corner. Around 10 minutes walk from the Metro station and safe at night to walk the streets. The Arch de Triumph is about 10-15 minutes walk away and the Eiffel Tower about 20-25. Great restaurants to suit all budgets are also close by. The staff are wonderful, speaking perfect English for those who need it and French for those who want to practice. They are most helpful and will assist in any way. We were in there for New Years Eve and tried a to book a few restaurants but all were full. When we asked for help, the staff had booked us the restaurant we wanted at the time we wanted within 5 minutes! The rooms are quite large by Paris standards (I sneaked a peek through the door of most while they were being cleaned!). We had a non smoking Deluxe room on the 4th floor, and for 20Euros more a night than the standard, it is well worth it with an additional separate sitting room allowing you to really spread out. The bed was firm, the shower had good pressure and the in-room bar fridge has room for your own drinks if you want. As the hotel is located in a residential area, our view was of an internal courtyard and the back of other apartments, which made it very quiet. The room heating via radiators was good and can be easily adjusted. There is also an additional fan heater if you need it but were never turned it on and were never cold. All windows open fully to let in fresh air if you want. Rooms also had a/c but in December it was far from needed. There is a lift to all floors so you don’t have to take the stairs with your cases - one at a time though with bags coz its small. The breakfast is nice with cereal, breads, boiled eggs, fruit, juice and tea and coffee included for around 12 Euros. There is also an option for breakfast in your room for the same price. There is free internet though a computer in the lobby and the reception is 24/7. So, if you are looking for a Paris hotel with a price well under 200 Euros a night, I would highly recommend Residence Foch. I booked directly through their website and would recommend this for the best rate. You pay 1 nights deposit on your credit card which is subtracted upon checkout. Just follow the links to the hotel on Tripadvisor and you will find it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience for the Most Part”
Reviews.Author: Dignan3432
Reviews.Content: After spending most of a recent trip to Paris in business type hotels outside the center of the city, we finished our trip at the Hotel Residence Foch to experience a more boutique-type hotel. Since our other hotels were a completely different style I can't really say how this hotel compares with others similar to it, but I will try to explain the facts for my experience. First off, although there are three different metro/train options nearby, none are particularly close and after a long day of sightseeing (i.e. walking and standing in line) it would have been nicer to get back to the room a little quicker. The area is safe, quiet, and mostly residential, but does have some cafes and a small grocery market (which comes in handy if you don't want to spend a fortune on food) within easy walking distance. The Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees were within a mile or two of flat terrain walking so the location has some plusses and minuses. The hotel staff was very friendly and English was spoken by all. The room we had was tiny (#60) and was located next to the elevator so sleeping in much was difficult. The view was similar to the pictures shown, but the room was in need of some updating and/or basic touch-ups. Nothing horrible, but seemed easily fixable. The breakfast buffet was very refreshing, but should have come with the room based on my reservation and our credit card seems to suggest otherwise. Just check with the front desk before you assume your reservation with free breakfast is noted. All in all, not the best, but certainly not terrible. A solid price, but considering the streets of Paris are littered with boutique hotels, I think I would have rather spent a little more to be in a more central location with a slightly nicer standard of room for my boutique experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little gem”
Reviews.Author: ArJaminyfe
Reviews.Content: From 29 December 2007 until 1 January 2008 we stayed with our three teen-age daughters in this very homelike hotel. We got a very warm welcome by the receptionist and received the keys within 5 minutes. We were given room 52 and 53 on the fifth floor on the streetside. The no-smoking rooms were very recent completely renovated and very tasteful decorated, very clean, warm, comfortable and well equipted with flatscreen (the signal was not so good unfortunately), minibar, tea/coffeemaking facilities,airco, a safe working on your creditcard and a very well equipted and new bathroom. The breakfast is being served on the groundfloor in a little cosy room with 12 chairs. The atmosphere there is very relaxing and informal and the staff will do everything to satisfy you and to feel comfortable. There are several sorts of fresh! bread, croissants, muesli, cheese, ham, marmelade, Nutella, honey, juices, fresh fruit, eggs, milk, yoghurt and much more. We used breakfast every day and it was really lovely and for us very complete. The hotel is standing in a Residentiel (a lot of Ambassies), quiet and safe neighbourhood. There are 2 Metrostations and several Velib(bikes))-points nearby. The Eiffeltower and the Arc-de-Triomph are within walking-distance. There are indeed enough good restaurants in the neighbourhood. When you really want to sleep quiet and not be waked up at 7.00a.m. every morning by the garbagetruck ask for a room on the backside of the hotel. The airco was not working so we slept with open windows. So every sound was live. There is free internet access in the lobby which is very great. Our compliments to the always smiling staff. They were all just great, very helpful, friendly, nice, very good English speaking, and really interested in their guests. Isabelle is a very nice lady and she will do everything to make you feel at home. When you read it Isabelle: Thanks for everything (p.s. our daughters liked your clothes very much!). We highly recommend this cosy place and will certainly come back in future. It's a lovely place for a very reasonable price (certainly in a town like Paris) and the staff is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “In a really nice area”
Reviews.Author: YoungIrishman
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Paris on 2 previous occasions and were not impressed with the standard of hotel. In fact the first time we stayed there, we moved hotel after 15mins. We moved to the nice but completely overpriced Hotel Ambassador on Boulevard Haussmann. I cannot remember the name of the hotel we stayed in the second time that we were in Paris but the room was so small that we had trouble even walking around the bed. This time we used Trip Advisor to find a hotel. We came across Hotel Foch and liked the reviews. Some of the reviews mentioned Nelly and yes she is as good as they all say. She makes you feel so welcome. She wasn't there when we arrived on 23rd of December but the gentleman who greeted us was excellent. They have this lovely habit of coming out in front of the desk to talk to you when you walk in the door. We had our 11 month old son with us and Nelly just loved him. We were given the only room on the top (7th floor). The room was nice. It was very clean but looked a little shabby in places(e.g. worn carpet). The lift only went to the 6th floor so carrying baby and buggy up the 3 flights of stairs from there to get to our room was getting a bit tiresome after a few days. We brought our computer with us and really appreciated the free wifi access. We had a big deep bath and it was lovely to soak in after a long day of walking around Paris. It is a 10 min walk to the L'arc de triomph and 20mins to Eiffel Tour. The area around the hotel is very quiet and feels very safe to walk in. The hotel booked a restaurant for us to eat at on Christmas night and it was spectacular! In fact there were lots of restaurants nearby and almost all looked really good. We ate breakfast in the hotel one morning and while it was nice, we felt it was completely overpriced at 12euro per person. The other mornings we went to nearby cafes and ate plenty for a lot less money. When we go to Paris next time, we will stay here again. It's not perfect and at €160 per night for room only, it's not cheap. However having experienced other hotels in Paris, this one is as good as you'll get for the money!! To get a really nice hotel in the centre of Paris, one would have to pay far more. Again, nicer staff you will not find anywhere in France or beyond!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent, all the positive reveiws are true!”
Reviews.Author: bishop100
Reviews.Content: I'll be brief with the reveiw as so much has been written before about how good this hotel is. I booked this hotel 6 months in advance of staying here (in August) for our first leg of our honeymoon, and was told that there was only 2 rooms left(!!!), so to avoid disappointment at peak seasons do as I did book well in advance. I chose this hotel purely from the reviews here on Tripadvisor, and liked the fact that Nellie even put a response on here to an unhappy reveiw, this to me shows that this hotel prides itself in listening to its customers, and hopefully feeling proud of what's being said. We were on the top floor of the hotel in a deluxe room with a balcony from which we could see the top of The Eiffel Tower. Unfortunately the weather wasn't great for our three days there, as we would've taken up the opportunity to eat breakfast on the balcony. Nellie, if you are reading this thanks again for welcoming us to your hotel and we look forward to seeing you again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff.”
Reviews.Author: Sidney2007
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based on the rave reviews. Yes - It's a lovely hotel in a lovely neighborhood. The pros about this hotel: the staff is wonderful, the rooms are clean, and it offers good rates. The cons: location is fine if you don't mind walking a bit to the metro, sights, etc., also the rooms are a bit dated and could use remodeling & renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and great staff”
Reviews.Author: 2103grand
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. The staff are excellent and very helpful. They are all terrific hosts and make you feel like they really appreciate your business. Helped us decide which sights to see and recommended very good (and reasonably priced) restaurants. Gave us a complimentary upgrade to our room and are first class. Also had free internet access in the lobby. Our room was very well appointed. Beware that the bed was rock hard. About the only complaint I would have is that the proximity to the Metro stations seemed a bit farther than advertised on the web. But, that's a minor point. We never ate breakfast in the hotel. We found a local bakery for coffee and croissant a bit more economical.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: browngravy
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in Paris many times but this was the best hotel ever. Good location between Eiffel Tower and Arc de Triomphe, close to metro stations. Staff very friendly and helpful and rooms very reasonable. Free WiFi and no smoking rooms. Rooms not large but adequate. Will definitely come here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Super Helpful and Fiendly Foch”
Reviews.Author: Bovski
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked through the door, the staff at the hotel were superb. We were swiftly checked in, and bearing in mind we arrived at the hotel by 11am, the room was quickly sorted out for us, 15mins, and we came back down to go out exploring!! Before we did though, Nelly gave us an in depth brief about the transport system and the best ways to get about and how much things cost!! The map was free along with the advice and stood us in good stead for the 5 days we were there. On returning to our room, it was warm, comfortable and homely. The bathroom was clean with one hell of a power shower which was piping hot!! Our trip was made all the more enjoyable by the advice and recommendations given to us by Nelly and co. Local restaurants that we visited were great and not too expensive. And the evening meal cruise on the Bateaux Parisiens is a must!! We paid slightly more for the Select instead of the standard but I have to say that sitting anywhere would have been special enough. We did have a window seat towards the front of the boat that is the Premier area, but the food, entertainment and wine were all first class - simply pick your budget and you will have a fab time!! We did the usual tourist attractions, and were flabagasted by the queues for the Eiffel Tower during the day. We did however, return at 9pm that same night to find no queues so went straight up the lift to the top. Brilliant!!! Back to the hotel though! Nothing was too much trouble and we were always greeted with a smile and an inquiry as to where we were going, or where we had been, and given some beneficial advice which was extremely useful. If we had any complaints though, and I feel that word is too strong, I think feedback would be better, it would be that on a couple of occasions there was no where to sit at breakfast. Once again though, we would be reassured and not have to wait long for a table to be cleared and reset. Breakfasts were fantastic by the way!!! The final thing is that both of us came away with a couple of bites on arms and legs, which is strange as the hotel was really clean so c'est la vie!!! We really cannot fault the Residence Foch. The location is great, (25 min walk from the Eiffel Tower and 10 mins from the Arc de Triomphe!!) Loads of places to sit and eat/drink. Metro stations close by. We will definitely stay there again on our return to Paris. Last tip. "Paris Shuttles" taxi company were great. From the CDG Airport direct to the hotel door for 19 euros per person each way!! We booked them for our return trip to the airport and they arrived 10 mins early getting us to the airport in plenty of time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Rsvl
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel whenever we have the opportunity. This was our first trip to Paris. Each neighborhood, restaurant, flea market, bistro, shop and museum exceeded our every expectation. The people we met were warm, helpful and friendly. And, all of this can be said about Hotel Residence Foch. After an overnight flight from Denver, we arrived at the hotel early in the morning to find our room clean, ready and waiting. Nelly, Isabelle, John Lui and everyone at Hotel Foch treated us, not simply as visitors to their hotel, but rather as guests in their home. Located on the west side of Paris, near the Arc de Triomphe, and within walking distance to the Eiffel Tower, Hotel Residence Foch sets in a wonderful neighborhood and is close to each of the Paris Metro Lines. Every day was something new and exciting for us in Paris and, at the end of the evening, we could always look forward to returning to the warmth and comfort of Hotel Residence Foch.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Paris”
Reviews.Author: bear54
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my family of 5 at Residence Foch. Me my wife and 3 boys (6,8,11). We really enjoyed our stay,this hotel is in a great location next to neighborhood bistros, bakeries and grocery stores. It is not in a touristy area.But it is within walking distance to the Arc de Triomph, Bois Boulogne and the metro.The service at hotel was great especially Nellie and Jean Louis. There are some great restaurants on Pergoulese (which runs by hotel) We had a family room with 5 beds and we were very happy with it. We had enough space for all of us.They are kid friendly at the hotel. We definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nicey Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marcus2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family for four days. The hotel is located about a 10minutes stroll from the Porte Malliot metro station. The train trip (Airport CDG->Chatelet->Porte Malliot) takes about an hour and costs about 7eur. The hotel is quaint. The lift holds three and each floor has about three rooms. The breakfast room has about 5 close tables. The staff at reception are incredibly helpful and they will recommend some decent places to eat. I found one of the staff members overly fussy. He made breakfast uncomfortable and very rushed, when everyone else was relaxing. The rooms are paris size (small but alright). They have flatscreen tvs with BBC Prime (so no missing eastenders) and the bathrooms are modern enough with a decent spray on the shower.Aircon is cool, but a bit noisey (not overly) The hotel would be well suited for older couples. It is in a quiet area, but not too far from the main areas. I booked the hotel directly and it costs 150eur per room per night. B'fast was 12per person. It was limited. Bread, egg, yoghurt and fruit. In small supply. you can walk to the arch de triomphe in about 25minutes or you could fly there in the metro. Go here if your main consideration is noise at nightime, and polite reception staff. Its probably a good hotel, by paris standards (for the price). Beware, everything is even more expensive than you think. Thats saying something coming from someone from Dublin.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Residence Foch”
Reviews.Author: sophieSanJose
Reviews.Content: I was at the Hotel Residence Foch for my birthday and was lodged in a very pretty room. Nellie is the key to this hotel's success and popularity. She helps with everything, including recommending a brasserie for my birthday and surprising me with a complimentary dessert and glass of champagne for me and my friend at dinner. What a surprise that was! The next day though, I was sick and amazingly enough she arranged for a doctor to make a housecall to the hotel. He prescribed medication and I was up and about the next day. Having to spend an entire day in a hotel room in Paris wasn't what I had planned, but luckily the flat screen tv and comfortable bed made it easy. Thank you Nellie for making my birthday in Paris so special! Leslie

Reviews.Title: “A great Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneSaxophone
Reviews.Content: Two Australian couples had a great stay at Hotel Residence Foch a month ago. The location is great, quiet and safe, but close to many sights by walking or the nearby Metro. The friendliness and helpfullness of Nellie and her staff is quite unbelievable and they make staying in Paris so easy and comfortable. There are great retaurants and food shops nearby, and it a not - to- touristy neighbouhood. Highly recommended and we would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “A Taste of Paris”
Reviews.Author: SatisfiedTraveller46
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 (2 adults, 13 year old and 10 year old) spent 4 wonderful nights at Hotel Residence Foch.
