On arriving by train at a metro stop in close proximity to the hotel, we had no difficulties finding Hotel Residence Foch which is situated in a very quiet and safe neighbourhood within walking distance from the Arc de Triomphe and the Eiffel Tower. On the first night, Nellie spent time highlighting major sites to visit and helped us to prepare a comprehensive itinerary for the duration of our stay. Whilst I had spent time preparing an itinerary prior to leaving Australia, it was most helpful to have input from a resident. Nellie and her staff are friendly and very accommodating. I required a doctor on arrival and the reception staff promptly organised for the doctor to visit. Afterwards, we explored the area near the Hotel and also headed to the Eiffel Tower to view the lights on dusk - spectacular. Our spacious room was very suitable for our family. It consisted of two rooms partitioned by a heavy curtain with a very clean large bathroom. The decor was very tasteful. After busy days, visiting museums, riding on Hop On Hop Off buses and eating in exquisite French restaurants, it was wonderful to arrive back to Residence Foch to rest and be restored for the next day. We all enjoyed the breakfast buffet. We also purchased cold meats from the local butcher, French cheeses from the Deli and delectable treats from the pastry shop which we ate in the foyer of Residence Foch. The free internet was also great - my two children had the opportunity to communicate with their friends in Australia. Hotel Residence Foch is definately a safe and suitable place to stay with a family. Thank you, Nellie and the Team

Reviews.Title: “Charming, comfortable & good value”
Reviews.Author: Villiers34
Reviews.Content: Contrary to some other reviewers, my wife and I found this to be a charming little hotel, full of character, in an excellent location in a quiet back street close to the Metro, Arc de Triomphe and many good bars and restaurants. Nellie and her staff were extremely friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. The breakfasts were certainly to our liking, though may not suit the American taste. Our only reservation was that our room was small (but the bathroom large). If you are thinking of an extended stay, or have a lot of luggage, this may not be for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: imbota
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Residence Foch on a recent saturday night during a layover in Paris. Had a great experience! The hotel is in a very nice neighborhood near the Arc De Triomphe (10 min) and the Eiffel Tower (20 min). There's a train (metro) stop about 5 minutes away. The staff was very accomodating and friendly and gave us a good recommendation for dinner. Both front desk folks we dealt with went out of their way to make us feel welcome. The hotel is more quaint than fancy but was very clean and quiet. I would absolutely stay here again. For the price, I suspect this is one of the best values in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “We'd go back in a flash”
Reviews.Author: williams70
Reviews.Content: Travelling with another couple, my wife and I spent 5 wonderful days in Paris at the Hotel Residence Foch. We chose this hotel based on the great reviews on this site. The hotel is indeed in a great location quite close to two Metro stations. There are scores of great restaurants nearby, and if you are adventuresome, you can register and use Paris' nearly free bicycle rental system with a bike kiosk about two blocks away. The rooms and the breakfasts were great and the staff very helpful. They now have a laptop parked in the lobby that can be used to check e-mail and museum schedules, etc. If you are looking for a small hotel that reasonaly priced and well-located, this fits the bill. Next time we're in Paris, we'll be back there..

Reviews.Title: “Basic, Charming Hotel, Out of the Way Location”
Reviews.Author: SeventySix
Reviews.Content: A basic but almost charming hotel. Has plenty of character but the location and breakfast lets it down. This hotel is clealry aimed at North American visitors. The hotel is clean and well maintained but the decor is stereotypically chintzy and the style is dated. That said, it gives it character often lacking in chain hotels. The staff are friendly and eager to please when dealing with run of the mill queries but can be a little patronising and unwilling to help with more complicated requests. The location, whilst very quiet, is far from central. The nearest Metro station is a 20 minute walk and it's then a 15 minute ride to the centre of Paris. Whilst there's a restaurant next to the nearest Metro station, a dearth of any other decent bars, cafes or restaurants means not only do you have to travel some distance for the sights you must do the same for eats and drinks, too. (The hotel bar isn't inviting). We stayed in a superior room which was very comfortable and a good size with plenty of storage space. It was let down, however by the cramped layout of the ensuite bathroom. There was free wifi in the room (and thoughout the hotel). Breakfast was reasonable value (for Paris) at €12 each but the quality and variety was disappointing. There was a 'boil-your-own-egg' machine with no timer, the orange juice was from concentrate (not fresh) and the pastries were few in number, small and dry. Restaurant staff were very friendly, however. Leaving the hotel at 6:30 am on a Monday, the hotel were unwilling to serve us breakfast before we left, even in the room, which seemed to be a casualty of the place being a small, family run business. That said, the hotel was good value and the staff were more freindly and helpful than not. All in, if this hotel was more central, I would definitely stay here again. As it is, I think it's too far from the action for a repeat stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: Shrina
Reviews.Content: I was arriving from the Amsterdam leg of my trip and my good friend had reserved a room at the IBIS. Little did I know that I was in for a terrible shock... but this review is about Hotel Residence Foch. I went on tripadvisor, found this lovely hotel and booked online for 110 euros for 2 doubles a night (w/ air conditionning) on a last minute special on their website. What a find! Great little hotel, very clean, flatscreen TV, renovated bathrooms, nice windows, comfy beds and very friendly staff! The locations is awesome since you are near the subway, the Eiffel tower and you are in the 18th arronsidissement which is where you need to be , a walk away from many sites. The neighborhood is safe and pretty much upscale (embassies are next door). For this quality in Paris, it's a steal! I highly recommend. Of course, don't expect extreme luxury at this price, but it was absolutlely fabulous for this girl that likes to stay at " Leadings hotels of the world" when the office is paying! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with loads of Parisian character”
Reviews.Author: Earlybirds
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a week from 13th August. We had a very comfortable room at the front of the hotel on the first floor. The hotel is very welcoming and the service unobtrusive making it an ideal place to relax and see the sights of Paris. Residence Foch is convenient for the Air France airport shuttle to Charles de Gaulle and also for the RER and Metro. The 2 day hop on hop off green and yellow bus was well worth the money and helps you get your bearings in Paris. It stops at the Arc de Triomphe which is easy walking distance from the hotel. The Batobus was also fun for a day as you can also get on and off as well as seeing the sights from the river. We did use the Metro towards the end of our stay, but generally walked everywhere and recommend visitors take a good pair of walking shoes! We can thoroughly recommend this hotel which is spotless and well situated in a quiet area of the city. The staff are exceptionally helpful and cheerful which undoubtedly adds to its charm. We would love to return to Residence Foch and visit all the attractions we missed first time around.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: engelmarc
Reviews.Content: It started with a nice Welcome e-mail after we made our reservation. I should have responded by asking directions, since we walked from the Arch de Triumph instead of from Port de Meioux. Arrived at 9 but didn't expect room to be ready, so Nellie, the owner, had us leave our bags, freshen up, and suggested a lovely walk and cafe. Lovely 15 minute walk to Trocadero. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We found the location to be very convient although not in the center of things. We are not high maintainence and found the hotel delightful. We only had 2 days so a big Paris suggestion is to buy tickets to the Yellow bus tour. There are 4 routes and you can switch from one to the other. See [--] enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Well kept secret so shhh.....”
Reviews.Author: kresic
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful Hotel. The staff really makes your experience at this hotel more like a 5-star! The Hotel is situated in one of the best neightborhoods in Paris. My husband and I walked everywhere, took the metro and buses and we never felt creeped out coming back late at night. Our room had a great view of the neighborhood with its beautiful architecture, plants and flowers. Our Hotel room was always clean and nicely decorated in Parisen style, ask for the Blue room you wont be disappointed.....

Reviews.Title: “It's all true! Fantastico!”
Reviews.Author: RealityCheck310
Reviews.Content: This was one of the very best experiences we've had in a hotel (of any star rating) in ages. It truly is about the PEOPLE here. It's amazing what an impact the idea of good service can have on an estabishment and, by proxy, its guests. I'm not going to say that our room was palacial. If you're staying in your room for more than sleeping-- and other romantic endeavors ;) you're wasting your time in Paris. In fact, our room (#60) was right next to the adorable little elevator which operated constantly... but that is literally our ONLY critique. The rate for this lovely "home" in Paris was very reasonable and it's ideally located on a very quiet, safe street adjacent to the German embassy. NELLY is an amazing owner who always has time to help no matter how small or giant the request. To give you an example, they helped us get acclimated to the city, gave us routes and suggestions on par with any guide book and were always excited to hear about our adventures at the end of each day. They even took the time to book an additional room night for us in a nearby hotel with the very same rate when we decided to extend our stay. Nelly and her staff made us feel special and that's what everyone wants. In a world of impersonal "box" stores and internet anonimity, the Residence Foch is a refreshing and affordable escape.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, great experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: nadiasmyth
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Residence Foch in July as a surprise Birthday getaway and what can I say - we simply had great experience and fantastic memories. It has been 7 years since I last visited Paris and to tell you the truth I had very mixed feelings when my husband told me that he had organized a week-end in Paris for my Birthday, I thought that I would much prefer a trip to Barcelona, but how wrong was I. We flew from Shannon to Paris with Ryanair and what was suppose to be 1h30min flight became 1h10min thanks to great flying conditions. From Beauvais airport there is a bus to Port Maillot and from there it is a very short walk to the Hotel. From the minute you step out from the bus and take first breath of Paris air you know that you are somewhere different and magical :)Although it was nearly 11pm by the time we made it to the hotel we were greated by a very nice receptionist, check in was very fast and smooth. We were given our key and shown to the elevator as our room was on the 4th floor. Hotel itself is very small, with narrow staircase and tiny elevator, but myself and 6'3 husband and suitcase didn't have any problem to fit in:) As my husband told me that he got exellent price from hotel's web site I didn't expect much from it, but I was wrong again:)Yes, room is on the small side but it has everything you need and bathroom is quiet big. In the room there are huge windows so you can open them in the morning and smell fresh bread and croissants:), there is flat screen TV, air conditioner and ironing board and what I liked the most - room has Paris character, you know straight away that this room could be only in Paris and nowhere else in the world. In the morning we had breakfast in the dinning room downstairs, it is continental but we definitely didn't leave the room hungry:) What I liked the most about this hotel - it's location, it is close enough to all tourist sites, only 2 min walk to the Arc de Triomphe, but far enough to be able to blend in with locals and it is located in a very quiet district as well. Also there are alot of great restaurants near by, the best we tried was a sea food restaurant (sorry can't remember the name) at the end of rue de Malakoff, 2 min walk from hotel towards Port Maillot with a great price of €37 for 5 course set menu (including oysters and foie-gras!!!) Staying in this hotel gave us such a great energy every morning and high spirit to go out and enjoy every minute of our trip and coming back in the evening felt like coming home:) It's been nearly 3 weeks since we came back but myself and my husband still raving about it and I am sure all our friends are tired to listen about it :) and we plan to come back in a very near future. When visiting Paris again we will only stay in this hotel, unless we won a lotto and could afford to stay in George V, I would love to try it out:) My only advise to anyone visiting Paris - take it easy, start your exploring of the city by just sitting outside one of numerous cafes with a cup of coffee or a beer, breathing Paris air and absorbing this fantastic atmosphere around you, watching people passing by and loving every minute that you spend in this fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DublinDotty
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Residence Foch for valentines day in Feb 07 - location was perfect, staff were great. Room was very small but was perfect for us, it had all we needed including a minibar and a very nice bathroom. We stayed for three nights in total, it may be a bit small for people on a longer stay (1 week). As mentioned in other reviews, it have a more of a B&B feel than a hotel feel so if you are looking for somewhere more like a hotel then I would look elsewhere. Would definetely recommend Residence Foch, the area was perfect, literally max ten mins walk from the Arc de Troimph, lovely safe area.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful experience!”
Reviews.Author: dianmarie514
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Residence Foch during our trip to Paris in March of 2007. Everything about the hotel was to our liking. The room for 2 -- comfortable and quiet; the staff -- extremely friendly and helpful; the location -- a safe neighborhood, close to the Metro. At first I thought the breakfast was a bit pricy but soon changed my mind after we ate breakfast elsewhere one morning. The food at the Residence Foch was plentiful and good -- it kept us going for several hours each day. We booked a private van to and from the airport and that helped ease the anxiety of getting to the hotel and back to the airport in a city unfamiliar to us. I would stay here again and recommend this hotel to others who are looking for a reasonably priced, quiet, safe and friendly environment in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Top marks!”
Reviews.Author: LanceScotland
Reviews.Content: This was booked by my now Fiance as a surprise and he used trip advisor. We were really pleased with the hotel. Staff were super helpful and friendly and always took time for a chat. The room was lovely and had a little balcony where we could stand out and see the Eiffel Tower. Breakfast was great and it was all just laid back. Note: rooms and lifts to floors in hotels in Paris are compact - that's the way of life there!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Little Miss Bossy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had never been to Paris. We couldn't have found a better hotel. All staff were very friendly and helpful. Because of the reviews on Trip Advisor i had a good idea of what to expect and wasn't disappointed. We were on the 6th floor and our room was very comfortable with a lovely small balcony. The shower room was compact but more importantly it had a lovely strong shower not one of those horrible ones that just dribble out.. We enjoyed the breakfast which set us up for the day. Paris was beautiful nad Residence Foch was the perfect base for sightseeing and eating out. Thank You everyone, who wrote such good reviews, we were certainly not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely.”
Reviews.Author: VDonahoe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this lovely neighborhood hotel for 5 nights. We loved it. Everyone there was so helpful and friendly. Nellie was wonderful. You felt like a guest in her home. Her staff gave us great suggestions for where to eat...my favorite meal in Paris was at Bistro Saint Ferdinand just down the street. Go there! We really loved the location of the hotel; in a quiet neighborhood, but so close to the Arc de Triomphe and Tour Eiffel and easy access to the Metro. If I had any complaint, it would be that our room...71...didn't have a stand up shower, just a tub with a hand held shower head. That being said, I wouldn't hesitate to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Residence Foch: Great staff, great stay”
Reviews.Author: teezee
Reviews.Content: Hotel Residence Foch: Paris made simple thanks to the kind and helpful staff at this charming small hotel. Many thanks to the tripadvisor travelers who recommended this hotel and who were spot on with their compliments. We asked the staff to make restaurant reservations for us by email before we arrived and they performed beautifully, emailiing us confirmation of our request and confirming again when we arrived. No question was too silly and no entry or exit passed without an interested and pleasant greeting. Rooms are small but well-appointed (this is Paris, rooms are always small!!) and location is fine with the exception that you have to walk a bit to the great streets filled with great people watching cafes and there is nothing right around the corner, so to speak. The advantage of this is that you are in a quiet block, walking distance to two metros, and not far from other pleasant attractions. Good breakfast too!

Reviews.Title: “Like home away from home”
Reviews.Author: LDVOLVO
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Foch for 8 nights in May and had a most pleasing wonderful stay . Nelly and Isabelle were attentive and accomodating . We stayed in a family room which was spacious , clean, nicely decorated and comfortable. We always felt that we needed anything , it would be no problem , and this is a great feeling to have when you are in another country and language can be an issue. Close by is everything ( Shopi , Restaurants , Park , Metro , RER , Cafe , Money Exchange , Champs Elysees ) and the area is very nice and safe .Breakfast is nice , especially because if you feel like it it can be delivered up to your room . This is an intimate hotel , warm like a home .

Reviews.Title: “More than you could ask for”
Reviews.Author: Cluggee
Reviews.Content: For our honeymoon, we decided on Paris and Tuscany. For our hotel in Paris, we went through about 250 reviews on this website and decided for the value, location and based on past reviews, the Residence Foch was our best bet. We were not disappointed. We walked from the bus stop to the hotel in a few minutes and were immediately impressed. The front desk staff greeted us in English (does it show?) and while we tried our best to stumble along in French, we were soon both flitting back and forth in two languages. We had a terrific room and the washroom was the biggest we'd seen in Europe! The breakfast alone is worth the price of admission. It rained the first day of our journey, so we took the opportunity to battle jet lag. One of the nicest sleeps I've had. Loved the lift. It fit me and my outsized suitcase. Loved the bar. They make a mean martini if you ask them. Loved the location. You can walk to the Eiffel tower, Arc de Triomphe and the Bois de Boulogne. As has been said many times on this forum, the staff are what makes this a special little hotel. They are wonderfully helpful and can recommend the finest restaurants and the best way to see the city. They also arranged a great trip to Versailles and Giverny that was outstanding. We booked through Otel.com, as we always do, and got a far better rate than any of the other websites or my travel agent could give me.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: HolsRust
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel on 26th May with our 7 year old to find that Expedia had messed up the reservation and had booked a room for two instead of three. The hotel bailed us out of a potentially difficult situation and we had a fantastic stay despite the abnormally bad weather. The breakfast is very good, the area is safe, there are convenient restaurants/Bistros of various types and prices, the metro and RER trains are close (you can get from either airport with a couple of changes, and travel easily to any of the bustling areas of paris if you wish). What really makes this hotel stand out though is the owner Nelly, and her staff. She/they promote both the hotel and paris, and whilst I find staff in small French hotels generally very friendly, I can say that here they are the most helpful and friendly we have come across in many trips to France and will add value to your stay. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel (except on the week when I want to go there next). Finally, thanks to the others who left reviews and helped me choose this hotel. PS. for those who don't speak French, they speak very good English

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RaffYork
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Residence FOCH for a week in May for my Partner's 40th birthday. Booked on-line which was very straight forward, although we did have alittle trouble finding the Hotel when we first arrived (my fault for not printing out the little map - just get off at the exit for Avenue de Malokoff) and it's a 2 minute walk. Our room (50) was fine not enormous but quite sufficient space for us plus it had the added bonus of it's own terrace, through the bathroom. (I had picked this up from Trip Advisor -my partner thought it was a cupboard so got a pleasant surprise). We visited the Musee De L'Orangerie to see Monet's Waterlily paintings (just off the Place de la Concorde) and they were stunning and I would highly recommend a visit. RER service to Versailles from Porte Maillot station, very easy just change trains at Champ Des Mars - Tour Eiffel and catch any train with a name beginning with V. Versailles Palace very beautiful, we did a costly but excellent guided tour, very knowledgable French lady, learnt alot. Staff at this hotel are all brilliant and were always pleasant at all times, they were very helpful. Nelly recommended a fabulous restaurant (Le Petit Bisto - I think). Special Birthday meal and well worth the money with the very special touch of a glass of champagne from the hotel. Our meal cost about £100 but was one of the nicest steaks I've ever tasted. We will certainly return to this hotel but will perhaps try to get a superior room next time (not because the other rooms are not good but just for the extra space and perhaps a front facing balcony. One last thing, do climb the Arc De Triomphe at night (284 steps) it's well worth it for the view....oh yes if you visit the Pantheon there is a little bistro just down the road (1st one you come to) that did a fantastic Ceasar salad for 8 euros each. Thanks again to Nelly and staff, we had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a great experience”
Reviews.Author: paul2hoots
Reviews.Content: I booked twelve rooms at this hotel for some 23 Rotarians to celebrate a couple of 60th birthdays in May. Booking directly was very simple - Isobelle will usually deal with this. She and the other staff could not have been more welcoming or hospitable. In the end we had to give up one of the rooms as two could not travel, but again cancellation was easy. The superior rooms were very spacious, but perhaps the ordinary rooms were by comparison rather small. That did not detract from the hotel in any way. It was convenient to the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees. The Metro was a two minute walk and the area was quiet and relaxed - just like the hotel. First class boutique hotel, with first class no fuss staff. We'll definitely go there again when next in Paris. Thanks Isobelle!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding small hotel”
Reviews.Author: ejonone
Reviews.Content: Nelly Rolland runs a wonderful small hotel that is perfect for couples and single travelers. Our stay from May 5-12 was absolutely delightful and mirrors so many of the other reviews. Nelly, Isabelle and the rest of the staff are gracious and helpful. Our room (41) faced the courtyard and was adequate in size with a nice bathroom. Closet space is limited, but we don't pack huge amounts so it wasn't an issue. A few notes on the area. There is a small market called Shopi just a short distance away near the corner of Rue Pergolese and Avenue de Malakoff good for a bottle of water or wine and some snacks. A larger (very upscale) market can be found in the lower level of the Galerie Commerciale L'Atrium du Palais des Congres (just across from the Le Meridien hotel where the Air France bus stops). Very nice takeaway food. Even better is the market across from Bon Marche at the Sevres metro stop. We had dinner out at Le Petit Retro, a bistro recommended by Nelly, just off Place Victor Hugo; also at La Villa Corse, a Corsican restaurant on Avenue Malakoff (across from the Shopi market). We found both to be excellent; Villa Corse ended up being around 270 Euro for two, Le Petit Retro was half that. Porte Maillot metro station is large but less crowded than many and is also an RER stop. We found it easier to purchase our carnets (10 tickets for the metro) in the afternoon. The ticket windows were more crowded in the morning. For the Louvre, exit at the Palais Royal Musee du Louvre and follow the signs to the museum. You can connect directly to the lower level of the museum where the ticket kiosks are and avoid the lines outside (we bought our tickets in advance via the web and avoided the ticket queue as well).

Reviews.Title: “Superb Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Martinojct
Reviews.Content: Hotel Residence Foch is the best 3 star hotel we have ever stayed at. We travelled with our friends and found the hotel such a great place to re-group after a long day of siteseeing. Nelly and her staff work so incredibly hard to make your stay an enjoyable one from the cleanliness of the rooms to assistance in finding the best sites and restuarants in Paris. The hotel is located in a very safe and upscale part of Paris with an easy 10 minute walk to the Metro. We can not wait to return to Hotel Residence Foch!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: EmmaAndDayton
Reviews.Content: Residence Foch is in a perfect part of Paris. Its safe, close to the Metro and surrounded by traditional bakeries and patisseries. The staff are what makes this place so great though. The moment we stepped in they were directing us to the sights and hidden secrets around Paris. Thanks so much for making us feel at home in your hotel. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Well, it says 3 star, and it is 3 star, but the staff do make a difference !”
Reviews.Author: linlithgow
Reviews.Content: Well, it describes itself as a 3 star hotel, and I for one wouldn't argue with that ! Certainly it is convenient for flights into, and out of, Beauvois airport, the airport bus transfer (13 euro single)making a one stop trip to Port Maillot which is about a 15 to 20 minute stroll to, or from, the hotel. The staff, Nellie et al, are all very welcoming and helpful to a fault. The hotel itself is located in a nice quiet residential street with a few embassies nearby and it's about a 15 minute stroll to Argentine metro which connects with just about anywhere you want to go. We arrived early so the room was not yet available and it was suggested we leave our baggage in the little reception area while we sauntered off for a while. This was also the case when we checked out at 12 noon with a whole day to kill before our flight home. While nothing happened to our baggage in the interim, I was, to say the least, most uncomfortable at having to leave it in such an exposed position where, frankly, just about anybody could have come in and wheeched it away. Something I had sussed from between the lines on Tripadvisor reviews was that the breakfast was not of particularily good value. I was spot on in this respect as at 12 euro per person (£17 or $34 for two persons) it was the absolutely worst value I've ever seen in any European hotel (Riga to Rome via lots of places) for such a meagre offering. Nellie, despite what others may have said on this site, you are definitely not giving value for money as far as breakfast is concerned. We were fortunate in being allocated room 50 which had a small terrace attached so we we bought in all our breakfast provisions from local stores and boulangeries for a fraction of what we otherwise could have paid. Apart from that it was also more pleasant doing it al fresco than breakfasting downstairs in a small area off reception which had no ambience whatsoever. Regards the bedroom, yes it was small, so small that there was no designated area for luggage, only a small single wardrobe for hanging clothes, the hangers were of a design that immediately collapsed when you hung anything on them. Yes, Nellie was informed and produced some traditional style hangers but I doubt we were the first to experience this. The only other storage was two very shallow drawers in a small table supporting the TV suitable only for stashing knickers (either gender) and socks. I've given what I believe to be an honest review and if I was ever to return to Paris, which I won't, overrated and poor value, then I would certainly give this hotel consideration amongst many others. Incidentally, if you want to experience how vile food can be, yes in Paris, go to "au sergent recruteur, rue st louis, i'lle st louis" I can honestly say it was complete merde to give it the full local venacular. Or in Eurovision terms "null point". One last note of caution. I booked this hotel via Expedia falsely confident in the knowledge that, like every booking I'd previously made with Expedia, the cost was deducted from my credit card there and then. Not so ! On this occasion it transpired that my credit card was only being used to guarantee my arrival ! I was presented with the entire bill on my check-out. Not the fault of the hotel but it has put a fair dent in my faith re Expedia. If I hadn't a credit card with me I was in shtuck ! The MacLeods of MacLeods of Harris, Lewis, Raasay, Skye and everywhere in between. Viva Alex Salmond, the SNP and the future Scottish Republic !

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Residence Foch”
Reviews.Author: Ritter-Writer
Reviews.Content: It takes a lot to impress this middle aged English couple who now live in Spain! The Hotel Residence Foch has managed to do just that. I won't repeat what so many have said. But in brief, the quality of the rooms, genuine friendliness of the staff and quiet location in a smart area more than make up for any shortcomings this hotel has because of its small size. If you go to Paris and appreciate quality, service and an unusual degree of tranquility for this city, I suggest you stay at this charming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: rollingstone50
Reviews.Content: Well , after many years of travelling to the Uk and Europe on business I finally convinced my wife to take a holiday in Europe in conjunction with her 40th birthday. Paris first stop. A genuinely Parisian Hotel. 3 star rating but 5 star service. The room was ffine ...number 61 and the welcome super. Nelly and her troops make it feel like home. Their assistance to ALL their guests is amazing. So well informed and so keen to share their knowledge. Folks we LOVED the place AND WILL RETURN AT SOME TIME IN THE FUTURE..... April 23 to April 27 2007. Thanks Nelly!!! Ron and Sharon Livingston

Reviews.Title: “A jewel of a hotel in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: Travellhopper
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights on 24th April and the hotel was as good as the weather. From the warm welcome you get as you come through the door to the advice on departure the staff could not do enough for you. The room was small (but hey your out seeing the sights all day) but was spotliness clean. Air conditioning was good due to the heat and towels changed every day. Just off the underground at Porte Mallot the directions given on the website were easily followed and took the worry about finding the place away. Breakfast is 11 euros but worth it when you consider the prices for coffee,danishes etc in some local bars. We would definetly recommend this hotel to any visitors to Paris and if we are back then we will be staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and cosy hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheGupsters
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2007 and despite the weather being either very cold or absolutely tipping it down with rain the warmth and friendliness of the hotel seemed to lift our sprits. Nellie and her staff were so helpful in recommending restaurants for us to eat at, especially as when we arrived on Sunday there were not many places nearby that were open. Myself and my partner are fussy eaters as well, so this eliminated us being disappointed if we had had a look for places to eat ourselves. This way we had a fantastic and reasonably priced meal each evening. Our only complaint would be the size of our room. We stayed in room 52 on the fifth floor and while we did hear some of the other guests next door and opposite and in their bathrooms it wasn't too intrusive. The room overlooked the street so we would hear the rubbish being collected in the morning, other than that the traffic noise was minimal. We did struggle to fit our suitcase somewhere in the room and there wasn't much space to hang our clothes. However, the room was clean and the bed was comfy which is practically unheard of in some hotels! The other minor complaint was that the curtains didn;t meet in the middle, which we should have really mentioned ,but as everyone was so nice we didn't want to be the fussy english people that moaned! It never once spoilt our enjoyment. We would definitely recommend this hotel and stay here again. Breakfast ok, it was included in the cost of our room otherwise we may have chosen to have had something hot, rather than continental. Great location, great staff and great atmosphere - worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Super little hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaulnDeb
Reviews.Content: There are lots of comments about this hotel on Tripadvisor & if like me you use these comments to book your hotels you take the majority view. This hotel gets into the top 10 in Paris because of the staff, location & just general good feeling it leaves you with. The hotel is small, I counted 25 rooms on 6 floors. We had a small room but the fact it had a wonderful terrace (rm 50) easily compensated for this - Ok the weather was hot - great for breakfast in the morning or a glass of wine at night - might not have been so good if raining. Location is great. 10 mins walk to Arc De T & 20 mins walk max to Effiel Tower - best way to view it. Sorry but if you can't find the Metro from the hotel stay at home! It is v easy & v convenient for Louve etc on Yellow line & Sacre C on bue line. The area is clean & you feel safe. Some nice restaurants & bars in the area plus a nice deli & supermarket around the corner for cheap pastries & wine. A great little find this - fully justifies top 10 - Nellie & her staff only too pleased to help. Will definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - Charming Staff”
Reviews.Author: txroberts4
Reviews.Content: My family (husband, daughter and I) stayed at Hotel Foch during the first week of April for two nights. We had come over from London on the Eurostar. We only had a limited time in Paris so we are so pleased that it was such a wonderful time. Our room was clean and very comfortable. It was not huge, but this is Paris, not the US. The beds were comfortable, clean and warm. I am not sure what some other posters are complaining about. The hotel is so charming and spotless. The staff is incredibly nice and they really went out of their way to make us feel welcome. They gave us suggestions on things to do and tips on making our stay easier. We travel a lot all over the world and we all agree that Hotel Foch is now one of our favorite hotels! I will never forget our trip to Paris, nor our stay at Hotel Foch! We are already planning our next trip....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: PeepsPiper
Reviews.Content: This is such a cozy and friendly hotel in a great location. Extremely welcoming, obliging and helpful staff/owner, great size room with all the trimmings etc. Would thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “By far the best hotel in Paris!!!”
Reviews.Author: cpanyc
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a week at the Hotel Residence Foch. I must say this is by far the best hotel I have stayed at in Paris. ( I have been to Paris 4 times). We stayed in the family room and were completely pleased. The breakfast was good and most of all the hotel staff were extremely friendly and kind. The room and the hotel itself was clean. They made my 6yr old child feel welcomed and comfortable. On our last day there she threw her arms around the one of the front desk employees and told him she would miss them all very much. The hotel is close to the #1 and #2 Metro lines, the RER train and the Air France bus to the airport. It is very easy to get around from there. We will definately stay here again and recommend it to anyone who needs a hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “completely over-rated”
Reviews.Author: digbyLondon
Reviews.Content: I really don;t know what all the fuss is all about and can only assume the manager has lots of friends who keep topping up the ratings. OK the staff were friendly and that is fairly rare in Paris, but our "family room" was long and narrow, the bathroom was basic, and the radiators were turned off. The hotels does not look as if it has had any more attention than a coat of paint in the last twenty years. The location is OK but not great. For a hotel which is in the Top 10, I would expect much better.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Pierre and Nicole
Reviews.Content: This hotel gave us a friendly welcome and were always on hand to answer any questions, even when we attempted them in French. Everything was of good but not excessive quality and bathroom and room were very clean. The owners obviously choose their staff carefully because everyone from breakfast to night porter were great. We had a room by the lift and were concerned about noise but there was none. Our room was neither too small or too spaced out and had a surprise balcony through the bathroom (Rm 50). So we enjoyed a cosy three night stay in a well to do location in Paris, with breakfast on the balcony and dinner in some superb local restaurants. From the Residence Foch you can walk to the Arc D'Triomphe, the Eiffel Tower and the local Metro took us to the centre and to Versailles (via RER) no problems. Would recommend & would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Take me back to Paris”
Reviews.Author: MarkofDallas
Reviews.Content: And when I return it will be to the Hotel Residence Foch! Although this is a small hotel, it is very clean with very nice ammenities. We espcially enjoyed the 5 STAR hospitality and friendliness of Isabelle and her staff. Thank you for making our short stay in Paris memorable. Susan, Mark, Sam & Sarah

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Rave”
Reviews.Author: LAinNY
Reviews.Content: After studying Trip Advisor in depth, my wife and I chose Hotel Residence Foch for our stay in Paris March 14-19. I cannot over-emphasize how pleased we were with the hotel (and with Trip Advisor for cluing us to it). We travel extensively and I can honestly say that we have never met a friendlier or more helpful staff than the one Nelly has assembled. From the moment Isobel welcomed us to the hotel to the moment Bao waved goodbye to our taxi from the sidewalk, the experience was a real joy. Everything is as advertised and as others have described -- a great bargain, a lovely little breakfast arrangement, quiet location in a residential neighborhood. This last may seem a negative to some -- but get a Metro pass (the hotel's a five minute walk from both Metro and RER) and take the #1 train to the heart of Paris, minutes away. We thought staying in the 16th had its own pleasures anyway, and the hotel staff will direct you to local restaurants if you want to stay in the area for dinner. Our room (#14) was small but immaculate, and perfectly quiet except for some brief vendor noise (the linen delivery truck) one night. We will think of this small hotel as our home-away-from-home in Paris from now on -- such was the degree to which we were made to feel welcome and at ease, setting the stage for a delightful stay overall. Congrats to Nelly and company, and thanks again to Trip Advisor and previous reviewers.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Friendly Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: UKRobSurrey
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 rooms via this hotels own website for a long weekend break, I had been to Paris twice before and had not been very pleased with the Hotels chosen, so this time I read a lot of reviews on Trip Advisor and selected Hotel Residence Foch because of its high rating. We were not dissapointed, in fact we were delighted with the very cheerfull and helpfull staff who made our stay a most enjoyable one. The facilities are great and the rooms although quite small are very well furnished with very good quality linen, ironing board and iron, hairdryer, lcd tv, mini bar, room safe and tea/coffee making facilities. The Bathroom was large and bright well supplied with shampoo, soap etc and also lovely towels. Next time we will book the larger rooms which cost about an extra 20euros per night but after seeing them it would be well worth it. ( Room numbers ending in 20 are the larger ones). It is in a good location for the metro and also in a very quite district, so if you want a good nights sleep this would be a great choice. Thank you Trip Advisor and Hotel Residence Foch

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: nickiy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residence Foch on March 15th 2007 for three nights. The Foch is very close to the Arc De Triomphe and Porte Maillot. It's not in the centre of town but being on the Metro yellow route was great for visiting all the places of interest. I wouldn't take a car there. Watching people try to park was a very interesting experience. The Foch is a lovely old hotel and the service is excellent. We had a family room which was great, even for two tall teenage boys. I would say the accommodation is right at three stars but the service is far superior. Breakfast was lovely- especially the chocolate bits. It didn't feel like a hotel- much more homely and warm. Also good restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and would recommend, but I would not rate in the Top 10”
Reviews.Author: rbmb
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel. I am surprised that it is consisently rated in the Top 5, as much about the hotel was good but I wouldn't say it was spectacular. Plus Very friendly and helpful staff Good value Quiet, residential area (couple of embassies nearby) "Convenient" location (see below) Comfortable Quaint Con Uninspiring lobby Small room (considering upgraded to a better room) Basic rooms Location: the hotel is in the 16th and., which is not really near any of the sights (though we could see the Eiffel Tower from our balcony!). However, it is about a 10 minute walk to the metro (Porte Maillot) which is on a key metro line; also, given how good the Paris metro is, it is easy to get just about anywhere. Restaurant: Strongly recommend La Petit Pergolese (no. 38 rue Pergolese....don't confuse with Pergolese which is right next door....this one is good and has a Michelin star, but quite expensive); excellent food, atmosphere and good value. Breakfast: rather than the breakfast, we went around the corner to a nice Boulangiere and had coffee and croissants.....8 euros for two vs. 30 at the hotel. Airport Transportation: The best way to get from CdG airport is via the Air France bus (20 euros roundtrip); it drops you off at Porte Maillot and it is an easy walk to the hotel (if you don't have much luggage.....but if you do, walk across the street to the Meridian hotel and get a taxi to the hotel)

Reviews.Title: “Solid stay at a great price”
Reviews.Author: biztrav123
Reviews.Content: Just want to reinforce the good press in these reviews. Stayed there in June 2005. Early check in was a bit of a problem (got there about 10:30am) for me and for some other guests, but the receptionist invited us to leave our things under his care in the lobby. Rooms were ready in under an hour. Chose a standard room if I remember correctly, tight but clean and comfortable. Good a/c. Bathroom was spotless. Very friendly staff and the older gent who does reception in the morning on the weekends is a character. Wireless internet worked well in the lobby, don't remember any issues in the room. Location is ok, its a quiet area and there are a number of decent restaurants in the immediate area. Little bit of a hike (10 min or so) from the nearest metro station at Porte Maillot ('specially when lugging luggage). There are no escalators to the metro exit if you take the most direct route out, but if you are willing to add some time, there are some escalators up into the nearby mall/convention center. Yes, you can get to the Champs Elysee quickly, but it is a long walk to the "real" section of the Champs Elysee from the Arc de Triomphe down to the river. Take the metro and get off at Etoille Charles de Gualle.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: stedepi
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, friendly staff, nice location, good value.

Reviews.Title: “Deserve all the praise they get!”
Reviews.Author: Katie005
Reviews.Content: We have suffered surly service, poor plumbing and some awful hotels in Paris over the years. These guys have really got it right. The reception staff are charming, the rooms outstanding for the price and the hotel is also in a great position. There are lots of small touches which made this such a positive experience. We will certainly return!

Reviews.Title: “Below expectations”
Reviews.Author: Skiers12
Reviews.Content: Having seen the very good reviews on Tripadvisor and having experienced a really terrible Hotel in Paris 3 years ago we decided Residence Foch was the answer to our prayers. Problem was that our expectations were probably too high. Hotel very nice, staff very friendly, breakfast also very good. The downside was that our room, room 12, was very small. Could only walk around the bed (twin beds immediately alongside one another looking like a large double). Certainly could not pass one another in the room had to wait for one another. Although ceiling is high the room felt claustrophobic. Could see from the plan of the other floors that on each floor there was a similar small room. The other rooms on each floor appeared, from the plans, to be much larger. However our beds were comfotable, the decor nice and the bathroom good with shower over a small bath, toilet, bidet and basin. The hotel was, by Paris standards, very nice and good value since we had 3 nights for the price of 2. It was a little disappointing that this related to accomodation only and breakfast on the 3rd day would cost 11euros each. However we took the opportunity to have breakfast in a nice cafe nearby. The area is very nice, walking distance of the Arc de Triomphe and at the end of the Metro line so good for getting around Paris. There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance to avoid a metro journey late at night. We must have seen 30 - 40 restaurants in the nearby area. Top tip is go to the top of the Arc de Triomphe at night - wonderful views and there is a lift if you can't face the 200 plus steps. Certainly would return to the hotel but would ask not to have room 12 or a similar sized room.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have stayed anywhere better!”
Reviews.Author: Taleke
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a 2 night stay at the Hotel Residence Foch. I picked the hotel based on the reviews from other guests and I am so glad I did! This hotel absolutely deserves the raves it gets. My boyfriend and I were on a short trip to Paris and staying in the Foch was the icing on the cake. The staff is wonderful...WONDERFUL...and the hotel is quaint and excellently located. It is on a quiet residential street but we were only about 200 meters from 2 Metro lines and within walking distance to the Arc de Triomphe. When we arrived we were greeted almost like family! We were quickly checked in and when we came back downstairs we were given a map of the area and metro lines and given suggestions about where to go...when certain places were open...the location of a flea market...so much useful information given by the amazing reception personnel. Breakfast was standard European (which I love)...croissants, cheese, ham, coffee, tea, eggs, fruit, etc. All very good. I will be visiting Paris again soon and I will absolutely stay at Hotel Residence Foch. I wouldn't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Our Best Stay Yet in Paris”
Reviews.Author: FreqFRATrav
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a five-night stay and had a wonderful time. It’s hard to believe the writer of “Reality Check” stayed at the Hotel Residence Foch during the same time period; we had a completely different experience. The room was very quiet, owing to its location in a very nice residential section of Paris and to the lack of traffic on rue Garbeau. On the nights we stayed out late, we easily slept as long as we wanted (sometimes until noon). Our water temperature was always consistent, and we heard no more than muted conversations from guests or staff (perhaps) in the hallway. We skipped the hotel breakfasts, drank the free coffee in the room and simply bought Pain au chocolat at the Pastry Shop a couple of blocks away. If you want to stay at a boutique hotel where you experience true hospitality in a unique residential setting, then this is the place to stay. However, if you desire a hotel with a closer proximity to the action of Paris, this may not be for you. Our experiences with Nelly and Isabelle at the front desk were always friendly and helpful. They would ask if everything was okay and if there was anything they could do for us. The night of our anniversary we wanted to eat at a memorable restaurant, and at their suggestion we ate at Le Pergolese around the corner from the hotel. It was truly an amazing experience, but do be prepared to pay extra if you go. (During our dessert the waiter brought us two glasses of champagne, compliments of Isabelle from the hotel.) We will certainly stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Reality check !”
Reviews.Author: NMLondon
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 nights at the Foch. Booked it based on the glowing reviews here - taking my girlfriend for her birthday (and to propose). On a positive note, it's true the staff are very friendly and helpful, and the general ambience and location of the hotel are good. The breakfast was okay, but you do pay (12eur p.p.) extra for it. On the downside, the hotel was really noisy internally. One could hear everything in the room from other guests conversations, to the staff going about their work to, most worryingly, bathroom 'activity' in the adjoining rooms. Really wouldn't recommend it if you plan on sleeping much / beyond 7am (that's 6am UK time) in the morning. The room itself was okay but quite small. There was a serious lack of hot water for showers and in our room the shower head was propelled out of it's holder when the water was turned off - a major and painful shock on day 1. All in all, I've stayed in worse but given the price this was a disappointment and I wish I'd booked somewhere else for this special occasion (though luckily she said "yes" despite the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug49
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserves it's #1 rating. It lives up to all its great reviews - charming, elegenat, well located, wonderful, friendly and informative staff. We stayed in a family room and were amazed by its spaciousness and the bathrooms and its lovely decor. The breakfast was also fantastic. Highly recommend staying at this hotel - and have already passed the details on to other Australians travelling to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: hepburn52
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for your money. Great Location, just 10 mins. walk away from the Champs Elysees. Staff are incredible and it was truly a pleasure to stay there. Rooms very nice, breakfast good. All in all a little gem!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable!”
Reviews.Author: TXPlaneJane
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay in Paris on business and the first stay at this hotel. I've definitely found a "keeper"! The rooms are wonderfully comfortable, the amenities are great for a hotel of this size/rating, and the staff is incredibly helpful and friendly. After a stressful day of business meetings, it's so nice to walk into the lobby and be greeted by name!

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay, but....”
Reviews.Author: frequentravel
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 night stay that I booked after reading all of the reviews here. First things first- the staff is great. They are extremely cheerful (but not overly...), helpful, and well informed regarding the City of Paris and the surrounding neighborhood. The breakfast is very good- the egg boiler is a nice touch, and someone is always available to refill your coffee cup when needed. However, I am unable to rate this hotel higher than average because when I booked this hotel, I booked a double room- even confirmed that by email a few weeks before arriving. When I was shown to my room, I was surprised to not only see an extremely small (even more so than typical Paris standard) room, but also two twin beds pushed together. Now this may be a pet peeve of mine, but two twins pushed together is not a double, no matter how hard the staff tried to reason. When I asked if I could be moved to the double room I had booked and confirmed, I was told the hotel was full, and not offered any compensation to help soothe the oversight. Although I would not stay here again, some may like it, but the room snafu left me with a bit sour taste. Also- beware not to accept one of the rooms ending in #2 (12, 22, 32, etc...), they are the smallest rooms in the hotel, and are very uncomfortable...

Reviews.Title: “Best Place in Paris, bar none”
Reviews.Author: Hinkle
Reviews.Content: My wife and I revisited Paris after many years of being away. It was Christmas and we wanted a very special place to stay. We read reviews on Trip Advisor and couldn't bebleive a boutique hotel could have that many good reviews. We took and chance and are we ever glad we did! Our stay at Hotel Residence Foch was a dream! the staff was exceptional, the accomodations perfect, the breakfast awesome, the friendliness above reproach. It was nice to get back to Paris after so many years and staying at the Hotel Residence Foch was the higlight of the trip. You cannot go wrong staying here. Hinkle, Austin, Texas

Reviews.Title: “most welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: expattraveling
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 3 nights at this hotel. We were an odd group of travelers - 2 adults and 6 children ages 4-11. We had two family rooms, one on top of the other. The hotel is very welcoming and homey. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, although not terribly modern. The most extraordinary thing about this hotel though is the staff. Nelly, the owner, and Isabelle, who works reception, couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. They made every moment of our stay there lovely - and accepted our noisy kids with open arms. They made sure we always knew where we were going, had enough chocolate chaud, and truly seemed to care about our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in a great area of Paris”
Reviews.Author: jambo38
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an ideal location for the Arc De Triomphe in a quiet location. You would not think you were in the centre of Paris. The area feels safe and is close to the metro and the airport bus stop. On arrival at the hotel we were met by the delightful Nelly who has to be one of the most helpful hoteliers we have met. very jovial with a good understanding of English. We stopped in a deluxe room on the top floor which is highy recommended. The room was not large but had everything you needed including a corskcrew and glasses should you wish to have a bottle of wine on the balcony with a view of the top of the Eifel Tower. Breakfast was excellent. A gem of a hotel we would highly recomend it

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: yvonnefov
Reviews.Content: The hotel lived up to the great reviews. Good location, plenty of restaurants nearby Rooms were spotlessly clean and breakfast was fine-loved the egg boiler and the bread was fresh The enthusiasm of the staff to help us enjoy our stay and see the sights was exceptional We would certainly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jolanda
Reviews.Content: We love the small hotels. Hotel Foch is walking distance to many sights and also close to metro. The staff is excellent and so very friendly. The room was very comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice although a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: schnouk
Reviews.Content: I booked and stayed one night at this hotel after reading the trip advisor reviews. The non-smoking room was very large by Paris standards, clean, comfortable and well appointed. Staff at reception were friendly and helpful. Location is good to walk to the Eiffel tower, Arc de Triomphe, Champs Élysés and central tourist attractions; access to the métro is a short walk. Overall a very nice hotel in a quiet upscale residential arondissement of Paris. On the downside I found the price a little expensive, particularly the breakfast that, at 11 euros, is very basic. Also the floors creak and my upstairs neighbour reminded me of his/her presence a few times during the night. This being said it remains a very nice and welcoming hotel that would likely offer better value for money for families and groups or more than one or two to a room. Ian Davies

Reviews.Title: “Even better the second time!”
Reviews.Author: babs96
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from my second stay at Hotel Residence Foch, and once again I have nothing but wonderful things to say. The hotel is lovely, quiet, and close to the metro for easy access to all of the city's sights. With its warm, friendly staff and beautiful residential location my husband and I felt as if we were staying not at a hotel, but at the Paris apartment of good friends. While there are certainly many beautiful places to stay in paris, Residence Foch allows you to feel like a part of the city for just a little while...rather that simply a visitor. Thank you Nelly...we'll definitely be back again!

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: njshell74
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed in this lovely hotel from OCtober 6th to October 9th for our first anniversary. My husband was already in Europe on business and I chose to meet him in Paris for the last leg of his trip. The staff at the hotel could not have been more helpful or speak better English. We had a standard double room with a large bathroom that even included ample counter space. In Europe, bathroom counter space is few and far between. The bed was more like a queen than a double and was incredibly comfortable. We had the breakfast which was 11 euros/person but was well worth it for the convenience and the fact it was buffet. The location of the hotel is a quiet residential area but we were no more than a 5-10 minute walk to any metro stop, the Arc du Triumphe, and the Champs-Elysses. Hopefully, you'll have the opportunity to meet Nelly the owner. She's just wonderful and deserves all the good reviews that are found on this website. We can't wait to return to Paris and this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: RossE
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 4 nights from 24 September. This hotel lives up to all the positive reviews here. It is conveniently located in a quiet street in a classy residential area, about 15 minutes stroll from the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysées, and about 5 minutes walk from the Porte Maillot stop of the Air France airport shuttle bus, which is about 30 minutes from the airport. The staff at the Residence Foch are delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Giorich
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the residence foch for two nights from the 6th until the 8th of October. To book I’ve used the hotel’s website and everything went wonderfully smooth. Upon arrival the atmosphere was intimate and relaxed, we’ve received a great welcome from the owner, and he made sure that what was on his system was matching what we required. The room was very spacious (I booked a familiar room for my partner and I, which I really suggest in the end of the day its only 200 euros a night what can you get for that price in Paris just a few minutes walk from the arc de triomphe?) there was a small living room with a sofa, coffee table, a desk, the mini bar, and the kettle with coffee and tea (complimentary). Then there was a very good size bedroom with a king size bed (made of two large single bed together) a wardrobe a table and chair, chest drawers, a small TV, and a closet with an iron board, iron, safe, and more space for clothes and an extra pillow. People please remember it is a three star hotel don’t go mad and think it’s the top of luxurious decorations but this is the beauty of this place and for what you’ll be paying it is worth more. The staff at the front desk could have not been more helpful, everything I needed was done and every information I asked was true, honest and incredibly helpful. What else can I say… I am a platinum member of starwood hotels and I’ve never felt so relaxed in any of the luxurious hotels I’ve been like at the residence Foch. I really don’t see how any other hotel can offer a better service still giving you that warm feeling of no pressure like if you are in your own home. Thank you to all of you at the residence foch and see you soon

Reviews.Title: “Staying at Residence Foch? Read this.....”
Reviews.Author: BronD
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel...no 'city' noise at night ! We stayed at Residence Foch after reading review in the Daily Mail and Tripadvisor and booked as birthday treat for my partner. Hotel Lobby is lovely and the greeting was genuine and very warm...not what you expect in a large city! We stayed in room 10, which is very small but beautifully decorated.. A little more storage would have been nice...if you are travelling with more than one average size case you might struggle ! Bed lovely and comfy..for us as we like them firm...thought the two champagne flutes were a nice touch..iron & ironing board, air con, safe and hospitality tray. The bathroom was large in comparison and with good facilities...great shower, hairdryer, new sink area & lovley big miror etc..if I was going to be picky (which I am) the old tan tiles were dated though. It would have been good to have a little more info on checkin...no prices in the room for the goodies in the mini bar...but it did come in useful for storing some fab pate & cheese that we snacked on ! We booked breakfast - despite some negatives in the reviews...we thought it was fine..good coffee, breads, preserves, croissant, cereal, yoghurts, fruit, cheese and ham...you can boil your own eggs if you like! Not bad for 11 euros in comparison to cafe prices! Thanks to Isabelle for the tip on the restaurant nearby 'Bistro Saint Ferdinand'...33euro menu, 3 good courses inc good wine and coffee..try this one for sure..the Creme Brulee was amazing! The hotel stairways and stained glass windows on each floor are lovely...any other critisisms...well, minor ones...might have been nice if they had recognised my partners birthday as they knew it was a special occassion (the restaurant even managed to put a candle on his dessert and we only mentioned it in passing to a waiter !) getting ice was a a bit of a task...we couldnt have an ice bucket but was given a glass..but we had to bring it straight back and you are between two metro stations...take comfy shoes ! Other than that we would stay again... On Paris...take time out to have a beer or two at a pavement cafe and 'people watch'.. dont do the top floor of the Eiffel tower...massive q's up AND back down to 2nd floor and view not that much better..we did it thursday afternoon and we waited over 45 mins at the top! in fact 2nd floor is open and you get better pictures with Paris in the background...DO go back and see the tower at night! Do research on what you want to see at the Louvre and go EARLY...masses of tour groups make it a bit of a 'scrum' at times...there is SO much to see, trust us, make a plan before hand or you'll get fed up trying to find things! We bought the 5 euro headset tour...not worth it as so much not listed. NotreDame...amazing from outside...dingy and we felt a bit dissapointing inside...be brave and do the metro, get a 'Mobilis' ticket for the day (zone 1 & 2 under 6 euros). Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “A WEE GEM IN PARIS”
Reviews.Author: Caledoniantraveller
Reviews.Content: We ( 2 adults and 2 young children aged 4 and 8) stayed here from 22nd to 24th September 2006. Arrived very late at night as the flight was delayed. Found the hotel very easily. If you are using the Ryanair Beauvais flight the bus drops you 2 minutes away. Safe easy crossing of roads with kids as all had controlled pedestrian crossings. Night staff at hotel were first class. Just handed over the room keys and we were in. No complicated check-in, no fuss. Kids loved the tiny elevator to our family room on the 3rd floor. room was great, if a little dated. It was spotless, beds very comfy and bathroom was spotlessly clean, with bath and shower, loads of toiletries and mountains of soft white towels. Apart from the decor looking a wee bit twee, the room was perfect.This in no way should suggest that the room needed re-decorating however as it really was in first class condition. Interior of the hotel in general is very nice, no complaints at all. Very clean, fresh and well maintained and no lack of that French chic you're looking for. Overall, very stylish. Breakfast is served in the small dining room and staff on duty in the mornings were as friendly as you could get. None of the problems we were warned about for families arriving in France who speak very little French. Everyone at the hotel spoke perfect English and tolerated very well our pathetic attempts at speaking French. During our stay, it appeared that the guests were mainly Scottish and English, with a few French. This hotel really is as good as the reviews which led us to book it. The staff will happily recommend a local bar or restaurant and can advise you on everything from Metro times to the weather forecast. Kids did not find the hotel too formal or stuffy, in fact they were in love with the place from the start. The winding staircase to the rooms is classic French, adds charm to the hotel and is easier to manage if you have kids than the tiny elevator. Outside the Hotel you will find youself in a lovely narrow street, with tall buildings on either side with balconies bursting with colour from hanging baskets and window boxes full of red pelargoniums. Very nice and atmospheric. The Avenue de Malakoff is at the end of the street and there you have the Port Maillot Metro station which is your gateway to all of the sights in Paris. We were able to reach The Troccadero ( station nearest the Eiffel Tower) in a few minutes. The Metro is very safe and clean. It is constantly patrolled by Police and security staff but the feeling is far from oppressive, it's very relaxed. In fact the whole city centre feels the same way, safe and relaxed. No crowds of youngsters intimidating visitors here. Stepping out of the station onto the street, you turn a corner and the Eiffel Tower is there in front of you. You first view it from an elevated position and you will want to join the hundreds of others taking photo's. Take time to stand and stare. Spectacular. Forget those who say anything negative about this. It is stunning, especially at night when it is illuminated. Don't go at weekends during the day or you'll queue for hours. Of course you can take the stairs but how many kids want to walk up an open air staircase to the hieght of a high rise flat? Instead, try what we did. We got up early on Sunday morning and got to the tower for opening time at 9 AM. ( just a few stops on the Metro) We got straight onto the lifts, and enjoyed a much more leisurely trip, no crushing crowds to scare the kids. Level 2 was high enough for them and saved waiting on a lift to the top. Antther highly reccomended sightseeing trip is the Batobus (a riverboat/bus) which you get from the Eiffel Tower. Costs only a few Euro's and is well worth it.The journey is worth it by itself and is another chance to rest up without stopping. Glass covered, the boats are ideal in all weather. We were lucky with hot sunshine so the creww opened up the roof for ventilation. take a camera!!! There are other similar boats run by other companies but they are generally much larger and a bit pretentious. The Batobus is fine. You can hop on and off at any or all of the 8 stops on the Seinne. Given that these include Notre Dame and the Louvre you will want to get off and explore. Take time to sit in one of the many outdoor cafe's and have a drink or a spot of lunch. It will give you a chance to recharge you batteries.Our 2 loved the freshly made crepes with chocolate, messy but a lot of fun!! All of the cafe's we went to welcomed kids and without exception the French people were warm,friendly and helpful. Kids weren't bored at all as there was plenty going on for everyone. Street shows of music/dancing/ rollerblading etc kept them amused while we took in the sights. The kids were as sad to leave as we were. Back to the Hotel, for a shower and a change of clothes we relaxed in the small bar with a drink. Kids were welcome there too with none of the dissaproving frowns you can get from staff at some Hotels. Checkout is fast and efficient and you'll walk out of the door onto Rue Marbeau with a sigh, vowing to return soon. This place is that good. Are there better hotels,of course there are but the beauty of this place is that it has a value greater than can be measured by the wee ticked boxes of facilities. The whole experience of staying at this hotel is that you are an individual. Stay at the Hilton if you like and you'll be just another number. Stay at the Residence Foch and you will feel at home, among friendly staff in very nice surroundings. Book it now!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rokh
Reviews.Content: We (family of 5) stayed at Residence Foch in early August 2006 for one night. It certainly deserves all the praises it has received on this site. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful: Nellie helped us in finding places, locating parking sites nearby,... The room (a family room) was very clean and comfi. WiFi internet access is available (you have to pay)...Air condition...cosy location ... When we arrived (August 1, 2006), this hotel had just jumped up to #1 spot on the TripAdvisor list. We could see how genuinely happy Nellie feels: an indication of how the hotel staff value the customers' views. The only drawback: if you're travelling by car, finding a parking spot, or garage, can be a headache: I had to circle around for about 30 min before I found a spot in another street near the hotel. But of course, this is not a fault of the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & staff”
Reviews.Author: Magere1_2
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 rooms for 5 nights. Greeting upon arrival by Nelly who took the time to direct us to local restaurants (YUM!) and suggest the best places to visit in Paris and cheapest modes of transport. Rooms, airconditioned, whilst smallish were very comfortable as were beds. Breakfast, extra, were always excellent. Highly recommend this hotel. Will stay there next time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “super hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eric92
Reviews.Content: I have booked this hotel for a customer visiting us in Paris who needed a convenient location near the business district with free wireless access and a good price quality ratio. I was very happy with the overall service (yes, "nelly is great"), rooms are very quiet, cosy and quite comfortable and I will book again for my other customers.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: lmwilkins
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Residence foch for 3 nights in Aug 2006. We had a brilliant time in pairs. The staff were welcoming and friendly telling us where the local RER and Metro stations were and how to get the various attractions around paris. The rooms were well kept and very clean. The bathrooms were spacious. The breakfasts were simple but lovely. Overall I recommend this hotel. I have stayed in Paris a few times and this was great value for money. We booked through a website that was offering 3 nights for the price of two! excellent!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: Juraexpat
Reviews.Content: Buyer beware! We had contacted the hotel directly via email - exchanged several very nice emails. Very friendly. When we went to check in, they did not have our reservations. When they finally checked their email records, they found it, and admitted that we did have reservations. They just could not understand why they didn't have the reservation, and they were full. They called around and found us another hotel. Much further away, not as nice, and a big disappointment. No offer of a free night some other time, or to pay for our room at the other hotel. When the receptionist was looking for our reservations, it became clear that they had a very archaic system for tracking reservations. If you're coming from far away for a once-in-a-lifetime stay in Paris, you might want to pass on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mader
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough good things about Residence Foch, the staff and especially the owner, Nelly. I used the reviews on travel advisor to book our hotels throughout Europe and am so so pleased with the choices we made. Residence Foch is a fantastic hotel for those who prefer a small intimate hotel compared to the large institutional hotels. The hotel is very very clean, which is extremely important to me, and the rooms were just right. Nelly and her staff went out of their way to help us plan our days in Paris which included things that as tourists (who don't speak French) we would never have known about. Thank you so so much for everything. My two childern, ages 16 and 17 just loved it too especially since Nelly has a free laptop to use in the lobby. This is a great benefit as you can check email from home etc. Thanks again and I hope to see you again in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Hotel – Don’t Miss”
Reviews.Author: BoulderCanyon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly magical. However, don’t expect to stroll in and be stunned by a grand entrance or gloriously appointed rooms. That is not why the hotel is ranked so highly, a ranking it absolutely deserves. This hotel is very comfortable and radiates a welcome; like you just arrived home from a long time away. I believe the Residence Foch has such great reviews because they have the most fabulous staff that you may ever encounter at a hotel. Nelly the owner is wonderful, she makes you feel like family, old friends. We began our Europe trip in Paris, here at this hotel, and returned two weeks later. Our twins who are eight, while we were riding the train through Switzerland on our way back to Paris asked where we were staying in Paris, I said “with Nelly” they beamed a smile that said it all. A lot about business and life can be learned from a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “"KEEP THIS HUSH , HUSH, DON'T TELL ANYONE"”
Reviews.Author: FIRNATINE
Reviews.Content: Our experience at this hotel was excellent. Nelly and the staff are the best (friendly, warm and professional). The Foch’s location is in a nice quite neighborhood close to transportation. The hotel is very clean with good facilities (especially the A/C, it was hot hot, hot when we stayed in Paris). The breakfast was perfect (all fresh) and reasonably priced. We spoke very little French but did not have any problem communicating with the hotel staff who spoke fluent English. Anytime we needed help with directions or ordering food the Parisians went out of their way to assist us. Everyone was very friendly, warm and polite. We only had a couple of days to spend in Paris (not enough to see all the sights) but will definitely return soon. We hope to be able to stay at Hotel Residence Foch for our extended stay. Therefore, hush, hush and keep this review quite or we will not be able to return to THE FOCH. The “trip advisor” was a huge help in picking out accommodations that fit into our budgetary needs.Ps: It is still hotter in Florida

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the Best!”
Reviews.Author: Victorious
Reviews.Content: Paris was the last leg of a 17 day France trip for my husband and me. What a fantastic way to end our trip with a stay at The Residence Foch. I discovered this hotel on Trip Advisor and all the reviews I read were right on the money. Nelly, hotel owner, and her staff, Jean Louis, Hedi and Slim were so friendly and helpful with everything from restaurant recommendations to booking tours, etc. The moment we walked into the hotel and Jean Louis greeted us we knew we were going to have a great stay. We have traveled the world several times and have never met a more accommodating group of people. The breakfast was fresh and wonderful. While there is no restaurant in the hotel it was not a problem if we didn't want to travel out to eat after a day of sightseeing. There are over 30 very good restaurant menus available for delivery to your room. Hedi assisted us with an order of Indian food that was fantastic.
