The hotel is close to the Arc and the Metro in a very safe neighborhood. A return visit to The Residence Foch is definitely in our travel plans. Rochelle Thuener

Reviews.Title: “Nelly is the best”
Reviews.Author: TravelerFour
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay at the Hotel Residence Foch. I chose the hotel based on the reviews posted on TripAdvisor. The best thing about the hotel is Nelly, the owner. She was warm, gracious and extremely helpful. She made getting around the city easy by providing detailed directions and maps and making suggestions for lunch and dinner. The hotel is more bed and breakfast with the warmth, comfort and familiarity of a rooming house. We stayed in a Family room (#40) which had a queen bed in one room and two twin beds in the other room which could be closed off by a curtain. We were able to open the large windows and enjoy the Parisian way of life. The rooms were well lite and there were plenty of mirrors. My children loved the size and decor of the rooms. The bathroom was large with a tub/shower combination. There was mildew above one wall above the shower. Also, after noticing that our sheets had not be changed, I left housekeeping a note requesting that the sheets be changed daily. You might also have to request washcloths. Nelly says they do use them in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A great little find”
Reviews.Author: drdkc
Reviews.Content: Once again, thank you tripadvisor members for taking the time to write about places that make your trips memorable. The Hotel Residence Foch did not disappoint. The staff is friendly, and welcoming. The rooms are clean and quaint, and the hotel is in a safe and great location, close to the metro and a short walk to the Arc de Triomphe. We had a family room, which had a queen bed and two twin beds, separated by a curtain, should you choose to close it. It was very hot in Paris and the airconditioning was a welcome relief. This hotel can be described as more of a bed and breakfast, as a boutique hotel might conjure up thoughts of upscale and designer. This little gem is just that. A quiet, charming, and cozy place to hang your beret while in beautiful Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Another happy customer”
Reviews.Author: Napajb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from six nights at Hotel Residence Foch and we couldn't agree more with the positive reviews posted. Residence Foch, located a block from the Bois de Bologne, is the type of charming little hotel of a bygone era - the hotel is in a beautiful and wonderfully maintained old building and the rooms are homey, not ostentatious, with a personal feeling to them. I had requested a room on an upper floor facing the street and this is exactly what we got -- in addition our room (# 62) had a huge balcony with a little table and chairs and a view of the very top of the Eiffel Tower. The bathroom in our room was smaller than most (no bathtub), but it was worth the sacrafice to have the balcony. Breakfast, which came with our room rate, consisted of croissants, pain au chocate, rolls, fresh fruit salad, a choice of cheeses and meats, cereal, yogurt, juice, and tea or coffee. We brought our selection upstairs on a tray and ate out on the balcony, which was lovely. The rooms have air conditioning (essential in the summer!), safes, a mini-fridge, a hot water pot with tea and coffee makings, a small TV, slippers and hair dryers (no clock), and there is free internet access in the lobby. The bed was queen sized and very comfortable and the shower had excellent water pressure. The only down side of the room was that the floors squeaked a bit and the walls are a bit thin so you could hear a little noise from adjacent rooms. The staff was unparalled in terms of friendliness and helpfulness (and they do all speak excellent english) as previous reviews have touted - thank you to Nelly, Jean-Louis and Eddy for making us feel so at home. The location is quiet but within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower (where you can pick up a cruise on the Seine) and the Arc de Triomphe, close to the metro and the RER, and a few good restaurant and shopping streets close by. The buildings on the Rue Marbeau are beautiful and give you the feel of a real Paris neighborhood, albeit a fairly ritzy one. It is true that if you want to stay in the middle of all the action, this is not the place for you. It is also true that if you are looking for a high-end hotel experience, you might not be happy here. But if you are looking for a lovely, welcoming place to stay in Paris with old world charm, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!!”
Reviews.Author: Ansar_Hassan
Reviews.Content: Thank you tripadvisor.com!! Nelly and her staff at the Hotel Residence Foch put forth their best effort to ensure that your stay in Paris is a memorable one. The Foch has many worthy attributes. 1. Well-located - The area in which the Foch is located is safe, quiet, and walking-friendly. It is close to two metro/RER stations and is less than a 20 minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe and Eiffel Tower. 2. Excellent staff - Nelly et al are awesome!! They are super friendly and extremely helpful. It is this alone that makes the Foch an absolute must. 3. Decor - The rooms are "cute", the bathrooms are of excellent quality (Westerners will appreciate the shower/bath), and the furniture is very comfortable. Our room (#10) at times was a little musty-smelling (my only complaint) but this was hardly an inconvenience. 4. Breakfast - If not included in your deal, it may be worthwhile including for at least a day, as it is truly Paris, sitting in a small area, eating croissants and drinking coffee with steamed milkers. I cannot say enough, but I will end by saying that the Foch was everything I expected it would be and more. I would definitely stay here again upon my next, eagerly awaited return to Paris. Congrats on being #1 on tripadvisor.com.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SenaW
Reviews.Content: Location is terrific - lots of good restaurants - two metro lines - and you can walk to the Arc d'Triumph. Our room was on the top floor with a balcony and all the amenities were good. What makes this hotel special however, is Nelly- who greets you with a smile and is always ready to accommodate your needs. If you are coming to or from the airport, ask her about the shuttle service which was 36 euros (for two) and took us door to door.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: lookforward
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Residence Foch. We prefer smaller, boutique type hotels over large resort types. Lovely room overlooking a courtyard garden. New bedding, quiet, comfortable. It is located on a quiet block in an area with embassies. Convenient to 2 metro stops. Arc de Triomphe is within walking distance. Owner was extremely friendly, helpful with directions, maps and dinner recommendations. Nice breakfast with soft boiled eggs guests can prepare. A great start to our 2 week Paris/Italy vacation. My only regret is not staying here on the last leg of our trip. We had booked another hotel in another area and were disappointed. If we get the chance to return to Paris we will definitely stay here.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Residence Foch
HotelInfo.Address: 10 rue Marbeau, 75116 Paris, France
